Un mini GTA roguelike ? ... si algo asi.
Cada nivel es un pedazo de ciudad creado aleatoriamente, tenemos que cumplir misiones para pasar los niveles.

El juego parece simple, pero entre el contenido de items, armas, personajes, poder comprar habilidades o modificadores de partida, buscar recompensas y todo esto en ciudades que se crean aleatoriamente, hace que sea infinito en horas de juego.

38643655.review:
Streets of Rogue is another weird game that doesn’t have any obvious peers. In short, I’d say it’s a mash-up of “roguelike elements” and class-based RPGs; While combat is certainly a big part of the game’s mechanics, you can actually make it through the game without firing a shot, punching a person, or getting in any other sort of trouble. Choosing from many members of a motley crew of strange bedfellows, your goal is to climb the city... tower... thing to kill the mayor (or something like that). You do this by accomplishing missions on each floor, ranging from “neutralize this target” to “free this prisoner” to “blow up this entire building” and then some.

Where this gets a little nuts is in the execution. Every character has their own unique attributes. The Hacker, for example, can both interact with electronics at range and access additional options on them that other people can’t. The Soldier is very good with guns, starts with several, and even has a slight jab at regenerating health with their Modern Warfarer perk. The Cop gets handcuffs that can incapacitate anybody from behind, but also gets penalized for harming or cuffing innocents. In this regard your choice of character can radically impact how the game flows, although to be entirely honest, trying to play with others typically devolves into a “smash and grab” playstyle rather quickly. Speaking of which, the online play works surprisingly well for a title with this kind of budget, but there have definitely been some hiccups here and there (most of which were fixed a patch or two later).

My primary critique comes from Streets of Rogue still being a work in progress. More-or-less weekly patches typically either add major overhauls, items, entirely new sections of the game to progress through, and/or new characters to fool around with. That’s definitely a good thing. What’s less encouraging is that sometimes there isn’t quite a method to the madness. While communication has always been focused upon heavily both ways, there are still a few weak links in the game itself, and the biggest one is how it tries (or fails, really) to explain new mechanics. The first time you run into something new, you are almost definitely going to die or be seriously inconvenienced by it, and the exact usage of a few items isn’t made clear until risky experimentation or seeing somebody else use them well happens before your eyes. If you can tolerate that, it’s definitely worth checking out.

38606234.review:
非常有趣的一款roguelike游戏，不同于一般的roguelike类游戏的突突突和考验操作，这款游戏的每个关卡更像是一个个的谜题组成的。你可以选择暴力突进（战士，猩猩，僵尸，摔跤手等等）你也可以悄悄的潜入或者爆人菊花（医生，刺客），你更可以长袖善舞，利用自己的手下和交谈让他们自相残杀解决问题（店主，银行家，笑星，奴隶主，酒保）各种各样的解法，几乎每个角色都有自己不一样的地方，特别是在更新了一个红色的贩卖机后（可以买到自己的初始物品）后，小偷也就有了用武之地（虽然会出现用了几十块钱的道具打开保险柜一看只有五块钱）
每个大关拥有的特色也是完全不一样，第一关贫民区里头到处都是混混，毒贩，小偷明目张胆的走着。第二关工业区有着各种明显的陷阱，以及各种火焰，爆炸。第三关公园区就是各种异类的聚集区，猩猩，食人者，吸血鬼等等你都可以在这里发现（其实我一直蛮期待在砍一个人的时候对方变身狼人或者是一个小不点溜走）还有战士的营地。第四关商业区，秩序明显更加完善，小偷只能从下水道里蹦出来偷你东西（我一开始以为下水道能走就蹦了进去23333）警察与黑帮在大街上巡逻着（黑帮似乎交了一次保护费后就不会骚扰你了？）还有没有面包为什么不吃蛋糕的贵族阶级，以及会从警亭里面钻出来的超级警察。
不过现在仍然有一些bug，在公园区的时候刺客有时候明明附近什么人都没有，甚至躲在小房间里仍然无法隐身。摔跤手有时候拿起东西的时候丢完了东西还在手上，然后就拿不了别的东西了。不过尽管有些瑕疵，这款游戏依旧给我带来了极大的乐趣，一个电脑几个人玩也是十分有趣。十分期待制作组更新出来的新人物，新地图以及新玩法。

38559415.review:
TL;DR - A very fun fasted paced beat'em up type game. Very similar to nuclear throne, in the way that it is a single run that you must complete, and there are 20+ different characters to choose from all with different abilities. Fun light-hearted game; I highly recommend it. 8/10

The game is set in a city that is built vertically where the mayor has taken over. There are many different levels, starting from the slum, to the very top which I think is like the mayor's house and such (I am not sure, I haven't gotten that far yet). You are a part of the resistance, a group fighting for the freedom of the city. When you start, you must fight or sneak your way through each level to progress. You will be given missions on each level, but as far as I can see you don't need to complete them, I believe you just need to make it to the other side and reach the elevator. There are lots of characters to choose from, each offering different starting items, and abilities. The gameplay in streets of rogue is simple but also a lot of fun to play. It isn't very difficult to learn, but I can already see there is a lot of room for you to get better. This game is still in alpha, so we can expect to see lots of more content updates. I would recommend this game to basically anyone, because it offers great singleplay, co-op and multiplayer. $14.99 is a great price for this game, so if it goes on sale, I would diffinitely take it. 8/10

38399638.review:
I don't normally do reviews, but I'm gonna for this one.

So this game is a tactical roguelike set in the neon dystopia of the far future. Your character, whichever one you pick, is on a mission, and it's up to you how you want to complete your mission. I've got 10 hours on record, to give you an idea of how much I've played so far.

You can hack your way to victory, create numerous zombie apocalypses (very powerful, suprisingly hard to pull off at times), escape your life as a gorilla being kept in a lab and seek your revenge against the scientests who created and tormented you, or just kick it with your gang members. There are way more characters to play than that, but it gives you an idea of some of the options available to you.

This game is deceptive. You might get a gun and then troll around the place slaying everyone who looks at you funny so you can steal their ham sandwitches, but very very quickly things can go horrificly wrong, and what started off as a simple mugging has now turned into a zone-wide police hunt that you are not gonna win, unless you "deal with" every law enforcement officer on the map. xD

I can't wait for this game to be finished. I've enjoyed everything very much, the dev in charge of the game even responded to me bugging him on twitter to say "I had fun, thanks!" and I've had about 2 updates since I got the game (which was in the Halloween sale).

I can see so much potential with the game. It's so cyberpunk in places and so unapolagetic about it. ATM I'd say the game is a tiny bit shallow in terms of length, but that's Early Access for you. I've still replayed it quite a lot, and most of the time I don't survive long enough to get to the final zone. I'm too busy causing chaos and getting myself killed. :D

38290627.review:
[h1] ROGUELITE IN THE STREETS, RPG IN THE SHEETS [/h1]

Streets of Rogue is a surprisingly deep Rogue-lite action RPG with a tongue-in-cheek sense of humor, cute pixel graphics, and a stellar retro soundtrack. For a game in Early Access, it has a surprising amount of polish and a rather complete feel. 

[url=https://youtu.be/QYsim83seVY] Check out FIRST IMPRESSIONS on the 2 Headed Hero YouTube Channel HERE. [/url]

Abundant character options, achievement-based unlocks, and an astounding wealth of weapons and items are par for the course here, and SoR's unique approach to tiny, linked, open levels with randomized layouts and objectives works in its favor to create quite an excellent "anytime" game. The coop mode alone is worth the price of EA admission, and while not perfect, the netcode seems very serviceable and functional. Occasional bugs and crashes are rare, but expected from an unfinished product - we found them to be nearly a non-issue. 

Although still in early access and in need of development, Streets of Rogue is blessed with an attentive dev and continual updates. 

I've had such a blast with my 10+ hours of gameplay, and eagerly await updates. Highly recommended.

38103768.review:
技术比较差，大概花了15个小时才全成就，赶过来写测评哈哈哈~
在某菊的视频里入坑的，这个气人主播，看得我好气啊，气得我赶紧买来自己玩算了！

起先看中了联机功能，不管是建立房间还是加入游戏都比较方便，可能加入游戏的会有一些延迟，不过我的体验是觉得延迟还可以接受。
画面就是像素风嘛，画质天花板比较低，不过本作色彩鲜艳，配合游戏里血腥的爆爆爆和炸弹的渣渣渣，以及不错的光影效果，视觉感很棒。
玩法上是传统的roguelike，开局一把西瓜刀，装备全靠捡2333，通过在游戏里完成任务、开箱子、杀人来取得装备和金钱还有经验，钱可以用来买装备，毒品，食物，弹药，酒，奴隶。。。还可以用来克隆（包括武器和自己2333）。经验够了就可以升级，升级最明显的就是瞬间满血（混战中奋斗至丝血，临死前突然杀了一个人然后升级满血免于一死的大起大落是真的刺激），并且可以在本关结束时从三个随机技能里选择一个，其余的对于属性并没有影响（除了第一个初始人物贫民区居民）。
在升级或者完成游戏里随机出现的金色大M任务（没错，就是金拱门）会给与鸡腿，可以在大本营里解锁各种奖励，突变，技能，以供在之后的游戏里使用，最近官方还更新了奖励池的修改，不过解锁全收集并没有成就可以拿就是了。
一共有23个游戏人物，除了一开始的几个，其余的都是靠成就解锁，不过解锁难度都不大，其中我个人很喜欢的是黑客（各种远程控制电视机爆炸，空气过滤器放毒气，冰箱突突突，停电，帅得一逼），刺客（隐身加背刺，谁用谁知道），医生（游戏里，用乙醚晕倒的人按照击杀结算任务）以及变性人（我觉得这个人物还有很多可以挖掘的地方，但是由于这个人在未附身以前弱得和鸡仔一样，且不能被警察看见，所以刚出生的时候特别弱，但是附身的玩法真的很有意思，假如，让你取得某个道具，你只需要附身这个人的同盟者，直接问他要就行了，反正就各种不当自己外人，可能还有很多创意的玩法，待各位一起挖掘~），比较偏向LYB的玩法，能不肛正面就不肛哈哈哈。
现在可以自定义人物，可以从已经解锁的任务以及奖励里选择想要的，不过如果想用自定义人物解锁成绩和其他官方人物的话，增减点数要在20以内，不同技能天赋物品都是自己的增减点数，总的来说就是越imba越贵啦，官方肯定是希望大家自定义人物，不是创造一个god，而是创造一个有特色的，有长处有缺点的人物啦。
感觉bgm的话还是比较单调的，一共就两首，平时一首，突变时一首，希望制作组以后更新的话能给每个场景单独配上bgm。
现在一共有四个大关卡，贫民区工业区公园商业区，住宅区正在制作中，希望制作组之后能添加更多的官方人物和地图。期待！

个人的一些小心得：
1.黑客hack其他的电器时，站在另外一个建筑物内并且关上门，就不会被发现。
2.医生的迷倒虽然在任务的完成上判定的是击杀，但是在成就解锁上，击杀就是指打死，医生的迷倒并不算。
3.遇见突变是机器人追杀时不用慌，机器人走得非常慢，弹道也慢，攻击cd也慢，所以只要足够灵活，走位可解。
4.变性人的附身技能，在脱出后有5秒cd，且被附身的人在脱出后会眩晕7秒左右，期间是变性人最脆弱的时候。除此之外，被附身的人在脱出后，会不停寻找变性人并攻击，不过在附身其他人以后仇恨就没了。而且在室外脱出，进入建筑室内并关上门的话，被附身的人就找不到变性人了（但变性人不受店主欢迎，会被商店店主驱赶）


嗯就酱。全成就完结删游戏~等以后更新了新内容再来玩然后更新这个测评~

First of all, I can't get over how fun this game is. Let me explain.

Streets of Rogue is a game in which you can become one of many random, but interestingly fun, characters.

You can then play the game whichever way you want; you can sneak, fight, speedrun, your way though a selection of diferent floors with increasing difficulty and content.

This is game is by far one, if not the, funest game I have ever played. The fact that it is so realisticly random makes it very entertaining. It is worth every penny I spent.

The developpers are also full of imagination and seem to have plenty of new features to add. They also seem to listen to the public's advice.

Kepp it up, I LOVE this game.

37860818.review:
This game is just plain fun!  The player has so much freedom in how to progress in the game.  Essentially there are a few mini objectives to complete in each level, such as destroying a generator, neutralizing a character, or collecting an item.  Naturally there will often be those who get in the way of these objectives to make it harder to complete them.  Now the fun part is determining how to go about accomplishing those objectives; do you use the assassin and cloak yourself and sneak around to backstab people without being caught?  Do you use the doctor to knock somebody out from behind with chloroform?  Do you use the zombie and just infect everyone you see?  You have so many choices on how to go about it, and they also allow you to finish the same objective in numerous different ways, like you can knock on windows to distract or confuse people, turn off power or computers in order to avoid traps, or you can use items or hire people to create diversions.  Choises definitely matter (which is why I nominated it for that category in the Steam Awards for 2017) and make the game so much more fun since it keeps it feeling fresh and new every single time.

Additionally, the game presents randomization with the levels so the maps will always be different, the objectives will be different, and the things you interact with will be different.  That adds a lot to the replayability of the game.  Multiplayer works well with this game and adds even more depth to it, since players can do their own thing in order to accomplish the goals away from each other or they can team up and utilize their specific class' traits to compliment the abilities of each other.

It is fantastic that the developer is updating this game frequently and regularly--there is a lot to do already but this is the type of game that can be expanded upon with the new content that gets added.  I can only imagine what sort of new enemies, new player classes, new items, new missions, etc. will be added as time goes on.  I highly recommend this game.

37819610.review: Avec un début prometteur, Streets of Rogue nous plonge dans un jeu où la diversité et le choix sont au coeur du gameplay. De nombreux personnages jouables sont proposés et ont chacun leurs atouts, changeant de façon nette la façon d'apréhender les différentes situations de jeu. 37780152.review:
A great, silly game that barely takes itself seriously, but for how hectic some encounters can be, and how much control you have over most situations, this game is a seriously solid top-down beat-em-up. From my single player experience, it's well worth it on-sale, and might be worth full price if I had someone to share the game with.

But the game is still Early Access, and (personally) lacking so much more content to make the replayability of the game that much more fulfilling. At the moment, the base game is not complete (there are 3 stages, each stage comes with 3 levels), and they are all fairly simply generated. But no bugs or awful mishaps from random generation! 

Take from from it what you will. 100% would recommend following the game for updates, and jumping in when you feel the water's warm enough for ya.

37771826.review:
I'm more surprised that I bought this game cause it looked "kinda cool" and somehow coined over 50 hours on it. I'm sure a lot of the people who played this game are just waiting for it to be finished. 

The tags Matt gave for this game are pretty accurate. There's a ton of stuff you can do in this game and you can do it *your way*. From sneaking into a hideout to press buttons to straight up going in and shoot everyone with a rocket launcher, this game truly lets you do what you want to do.

A couple of friends of mine instantly got hooked when they started playing co-op with me, saying that they'd buy the game when they get the chance. Now that right there, is something I have to commend.

Overall, Streets of Rogue is a open world game where you complete missions ~or fail them~. to get to next stage. The levels are randomly generated, so the experience will never be the same ~unless you're doing the daily runs~. You're free to do whatever you want to do on each level, there are almost no restrictions. The game is frequently monitored by its community and developer, so updates are something to be expected.

7/10
+ Freedom in levels
+ Diverse set of characters varying your playstyle
+ Coop makes the game even better
-  Music slowly gets boring ~if you die a thousand times~
-  Most NPCs should do more than just say "Whatchu want?"

37726267.review:
Early access done right. The game feels and looks good, even in this development stage there's a decent amount of content. I've just finished a playsession of about 7 hours and the experience was smooth and fun. I particularly like that there's a bunch of different playstyles/perks available in the form of different (unlockable) characters. This offers good replay value and plenty of ways to burn it all down to the gro... I mean *ahem*... experiment... plenty of ways to experiment! There's also a permaprogress system in place so you can gradually unlock more perks/weapons/items and playsettings to use during new runs. Multiplayer seemed to work fine and working together adds more ways to tackle the challenges (or eachother...) as opposed to solo play...

Only stumbled upon one little bug, sometimes the change appearance menu arrows wouldn't work for me when editing a character, or the item menu wouldn't let me move around in it. Both the menu's were sort of stuck... usually reopening the menu would solve the issue however, once I had to restart the run for it to react again. [spoiler]Also I'm not sure whether not being able to e.g. chloroform people with their backs against the wall was intented, but I noticed there's some npc's that I couldn't reach with the 'magic handkerchief' or similar specials like bloodsucking.[/spoiler]

Anyway, well worth it so far, glad I got it! Really looking forward to more content being developed and released.

Keep it up! Nominated for the choices matter award!

Take care and have fun!

37657426.review:
TL;DR: Right now this is a promising EarlyAccess and after buying it for half the price I have no doubt, it could be worth paying full price, if they continue on this path. This could already be a full game, for a lower price, but I have high hopes, this will be seen to the end.

Graphics:
Simple, pixely and totally what this game needs. No problems with fps, normal options for monitor resolutions and charming visuals.

Gameplay:
At the start of each level, you will get several targets you have to fullfill: Neutralize someone, get an item or switch some switches, etc. . For each of these targets you have several options how to do them dependent on the items you have, you can acquire in the level and the character you chose. This creates, for such a seemingly simple game, a great amount of options to get what you want. If you run around as a thief, stealing the living bejeesus out of everyone or become a gorilla, smashing stuff, you will surely find the character fit for you. Unlocking those characters is also not that hard and no problem and will be done without any special currency, only with actions within the game (ex. drink 10 alcoholic beverages in one run for the bartender).
On top of this you have permadeath and you unlock new talents and objects through their specially integrated currency "Chicken Nuggets". But do not worry, even on failed runs, if you do as much as you can, you get enough to upgrade at least a thing or two. Always do the missions from "Big M", a drug dealer. Normal objective, 5 nuggets as reward.

EarlyAccess (Spoilers):
This game right now already has so many options but I hope many more will come. Right now the game ends after completing Slums, Industrial, Park and Downtown, I think (4 level types and three levels in each category makes for a total of 12 maps per game and all of those are randomly generated). I only have done it once so forgive me, if I have left out one level type.
Right now you can see quite clearly the randomly generated nature of the levels with walls without purpose and strange setups for everything. Still, the game is very enjoyable and this does not in any way destroy the way to play the game. You always have a path to your objectives and can always complete them (as far as I know; 10 hours of playing at the time of writing).

Verdict:
If you are unsure about EarlyAccess, maybe give this game a go at a discount. I found it highly enjoyable and charming and do not regret buying it.

Заплати охраннику,  чтобы он не обращал внимания на то как ты подрываешь здания и пи*дишь стариков в туалете вместе с гориллой.
Взломать холодильник и заставить его вбежать в квариру соседа?
Сьесть банан, кинуть кожуру чтобы опрокинуть противника, но убегая самому на ней подскользнуться?
Натравить стаю бомжей на наркодиллера?
Получить пи*ды от трех бандитов за то что ты нанял телохранителя из другой банды?
Клонировать себя?
Взломать телевизор в чьей-то квартире и заставить его орать так громко, что соседи начнут долбиться в кваритру и отпиздят владельца этого телевизора? (или же он их, просто за то что они зашли в его квартиру)
Если хочешь уничтожь все что движется, если хочешь пройди уровень без единого убийства!
В городе зомби-апокалипсис? Тебе нужно кого-то убить, но ты слишком добр для этого? Просто приведи туда всех этих зомби и оставь развлекаться!
Это и много, много всего другого можно найти в этой игре, оправдала все ожидания!

37402714.review:
What can I say about Streets of Rogue to someone unacquainted with it?

It's without a doubt, a better than I expected game, it provides a comedic, action-filled romp across a Dystopia, with an active development, and innumerable amount of opportunities to exploit and explore. The standard characters are well augmented by a decent unlock system for items and traits.

Items being utilities or weapons you can find and unlock as either custom character equipment or as mission rewards that cost nuggets (the form of meta-progression system in this game). This goes for traits too, while characters provide good combinations of these traits and trade-offs, like the Gorilla being mega strong and tanky, but lacking the vocal cords to speak english. Characters themselves require the player to achieve goals or challenges to unlock them. Such as destroying graves to unlock the Vampire, freeing a certain amount of Gorillas to unlock the Gorilla, etc.

Overall, I gave this game the "Even Better Than I Expected" award for 2017, overall I wish to see this game make it to release, and I hope that tinyBuild continues to improve and create new content.

tl;dr Much approved, much loved, and needs more attention to it.

37398873.review:
This... is how to make a sandbox game.
Enough rules to make the game work, and enough freedom that you can do anything in any way possible.
So, you need to get to a safe, but it's guarded by a laser. What do you do?
Explode everything with machineguns? 
Sneak around using the ninja?
 Hack the security system?
Create an army of hyper intelligent horse people to create a giant cabbage robot to distract some scientists and then sneak in their lab to go back in time to make the safe never exist in the first place?!?!?!?
Sadly the last one isn't possible (Yet)
But this game allows for so much creativity, PLEASE; even if you don't like rogues, give this one a shot.

37342688.review:
[i]Streets of Rogue uses it's interconnected systems and interactions to create a simulation where role-playing means more than statistics and numbers.[/i]

The game has dozens of classes to choose from, each of which having unique traits, weapons, and mechanics that effect themselves, other characters, objects, and the environment. These classes also make up the NPCs, turning the levels into small simulations of a dystopian cyberpunk city. Everybody plays a role in these city blocks, including the player.
On top of that, the in-depth class creation system allows for even more possibilities.

There's also online and local co-op for up to four players, both of which work great.

Check this game out, it's rad.

37256928.review:
I'm an admitted fan of both "rogue-likes" and "rogue-lites."  I'm not entirely sure which category this falls into, and I love it. The combination of permadeath with the progression of unlocking new character types and rewards works well. Each character you start feels like it's got the same chance of success as your first character, but there's still a sense of forward movement. That it approaches the genre from a more modern perspective perspective, rather than the traditional fantasy tropes is an added bonus.

There are a few character types which can be a bit overpowered, but, as an Early Access title, I'm sure those balance issues will be resolved eventually... And even the OP characters on one map may be at a severe disadvantage on the very next level.

37243307.review:
Streets of Rogue is a great example of an Early Access game. It was a fun, "full" experience when I got it months ago. It's only gotten better and better in the months since. It's a game that welcomes a lot of approaches to solving problems with a ton of classes to choose from as well as a make your own class feature. If a shopkeeper holds an item you need for a mission you can: Bribe him, Threaten him, Shoot him, hire local gang members to kill him, lay a time bomb outside his shop and blow the whole thing up with him inside, etc. etc.

Recently I've found playing with the "Zombie everywhere" mutator active has made it a whole new game. I'm going to be playing this game on and off for a very long time.

37087196.review: 额，这是我第一次撰写steam评测有点小紧张哈。这个游戏这个游戏我玩了100多小时游戏中的许多套路也都很了解了。自己最喜欢玩医生这个角色，前期最容易收集装备。这个游戏最容易通关方式就是，买巨人药水233.这个游戏的缺点我还是提一下。部分时候npc的仇恨还是出bug有时候酒保突然就和你敌对了部分角色还是太费，比如小偷，僵尸，运动员这些在执行任务时太容易出现意外情况，而且不容易收集物品要么翻车损失大，要么根本没法收集。这个游戏经济还是很重要的。像我玩医生4关过去最多打到过4000块钱。杀戮机器人也不是不可战胜的。前期多鉴定注射器，然后用隐身和巨人把机器人打落地图边缘（这游戏地图边缘是一个悬崖）打掉后就可以安心收集道具了。如果没有隐身也可以把你刚出生传送门附近的墙用巨人药水都打烂，然后躲在传送门后面，机器人会用火箭筒打门会伤到自己这样也能磨死。个人推荐新手玩战士，虽然杀戮弹药奖励器被削弱了但是前期给很多道具还是能收集很多装备的，而且个人属性不错。我最爱玩的这个医生角色，其中一个技巧就是在房主（有黄色标识）看不到的地方打墙他就会过来看或者回头这样就可以晕他。咳咳，说了这么多看到的朋友们记得给我点个赞233。

37023979.review:
A very nice game with a good sense of humor and plenty of creativity.  Despite being still in Early Access, it has a ton of replayability both with a large pool of characters to unlock and the ability to make custom ones yourself.  You're given the missions, and you're free to tackle them yourself, however you wish!  It's also up to four players, both local and internet connectivity.

The only downside as of right now is that there's a rather noticable memory leak when playing over the internet, for the client-side computers.  This will probably change in the future however, as the developer is very swift with bugfixes and updates frequently.

Pourquoi je vous dirais d'acheter ce jeu ? Car il est exellent. 
Streets of Rogue est un beat them all. 
Votre but si toute fois, vous l'acceptez sera de tuer tout les bonhommes sur votre passage avec votre personnages. Il y aura des petites missions à faire sur chaque niveau. A chaque fois que vous passez un niveau, la difficulté s'aggrandit.

Le mode en ligne est assez fluide pour un jeu comme celui-ci et vraiment à 4 il y a moyen de vraiment s'amuser. J'ai un peu moins de 10h de jeu sur Streets of Rogue, mais franchement, il est addictif.

Je recommande si vous aimez les jeux un peu wtf

36856057.review:
This game is amazing for a multitude of reasons. 

First and foremost, it is complex. When you purchase this game and play for the first time, you assume it will be a simple and easy to master game that you'll spend a few hours on and beat. Then, you realize that when you talk to one of many random cpu townspeople, you can hire them to beat up a bouncer and gain entrance to a lab of scientists who each try to kill you as you rush to kill them first, gaining a key in the process, opening the cage of a gorilla, which you then talk to because you are also a gorilla who can talk to people because you gained a gorilla-to-human translating device from flipping three switches in a giant warehouse building in which there are countless traps such as flamethrowers, poisonous gas, and never-ending pits of doom, and you navigate this building of course while swinging a police baton at henchmen trying to kill you, and that you got the police baton by baiting a policeman into a pit of flame. Of course, that was just the first mission out of three per level, with three levels in a floor. And five floors.

Second of all, this game is goofily fun. And when I say fun, I mean side-splitting, laughing-so-hard-you-cry, rolling-on-floor fun. One of many amazing things you can do with this game is hack a television into running through walls and people, in the process killing a scientist stumbling around the map because your teammate gave him a dizzy spell through the cocaine-and-vodka martini he gave him. This will make you cry because you will just have too much darn fun.

Third of all, IT IS IN EARLY FREAKING ACCESS! This game is amazing, and deserving of every dollar it gets, and it is not even close to finished! This game is my favorite by far, and I encourage any and all to give it a go. Worst case scenario, you feel you lost less than $20. Best case scenario? Absolute fun, for ages to come. 

[b] BUY THIS GAME AND SUPPORT IT'S AMAZING CONTENT AND DEVELOPER [/b]

36849369.review:
ランダム生成される各フロアで2から3のミッションをすべてこなし、次のフロアへどんどん進んでいくという方式。
各フロアには無力化対象や、奪還対象、救出対象などがおり、例えば無力化対象であれば、眠らせてもいいし、逮捕してもいいし、もちろん殴り殺してもいい。

選んだキャラクターによって能力が異なり、例えば警官ならNPCを逮捕できるし、コメディアンなら周囲を笑わせて仲間にすることができる。（ジョークが滑ると敵対される）

なお、操作できるキャラは、特定の条件を満たすことでアンロックされる方式であり、その特定の条件は、特定のキャラクターじゃないとなかなか満たすのが難しい、ということがあるので、序盤はキャラクターのアンロックに専念するほうがいいかも。

1プレイ10分～30分で、手軽にあそべるのもよい（もちろん長く生存できればもっと時間は伸びるが）

36843210.review:
The game has potential, but I can't recommend it at the moment because the online multiplayer is too prone to breaking.  At times you'll get desynced and combat with other entities totally breaks for a few minutes until you finally resync.  But while that is happening, you can still move around and interact with things so you can totally bypass defenders, circumventing half the gameplay.

The game also has some rather bad hitching in the performance which happened for both me on my RX480 and my friend on his 1070ti.  If it hitches at a bad time you'll take hits or miss your shots and it is very annoying.  These aren't some bleeding edge graphics here, there is no excuse for that sort of performance issue on this kind of hardware.

The game isn't all bad though, and if not for these glaring issues I might have enjoyed it more.  The unlocking of percs and customizing your own classes is a nice touch.  The situations that arise in game can be pretty hilarious when big crazy fights break out because you accidentally got caught stealing from some guy.  The game is completely morally ambiguous as well.

If you are buying this to play split-screen locally, you might not run into some of this.  But I got this to play online co-op specifically but it is just too glitchy at the moment.  I plan to revisit this game down the road and should these issues get ironed out, I'll change my review.

Edit:
Based on dev response below, gonna give the game the benefit of the doubt and give it a thumbs up.
36843210.developer_response:
If the issue stated in your first paragraph occurs, please post an output log, as I am actively looking for a fix (if it's the issue I'm thinking of):
http://steamcommunity.com/app/512900/discussions/0/1458455461472158877/

Can you descibe the issue in more detail?  Are you able to hit enemies and vice versa, or are they just frozen in place?  If it's the latter, this is the result of a bad connection, and there's unfortunately not much I can do about that directly.  You might want to check into your firewall or router settings, or those of the person you're playing with.  But if all else fails, you could look into the programs Hamachi or Evolve as a means of starting up a LAN game with players in different locations.

Regarding hitching in performance - Can you describe in more detail what would constitute a hitch in this case?  This game is using a standard Unity configuration, and a large amount of optimization has been done already.  You may want to check into the programs you have running in the background, as this is likely the result of an issue external to the game.  Major hitches don't happen on my machines that I've used for testing, and it's not a commonly reported issue.

36818731.review:
I must admit, I did pirate this game before purchasing and would have over 30 hours on it easily if they were added to my Steam hours. Still went and paid full price for it here because this is certainly a game that deserves it.

It's one of the most fun games I played in a long time. That goes for both single-player and multi-player runs. It gives you total freedom (within the scope of your own skills and knowledge) on how to tackle the different situations. 

Want to go in, arms flailing and guns blazing? You can.
Want to go in, silently as a ghost and more quiet than the sound of a cat's footsteps? You can.
Want to avoid going in, sending your minions/friends/unwilling servants and reaping the rewards afterwards? You can.

Do expect for odds to change considerably in a very short amount of time, both for better or worse as chaos engulfs you and your plans.

36803606.review:
It's a pretty decent game. The soundtrack is well written and consistent, it's updates are pretty packed, but the main attraction is the actual gameplay. There is a large variety of methods to complete an objective, like busting through the front door with guns blazing, strategising the stealthiest and most outwitting of plans, tampering with the air they breathe so they forcefully kill eachother, or hiring a team of criminals to do your bidding.
The locals act differently depending on your misdeeds. Specific actions can affect their opinion of you, and therefore the rest of the floor, so you have to decide how you'd interact with people too.

One thing I would point out is that the playstyle you want to use has to fit the character you pick, so choosing an offensive character would restrict you to that offensive style. Thankfully, the addition of custom characters lets you work around this, allowing you to mix and match your favourite aspects of a player.

You can also have fun messing around with the 'Mutators', basically altering the game's pace and/or difficulty with crazy stuff like a zombie apocalypse every level.
There's a lot of bugs and glitches in the game sometimes, and often make it necessary to restart the game, however the community constantly points these out for fixing.

I'd say it's worth the buy personally, but perhaps you could wait for a more stable and packed version in future.

Wohl das beste Roguelike Spiel, das es gibt. Es ist trotz seiner sehr schlichten Grafiken ästhetisch sehr ansprechend und man fühlt sich darin wohl. Die Möglichkeiten sind fast endlos, man kann mittlerweile schon eigene Charaktere erstellen etc.

36561337.review:
I really enjoy this game, the graphics take me straight back to the OG Pokemon, and it's almost like I get to stab that butthead who prevented you from entering Rout 1 before you talk to the Professor.

The premise of this Rogue Like is that a corrupt mayor has stolen all the booze in the city in order to fund a crime cyndicate that he is in charge of, and you must scale the city to stop him (and is a pretty decent statement about runaway capitalism). The city is appropriately separated into socioeconomic statuses and you must go through the slums all the way up to the 1%ers to kill the mayor.

The combat is an addictive balance of melee, guns and stealth, although I can't help but feel like the Soldier is the best character I've got so far. The Doctor was great for unlocking the Assassin, because I was able to chlorophorm everyone without detection, and the Gorilla was great for unlocking the wrestler because his dash attack still counts as using only your fist, but neither of those characters are able to use weapons (and the gorilla isn't even allowed in stores for hillariously obvious reasons). The Assassin's sword runs out of durability way too fast so you pretty much have to secure another weapon before it breaks, which is a drag. The Soldier however, has a helmet, guns, mines, grenades, and door demolishers. I'm working on unlockin the other chacters, but as it stands Soldier is mostly who I want too play, and the immbalance is worth mentioning; athough the gorilla is a strong second pick because give him a melee weapon and he can dash to one hit kill most things.  

So far it feels a bit easier than Nuclear Throne, as I die a somewhat often to Big Bandit on floor one of NT, where as there was no boss at the last floor of the slums in this game. I would appreciate if I had to kill King Hobo to get out of the slums or something. It would make sense that the mayor employs the filthiest hobo to keep the slums down on their luck.

Also, it may be lost in the wall of settings text, but this game doesn't appear to have a mouse senistivty slider, and I had to go into my PC's mouse settings to adjusts, but hey thats an Early Access game for you. 

Overall this game feels way more polished than a lot of early access games, and I gotta give props to the one guy developing it because he seems pretty responsive to the community, but more importantly he seems to have created a game that one person can manage. I see way to many tiny dev teams get swamped in what they want to accomplish. 


Pros:
*Addictive Gameplay 
*Nostalgic Graphics 
*Sweet sweet 80's 8bit techno song as a background to your slaughter 
*Unlockables are worth unlocking and unlocked with chicken nuggets  (I really hope this is a nod to the game Kindergarten) 
*No bugs/crashes so far
*Mutator adds fun game changing options with minimal penalties. 

Cons:
*Character Immbalance (possibly only an early game issue)
*Too many characters cant us guns (I think it would make more sense to bar the Doctor (and other classes) from most weapons, but not all. Let the Doc use a pistoles and maybe like a scapel. The hippocratic oath doesn't apply to people who ARENT your patients and you can still beat the crap out of people with yer fists, so The Doc's logic is already inconsistant.)
*No? sentivity options for the mouse (either that or it's kinda hard to find and I'm being lazy X)

Suggestions:
*Increase durability of "Assassin's Sword" aka unique starting sword for Assassin. 
*Bar some characters from certain weapon TYPES instead of all weapons (no melee or no guns not specific enough IMO).
*WHERE MY B SKINS AT??? 
*More hair/beard options plz
*MORE BOSSES!!!!!!!


So the final question is, is this game worth $15 USD? I would say if you feel like Nuclear Throne is worth the price, you will find this game to be worth the price too. Though slighty easier in the beginning levels, I would say this game is worth it because it has more depth packed into the gameplay and because I see my issues with the game being adressed sooner rather than later, even if only by a similar modding community to the one that found NT. 


PRO TIP: Soldier is best when he looks like Mr. T (Mr T B skin for soldier PLEEAAAASEEEEEE)

36550978.review:
[h1]一款极富有趣味而又别出心裁的Rogue类游戏[/h1]

  游戏本身好评如潮，已经证明了这款游戏的魅力。接下来我想用这篇评测再为想+这款游戏又有所担心的玩家解决一些疑虑。
  这是一款类Rogue游戏，玩家需要扮演一名反抗市长暴政的角色，在一个被电梯分为数十层的城市中穿行，获取资源，在生存的前提下完成反抗军的任务并通往下一层，一步一步地向高层推进，一路上你会遇到各种各样的人物、建筑，你需要不择手段获取一切资源，让自己从一无所有变成强大到能征服整个城市的战士 。 

  这是一个只有一条法律的城市：[spoiler]”只要不在警察面前犯罪就不是犯罪“[/spoiler]。在这个城市中，有四处巡逻并且暴力执法的警察，有见面就会火拼的帮派成员，也有老实经营的店主、四处流浪的贫民、飞扬跋扈的贵族、阴险的奴隶主、恶趣味的科学家，甚至还有狼人、吸血鬼、丧尸和高度智能的大猩猩，更一颗赛艇的是，你可以直接扮演他们中的任何一个在这城市中闯荡天下，这难道还不够 Cooooooool 吗？？

  在这个游戏中有着现实中亦有各式各样的建筑物，居民楼、诊所、酒吧、警察局、商店、银行、工厂...你穿梭其中，你可能为了只是获取冰箱中的食物就动手杀死无辜的居民、也可能路见不平勇敢拯救被违法囚禁的百姓，你也会枪杀、下毒、挑拨、潜入、用电脑骇入，或是布下C4来一场华丽的爆炸，为了获取资源和完成任务，你有着无数种选择，这也正是这款游戏的魅力所在。

  只要你了解了这些小人物之间，有着什么样的关系联系；丰富的道具和技能有什么作用；地图上的每一个物体有各有什么样的功能，哪怕是一无所有的从贫民窟的底部开始，在数关的闯荡之后，你都将拥有获取轰动撼动城市的能力。因为这款游戏不要求你有着如同在”以撒的结合“中那样的操作技巧，你大可以用拳头或者棒球棍儿无脑抡人、或者见面就给对手来上一梭子，因为比起这些，这个游戏更要求的是你能完全地了解这个世界的信息，只需要有足够的经营能力，和一点点小小的操作技巧，你就能玩转这个游戏，我想这也是这个游戏和其他的类Rouge游戏最突出的不同了。

 对于我个人而言，这是我第一款认真去写的测评，[spoiler]感谢这款游戏给有段时间没网络的我带来了许多欢乐[/spoiler]，我经常离线玩这款游戏，因此真实游戏时间可以说远超steam统计的了0 v 0
。因此我真心地希望有更多的玩家能够了解并喜爱上这款独具一格的独立游戏。

[i]总评：

+丰富的角色以及道具
+超高的自由度
+带感的Bgm
+黑色幽默
+自带简中
++自建角色以及自由选择游戏突变
++一个人开发依然更新不断的勤奋作者

-糟糕的联机延迟
-每次更新都有显而易见的大量Bug[/i]

即使这些小瑕疵，依然不影响我愿意给这个游戏一个大大的好评。（9/10）
Shut up and take my money

系統相當精細，值得重複品味
評論當時內容到4-3
1.角色特色十足，尤其是那些可以使用能力的角色讓玩法大異其趣
2.遊戲中各種任務皆能以多種方式解決，與其同時發生的意外讓過程有驚有險
3.理解NPC的視線與聽覺非常重要，事情到底能不能輕鬆解決就得想清楚
4.每到一個新樓層都會有新事物，不過那些新事物不是以後每個樓層都會出現的所以稍微減少了隨機的樂趣
5.預定會有5大關=15小關，算起來感覺內容有點少，主要是放在重複玩的樂趣，但因為3.所說的其實會一直遇到重複的關卡要素
6.雖然各角色都有各自的優勢，生存策略上比較穩定的做法還是想辦法找出無敵或隱形藥劑，複製一些出來以防意外發生
7.道具格子實在不夠用，此遊戲道具、食物、武器、藥劑種類又雜又多，單一、次要用途的東西想要放著以備不時之需結果就是妨礙食物或武器的空間，只好拿去賣掉，讓那些低階的道具在中期以後變得很沒有意義。不過道具的取捨也是Rogue-Like遊戲的經典要素就是了

My custom character had the 'Specist' trait - Gorillas attack me on sight.

I dump poison into the air filtration system of the local shopping mart, on my way to perform a mission.
Everybody piles out of the building. Except for a Jock who died just inside.
Among them is a Gorilla. It attacks me.
A police officer reacts to the law-breaking Gorilla by shooting at it, hitting a Goon in the process.

Stray bullets involve 2 hackers, a Gorilla-hating scientist, a soldier, and a mobster.

In an era of indie games trying to recapture the past, Streets of Rogue moves gaming forward. Don't let the simplistic graphics fool you!

36131093.review:
Had a lot higher hopes for the game based on comments, but it's really just only an okay game that TRIES to accomplish a lot but struggles in a lot of aspects too. Overall you'll have a great time playing the game but it loses the charm quick. 

PROS
------

- The unique characters like the Zombie are REALLY fun and offer really unique and interesting gameplay in comparison to some of the other characters. 

- The humor is great.

- Some interesting and well thought out ideas are in place like being able to poison characters to make them leave, or being able to bribe certain characters to do certain tasks for you.

- The items are pretty interesting for what they are and some of them are definitely unique and fun to use.

- The game feels like a unique experience compared to other games in this genre.

- The game runs great because of the low cost art style. 

- Dedicated developer is always a plus, especially with how easy "Early Access" is to exploit.

CONS
---------

- $16.99 feels too expensive. Yes the developer is dedicated, yes there's an okay amount of content, but it exploits the grind aspect to say there's more content than there really is. Pixel graphics, a weak soundtrack, and some clever ideas aren't enough for that price tag. 

- Half the characters are great, the other half are just kind of whatever. Some characters like the Hacker just feel very, very, very useless and uninteractive. 

- VERY few NPC's. 30 minutes in you've seen every one of them and you basically already know what they all do.

- The inventory / HUD feels a bit clunky or ugly. Could be polished a bit and cleaned up. 

- Not a whole lot of clever or sneaky interactions that you can find that aren't pretty obvious already.

- The maps are pretty boring. Very few things to interact with and once you've played a run or two you'll see nothing new from then on. 

- The game takes a while to play through a run and a LOT of the run feels grindy before it gets interesting and possibly a bit difficult. 

- Buying items doesn't feel very rewarding or useful. I kept finding that unless I needed that one clutch heal, then I was never, ever, ever using the item machines or shops. 

- MOST items feel pretty pointless. A lot of the time you can get through a game solely by shooting your way through or using your fists without the need for any other items aside from food (healing).

- So many interactions either feel wonky or just flat out don't make sense. It doesn't feel as polished as it could be. Characters act uncharacteristically sometimes out of nowhere and there isn't a sense of.. "my gameplay sparks x reaction from characters." It's just alerting an enemy versus not alerting an enemy. 

- Rewards and purchases with the currency feel.. wonky. Currency takes a while to get and most rewards feel too insignificant for you to want to buy or grind to buy. A lot of them you actually DON'T want to buy because it makes gameplay more inefficient with the way leveling up is designed. They don't offer interesting enough gameplay changes. 

- The game isn't challenging unless YOU place some kind of challenge there for yourself, which basically means every run is some kind of Nuzlocke run. You're just looking for excuses to do things in certain ways. 

- The game was made under the premise that you could play it however you want. That being said, the only method that makes sense is to go in guns blazing because you're still basically doing the same thing as the other methods. You want to hack that computer and have an edge in that regard with the Hacker? Doesn't matter, because computers are too easy to access, too easy to use, and you're left with no niche, purpose, or edge over any other character. They can do the same thing as you just as easily. Computers and certain things should've been made more difficult for the average character to access to give certain characters distinct niches. Right now they can all do the same thing as one another with ease (except for characters with special abilities).

35825309.review:
Honestly, this is one of the best purchases I've made all year. I normally can't stick with a game for more than a few hours before I start finding it boring, but I've unlocked every character, item and ability, and I'm still coming back to this game all the time thanks to the excellent create-a-class system. I don't normally write reviews, but I honestly lie awake some nights worrying that people don't understand that Streets of Rogue is a seriously awesome game. So let me tell you: Streets of Rogue? Seriously awesome game. You heard it here first. So sit down, buckle in, and crack open a boy with your cold ones whilst I explain to you /in detail/ exactly why and how damn much I reccomend this game on steam.

---

Plenty of games have tried to simplify the rogue-like genre to varying degrees of success, but I think the best way to understand SoR is as a procedurally generated immersive sim. The game handles combat, item hoarding and leveling up characters perfectly well, but the true beauty is the playground you're given to play in. The first few times I played, I died consistantly within the first three levels because I was running around at full pelt punching slum dwellers, scientists, doors, fridges, and anything else that I suspected might drop an item if I could only punch it the right way. Slowing down, I realised there are so many more interesting ways to play. For item collection quests, you don't have to kick the door down and punch the item out of it's holders' still-warm corpse. You can knock politely, offer the guy an item to trade, and be on your merry way. Or visit a drug dealer, spike his air-conditioning with a random drug and see what happens. Might poison him, might turn him invisible. Is he in a gang? Pick a fight with a rival gang, and lead them to him. Is he in a hideout? Find a hacker, pickpocket his hacking tool, and use it to set off poison gas and trap doors in his base. Half an hour in, you'll realise how fun it is to pick a class and take it's unique abilities for a spin to see just how many different ways you can skin a gun-toting cat guarding the item you need to exit the level and escape the unkillable robot death machine slowly stalking you across the map.

Even in beta, I still haven't seen all the games content- in part because of how balls-hard it can be, and in part because its so much fun just to screw around trying new characters or ideas out. Half of my runs end with me hitting exit, because I've just seen something happen that gave me an idea for an awesome new character build I had to make RIGHT NOW. Holy shit, fire spreads in this game?? Hold up, let me roll an arsonist class with a flamethrower, and oil barrel and a lighter. Secret Agent that mixes cyonide into drinks and loads a water pistol with rage inducing chemicals? Check. Player-made gang that gains a new member each level, but is attacked on sight by rival gangs? Checkion rings. Ancient vampire that's strong enough to punch a dude through an entire building's worth of walls, but can only heal by drinking blood? You get the idea- there's like, a ton of different ways to play the base game, and with the create-a-class mode, you can basically play however you want to. There are a few limitations with how creative you can get, but by and large, I've been able to make every character I've wanted to so far. PROTIP: Grab a buddy, turn on rogue-vision mode, and play co-op as the police officer class. You're basically playing a top-down S.W.A.T sequal.

At the moment, my only gripes are with a select few abilities or items that aren't fully explored and feel a bit useless. For example, you can play as a doctor that gets extra bang for his buck with medical items... all one of them. And I often go entire runs without encountering a med kit at all. The game features an awesome firespreading mechanic that takes into account flammable objects and oil spills- but its impossible to use oil to set anything on fire, as it can only be poured into empty spaces. There are a few cases like this where the game features content that isn't being used to its fullest- but unlike many beta/early access titles, they are small issues that I can absolutely see being addressed in future patches. The dev even has a form built into the pause menu so you can hit him up with suggestions and feedback the moment they pop into your head- and from what I've seen, these ideas genuinely get taken into account and often find their way into the bi-weekly update patches. The only other problem I have with the game is that there isn't more of it to go around- but with placeholders in the current version for character-specific missions, player-created gameplay mutators and more, I can see that changing very soon. 

One criticism that tends to crop up in negative reviews is the lack of mission variety leading to repetitive gameplay. To an extent, this is true. You'll be given the same 3-4 mission types over and over again. Kill these guys, get this item, hit these switches, ad infinitum. But ultimately, if you are having repetitive playthroughs, it's because you keep doing the same thing every time. There is a ton of options at your disposal, and the game does a good job of rewarding (or necessitating) a varied approach to challenges. Limited ammo cappacity and frequent item rewards mean your best chance of survival will likely involve a few different gadgets, and you are rewarded bonus XP for pulling off missions without guns, weapons, or alarms. Ultimately, this is a psychological difference between forcing you to mix up your gameplay, and allowing you to. In the Splinter Cell games, each mission is mixed up with different requirements- use these weapons, trigger no alarms, complete the mission in this time limit. But at the end of the day, what are you doing every single time? Killing those dudes, grabbing those maguffins and hitting those switches, with varying degrees of flavour text thrown on top. Chosing not to do this in SoR is a design choice that leaves the creativity up to the player, not the developer. The game isn't going to tell you "Kill this guy with cunfusion gas, trigger no alarms". But you WILL find yourself with a vial of confusion gas in your pocket, tasked with killing a guy surrounded by fire pits and meat churners, and you can bet you'll get a bonus reward for killing him without weapons and without triggering alarms. 

As it stands, I'd reccomend this game to just about anyone who can enjoy being left to make their own fun in sandbox games. It's a ton of fun in single player. It's awesome with a bud. It'll take you a long time to unlock everything. You'll have a lot of fun screwing about in the process. If the developer keeps to his plan of adding a ton more mission variety, more items and abilities, more characters and more interactions between all of these elements, this could easily be something I consider a masterpiece.

TL;DR:
If you the type of guy that boots up GTA SA, runs in the complete opposite direction of the mission marker and starts practicing safely landing airliners, this game is probably your jam. If you told your friends you'd finished Oblivion after Sean Bean turned into a firey winged god-lizard and killed Goro from Mortal Kombat, this probably isn't your jam, but its your own fault.

35780097.review:
I love how the characters you can play in this game each make the game a completely different play experience.  A comedian telling jokes can get the owner of a locked door and safe to just give up their key to you, although I went into a room with some thugs who didn't like my humour when I told my joke and immediately killed me, so the jokes don't always go down that well.  But then playing a vampire where I have to drink the blood of innocents and making sure no-one else sees me doing it changes everything - and playing a zombie that everyone runs from or tries to kill and you need to get a zombie infection going on each level is yet another different experience.  Then add into that some random 'events' - the two I have come across so far are a radiation leak each 20 seconds that hurts people outdoors (which you can use to your advantage, but which has you scurrying from building to building) and a killer robot slowly chasing you whose missiles it shoots at you really hurt - but again can be used as an advantage to help you blow walls down.

My only request at this point is to allow characters to be upgraded.  There is an unlock system that lets you unlock new random inter-level rewards - but for casual players such as myself I would stick to the game longer if I can grind my character's stats higher and other improvements (such as improving special ability through upgrade tree).  There is a way to pay for starting items, but I don't like spending upgrade currency on single use items - I would rather grind permanent items (starting from weak and slowly upgrading to stronger) than just buying single use powerful items.

Overall this doesn't feel like an Early Access Game, it feels like a completed game.  Mind you at the time of writing this review I see the developer talking about improving Downtown area and until now I haven't managed to get that far in the game!

35773643.review:
I have immediately fallen in love with this game: the design, the content, the humour. This is basically a rouge-like open-world, kinda, platformer. With quests, weird characters, weird pick-ups. In fact there's so much going on in this game, I doubt I'm clever enough to figure most of it out.

The main thing that attracted me to SoR is that each mission can have a peaceful resolution; much like Bethesda's Fallout games until Fallout 4. Yes, you can go in like a genocidal maniac and kill and destroy everything, but if you spend the time looking around, or investing in some unusual objects, then far more radical options up.

My first game lasted 25 minutes. Tip, don't take on a slave-trader with a butter-knife.

Excellent idea and well worth the money.

35619539.review:
Like so many others, I'm growing tired of Early Access, but this game was recommended to me by a friend and I am so glad he did!

Streets of Rogue has given me hope that Early Access can be done meaningfully.  This is the kind of situation it's meant for: a small developer whose game already has a great foundation on which to stand, but room to grow, and who who wants the gaming community to help grow the game.

[b]Bottom line, up front:[/b] This game is unfinished but [i]fun![/i]

As of writing this review, I've unlocked all the characters and played through all the levels available to me (3 levels with 3 floors each), but I still want to keep playing the game because of how much fun it is!  I still have to unlock all of the quest rewards and character traits, which you purchase with earning chicken nuggets, earned by leveling up, beating floors, or completing side missions.

So why do I think this game is so much fun?  This is such a subjective questions, and I'm not the best game reviewer so I'm not entirely sure myself but I'll try to break it down:

[list]
[*][b]This game is hilarious.[/b]  It's not funny in the sense that the writing is funny or there is sharp wit present in the game.  Its all in the situations you are put in or create yourself.  The core gameplay sets you up for some serious hijinks which can create some rather amusing moments.  For example, figuring out that the slavemaster can turn any character into a human hand grenade was one of my favorite discoveries.

[*][b]This game is accessible.[/b]  My wife is not an avid gamer by any means (i.e. spends most of her time on idling tablet games) but she loves this game.  And because she doesn't always have the best reaction time or aiming ability, we have to adapt our strategy.

[*][b]This game is dynamic.[/b]  It's not really the randomly generated levels and missions that create a dynamic experience (although it is a quintessential element to roguelikes).  The wildly different characters with their unbalanced (in a good way) traits can really affect how you experience and play the game.  The vast and crazy arsenal of items also allows for some creativity in approaching how you complete different missions.

[*][b]This game moves at your tempo.[/b]  You can complete the levels as fast or slow as you want.  You can be thorough or you can be efficient.  You can be neat or you can be sloppy.  Streets of Rogue gives you the power to experience the game however you want, which I think might be it's strongest quality.

[*][b]This game is satisfying.[/b]  Beating the missions and levels is satisfying.  Discovering a new mechanic that allows for a different approach is satisfying.  Pulling off a plan that you weren't sure was going to work is satisfying.  Slamming a goon through a wall so you can get 5 gold from a treasure chest is satisfying.  Going around and gimping every slum dweller on the floor with a baseball bat is satisfying.  It's just full of wholesome experiences all around.

[*][b]This game offers challenge without frustration.[/b]  I do like roguelikes, but sometimes they can really feel like a merciless grind.  Streets of Rogue is really a refreshing roguelike experience.  Although I have died plenty of times, meaning that I have to start the game over, I was always just eager to start over again rather than mad or flustered.
[/list]

Anyways, what I'm trying to say is that Streets of Rogue definitely provides $15 worth of fun, so this is an Early Access title I can strongly recommend.  And the developer (jut one guy!) engages with the community, is transparent and reasonable with his goals, and has made one seriously awesome game.  I cannot wait for this game to be finished so I can experience even more unadulterated, bloody fun!

35411505.review:
As of writing this review, the game was still unfinished. I will most likely be revisiting this review once it's complete to reflect on changes etc.

For being in an alpha, it's already got quite a lot of content and replay value. With the first three areas and two about to come, with most likely a lot more classes and more items and other features, the freedom just keeps increasing in its level of actual freedom. Does that make sense? I hope it does.

Either way, it does exactly what it is advertised as, it's a rogue-lite that allows you to complete your quests in multiple ways. If stealth is your forte, you can do that. If you want to blast in guns blazing, you can do that. If you don't want to get hurt, tell some blokes to do the killing for you.

A bothersome person attacking you? Run away, or kill it with a knife, or kill it by shooting it, or make him slip on multiple banana peels, or toss rocks at him, or make something around him explode, or make him anger some random passer-by or a cop, or shrink him, or freeze him, or just do whatever you feel like doing to him!

Because on the Streets of Rogue, anything goes.

35168991.review:
One of the best games I have ever played in my life! I literally can't stop playing.
So... I decided  to edit  my review! I thought I should give some more details to why this is indeed one of the best games ever made.
Pros:
1. The developer
Best developer ever, super active, always takes suggestions from the community, fast bug fixes, etc. Pretty much the perfect developer!
2. The sheer amount of options, you can choose from a diverse cast of 23 characters, these characters range from an angry gorilla who bashes his way through levels with ease, to a shapeshifter who can sneakily jump in and out of npc's bodies.
3. Did I mention you can play as a gorilla?
4. The levels are the just the right level difficulty, not to easy but not uncompleteable. 
5. Everytime, and I truly mean EVERYTIME, you play you will have a different experience.
6. You can do missions using sheer force, sneakiness, etc. There are tons of different ways to do a single mission.
Cons:
If there are any its the lack of characters being released, there is a rather long margin of no new characters after one is released, but that's just my pickiness and impatience.

Rating:
9001/9000
(Over 9000)

Should you buy this game?
YES, GO BUY IT!
Honestly this is a prime example of a good early acess game.

35144361.review: This is the most roguelike of all the modern roguelikes I've played, for one simple reason: complexity. Items, abilities and characters interact in a tremendous variety of plausible ways, while character classes lend themselves to radically different play styles. It really is a battle of wits, and much more cerebral than it looked in the trailers: for any given character class you'll find some missions straightforward, while others require you to improvise with whatever tools you have on hand. Highly, highly recommend this game.

35140855.review:
Wow, just wow. This is one of those hidden gems you take a first look at and just dont see the point, but the second you start playing it you realize how much depth you can apply to the game and how much of a learning curve there really is, its a classic "hack and slash concept" but with tactical variations based on the characters you choose, who then give you the abillity though achievements to unlock more characters and thus more tactics. Want to play with friends, its literally a couple clicks and you are up and running, great simplistic interface and unending variations to every map. You died again, oh well, click restart and run that level till you master its basics, OH NO theres a disaster and you now have a doubly hard challange!!. Seriously, the price alone gives this game a good reason to be tried out by everyone. Complie how well done it is and you will soon be hooked and spreading the word to your friends!

Could this game be any more fun? YES!! it could but only by adding more variiations to character types, and interactible mehtods in the world. OUTSTANDING GAME!
Extreamly responsive, even on others servers. 

So in ending, the only real review is more of a THANKS to the developers and Pat on the back for one HECK OF A GAME!
(Steam only allows one thumbs up or I would have to start sewing more on to put up as many as i wanted!)

35031302.review:
I've spent 50+ hours in this game so far and it's not even friggen' done.
And what's seriously special about it is that almost _every single second_ is entertaining as all hell. I might have played games that I enjoy as much, or more, if you consider the whole experience. Story arcs and "stuff". However for minute-to-minute entertainment this is the best game ever made. I'm not even kidding. 

The ability to have this much fun concentrated in such a short time is essential for me. You know exactly what I'm talking about if you have kids and obligations. Games like this, Tower of Guns or Desktop Dungeon are godsends.


If the dev had, at this point, called it done and never touched it again I'd still recommend buying it. Even though I'd of course be disappointed.


Just buy it!

35014790.review: Personally, I enjoyed Streets of Rogue for the sort of nature about it as a local multiplayer, 'sandbox-like'. It has numerous qualities of a sandbox where I can stay behind on the levels and destroy whatever it is I may. Each class, besides the most blatantly bland ones like the hobo or the criminal (for neither of which do I have respect) has a uniqueness to it that stands out among most. The mission system and overall gameplay seem to have a rather simple level difficulty which further supports my opinion of it as a sandbox-like with the progression-style gameplay being the only part of it that seems to directly contradict that genre placement. Please do bear in mind that this game is much more entertaining with friends that also directly contradict that genre placement by making the game extremely difficult to progress through as each and every one of them seems to want to beat my character's corpse until he's just a bloody mass. All in all, I promote a creative individual to this game in order to make with the early access label as they can. I now only play this game when there is a friend over as to have another person to assist me in my individual manner of creativity: how many people can you pile up at the minecart tracks at once to feed the beast?

35011905.review:
[h1]Pancadaria com e nos amigos![/h1]

[b]IMPORTANTE:[/b] Atualizações ao jogo citadas na review, a partir da versão [b]alpha 33d[/b], estarão somente em comentários, caso o jogo receba grandes mudanças, como a saída do Early Access, por exemplo. Porém, avisarei quanto a isso na review.

[b]EDIÇÕES:[/b] Nenhuma atualização do jogo citada [b]nos comentários[/b] - [b]16/09/2017[/b].

   Em desenvolvimento por [url=https://twitter.com/madguy90]Matt Dabrowski[/url] e distribuído pela [url=http://store.steampowered.com/search/?publisher=tinyBuild]tinyBuild[/url], [i]Streets of Rogue[/i] é um jogo do gênero [b]Roguelike[/b] com [b]elementos de RPG[/b] e que tem como foco a diversão com amigos, sendo totalmente confuso e engraçado. Além de que ainda está em desenvolvimento por uma única pessoa - a citada inicialmente na review. Lançado no começo do ano, [b]10/03/2017[/b], meu primeiro contato com ele foi em um final de semana gratuito juntamente com um amigo, tanto que jogamos até o dia amanhecer no domingo. A data de quando rolou esse fim de semana, já não sei. Mas posso dizer que foi decisivo para eu poder comprá-lo.

   Sua ideia é bem simples, e como citei no começo, foca muito na diversão com seus amigos, sendo na casualidade, também. Como está em [b]Early Access[/b], ainda falta ter um final, pois o propósito já existe, por si só. Não irei entrar em detalhes quanto à sua história, pois ela nem sequer é o foco do jogo, mas existe, caso alguém tenha dúvidas. Para que a diversão ocorra, o jogo nos proporciona uma bagunça imensurável na qual você juntamente de seus amigos acabam rindo e se perdendo com tudo aquilo que ocorre no nível (dungeon). Por isso, eu [b]recomendo somente se for jogado com amigos[/b]. De preferência, via voip ou no mesmo local, algo que torna muito mais comunicativo e propício a risos.

   Atualmente, na versão [b]Alpha 33d[/b], o jogo contém 3 lugares divididos em 3 níveis cada um, porém, podendo ser em 2 às vezes. São 23 personagens ao todo e muito bem bolados e com habilidades especiais, fora as iniciais e as que serão desbloqueadas a cada level up. Por exemplo, um ladrão tem a habilidade de furtar alguém tranquilamente. Em alguns casos, hehe. Outro é o canibal... Com sua habilidade especial de comer os cadáveres para recuperar vida é simplesmente a minha favorita! Lembrando que você pode personalizar até 8 personagens a seu gosto. Você personaliza todas as habilidades. Todos os personagens têm até 8 habilidades iniciais, tirando a [b]especial[/b]. Caso você crie um personagem e exagere, o deixando muito apelativo, você não poderá desbloquear conquistas e personagens, assim como habilidades. Há um limite. É algo bem bacana. Mais habilidades são destravadas a sua escolha somente quando você sobe de level durante a sua aventura sozinho ou com amigos, após completar missões para que possa avançar aos próximos níveis, dependendo do quanto de XP tenha ganho. Também serão destravadas na sua base (algo que vai entender quando jogar). A variedade de personagens é extensa e sempre aparece um novo à coleção. Não se preocupe quanto a isso.

   Os gráficos são pixelados, mas perfeitamente detalhados à sua proposta. Todas as ambientações são bem feitas e deixam os cenários bem variados, passando a real situação do lugar: um caos. O jogo é leve e não apresenta problemas de performa mas, por outro lado, apresenta bugs com os cenários. Isso não ocorre sempre, mas são bugs divertidos, pois os inimigos se enfiam dentro de paredes e isso é bacana. Não atrapalha o avanço com o jogo, mas lhe dá risadas. É divertido. Sua trilha de fundo e efeitos sonoros são formidáveis para a premissa do jogo. Ah, antes que eu esqueça: Suas conquistas são tranquilas, basta se divertir com o jogo!

   [b]Há tradução ao Português Brasileiro em 80% do conteúdo[/b]. Isso se dá por estar em Early Access, é claro. Aos poucos, deve sair atualizações quanto a isso. Contém erros em alguns casos, mas é perfeitamente aceitável. Eu não sei se alguém está sendo pago para traduzir ou se é algo voluntário, visto que a tradução não é feita pela Oficina Steam, então, caso não entenda inglês e tenha receio quanto ao jogo por conta disso, bem, não se preocupe. Nem se não tivesse tradução tornaria o jogo não recomendado aos brasileiros que não entendem muito bem ou nada de inglês.

   As jogatinas em coop podem ser feitas localmente, isto é, no mesmo computador com até 4 jogadores ou 4 jogadores jogando em LAN. O mesmo ocorre se for jogar online criando uma sala privada ou aberta a mais jogadores. Não cheguei a ter problemas de conexões, exceto quando a internet ficava um lixo ou estava em uso. Sua conexão será peer-to-peer. Se alguém estiver com problemas de conexão, afeta todo mundo (não de maneira extrema). Mas não é um problema, afinal, é compreensível um jogo deste tipo ter uma conexão assim, certo? Servidores seriam uma boa, mas gerariam custos. Entenda.

   Talvez você nunca tenha ouvido falar do jogo. Entendo isso. Nem eu conhecia, mas foi um final de semana que mudou tudo isso e um amigo me falar sobre o jogo. Testamos e gostamos. [b]TALVEZ[/b] o jogo entre em outro final de semana gratuito. Seria uma boa. Mas não posso dar certeza quanto a isso. O que posso dar certeza é que vale a pena com seu preço atual, caso tenha levado em conta o que falei no começo de tudo: jogar com amigos. Do contrário, não valeria a pena comprá-lo. A conversão do jogo é justa, tendo sua base em US$ 14,99 e convertidos em R$ 27,99. O desenvolvedor avisa que, quando o jogo sair do seu acesso antecipado, provavelmente manterá seu preço, porém, pode ser alterado. Talvez suba aos R$ 36,99, tendo base em US$ 20,00. [b]Eu recomendo esperar por promoções[/b]. São sempre bem-vindas e eu sempre recomendo-as. Por que a pressa, certo? Neste período de espera, que tal avisar os amigos e comprar o jogo com eles depois, hein?! Então, faça isso! Suporte-o quando possível. Fico feliz que já tenha vendido cerca de 140k de cópias mas, da minha Steam, somente 6 amigos têm o jogo hoje (16/09/2017). Sendo destes, 2 dos quais eu jogo desde o começo e me divirto sempre.

   [b]Enfim[/b], [i]Streets of Rogue[/i] é um excelente jogo do estilo [b]Roguelike[/b] com [b]elementos de RPG[/b] focado para jogatinas com os amigos, tendo uma conexão peer-to-peer compreensível, gráficos pixelados atrativos, uma ideia excepcional e muito bem aplicada, atualizações constantes através dos esforços do único desenvolvedor para a conclusão do jogo, trilha de fundo e efeitos sonoros bacanas e não enjoativos, por sinal, um conteúdo que tende a muitas horas de diversões e um preço justíssimo, portanto, é recomendadíssimo à aquisição para jogatinas divertidas e confusas com amigos.

   [b]Observações finais:[/b][list]
[*]Qualquer erro dito aqui, seja sobre o jogo ou ortográfico, falar abaixo e educadamente;
[*][b]Dica:[/b] Jogue para se divertir, não se limite, isto é, não leve a sério;
[*]Todo encurtador de URL é seguro, não estou aqui para ferrar com alguém, apenas prefiro usar a tag "url", entenda;
[*][b]DICA DE JOGOS DIVERTIDOS COM AMIGOS (REVIEWS):[/b] [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/magnofranklin/recommended/384490/]Necropolis[/url], [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/magnofranklin/recommended/252950]Rocket League[/url] e [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/magnofranklin/recommended/322330]Don't Starve Together[/url];
[*]Review no seu limite, o que sufoca falar sobre o jogo... (Uh!);
[*]Analise uma review, isso ajudará outra pessoa da mesma maneira contigo;
[*]Muito obrigado por ter lido, espero que tenha sido útil e bom jogo![/list]

This is probably one of the most enjoyable rogue games I've ever played! I love the vast variety of characters and abilities, as well as customization abilities and the overall silliness of the features (Chicken Nugget currency, anyone?)! The music is super-catchy, and the graphics are a nice throwback to the 16-bit era days. There's a lot to be loved about the simplicity of that.

I'm looking forward to what future updates have in store for Streets of Rogue-- keep it up, devs! You've got a great thing going so far, and you have my appreciation and thanks for continuing to make the game even better as you go.

34802090.review: It's fun at first, but I didn't have much fun after a while. There isn't much strategy or challenge to the game and it starts to feel repetetive after a bit. It's very much a run around and beat up people game, but I feel it could be much more. Games like Hotline Miami really feel intense and you are always in the action, while in this game if things are going rough then run away and hide, or just avoid enemies all together. There are too many friendly npc's and stuff going on, where it might be better if there were more incentives to sneak around. I'm not sure if the developer wanted this to be similar to a Grand Theft Auto game, but that's how it feels now. I know it's still in early access, so that's why I recommend it. It has potential. It needs more structure and less chaos. More reason to play cooperatively than just all going to do your own thing. Maybe PVP could be fun.
34802090.developer_response: My recommendation in regards to challenge/strategy: Try playing with some of the mutators like Low Health.  It totally changes the game.

압도적으로 긍정적인 평가를 주는 이유를 알겠다.
많은 캐릭터가 있음에도 불구하고 서로의 색이 혼합되지 않고 뚜렸해서 각양각색의 유저들의 입맛을 맞출 수 있다.
다만, 한가지 아쉬운게 있다면, 아쉬운 한글지원으로 어느나라 말인지 모를 문장으로 스토리 이해에 문제를 겪고있다.
게임 자체의 완성도는 지금기준으로 나름 만족스럽다.
하지만, 안타까운점은 새로운 캐릭터와 새로운 기술, 특성등등을 고려할 때 개발자에게 요구되는 일량에 비해 런닝타임은 짧을 것이라는 점이다.

34526547.review:
什么样的Rogue-lite游戏能在内容不足的前提下沉迷吸引力？什么样的角色扮演游戏能用玩法支撑起整个流程？

Streets of Rogue用它那张弛有度的节奏感、胡逼欢脱的氛围和缺乏平衡，但tm就是图个爽的游戏机制让我再次领略到Rogue-lite的魔力。

与多数RL类游戏以虚构幻想题材有所不同，这是一款“假装反乌托邦伪装成现实背景”的游戏。玩家处在一个用电梯来进行区域划分的城市中，由于市长的独裁政权，导致整个城市民风彪悍官匪横行。玩家作为抵抗组织的一员，目的就是通过完成每一个地形随机生成区域的任务，一层层往上前进并最终死在未完工的电梯里（因为还没推出完整版所以目前只有3大区域9小关）。

市面上的多数RL游戏的迷宫，多数以战斗内容为主，而本作除了特殊条件下，每一个关卡中玩家面对的并非只有敌对者。关卡主要的随机结构在于生成“房屋”，每种房屋的布局和特点都不尽相同。有些私人的房子进入后玩家会被NPC赶出去或者是直接开打，有一些则允许非敌对状态下自由出入。

是不是有点让你想起了《辐射》之类的欧美RPG？

事实上，目前游戏玩法几乎都是围绕在“如何进入任务目标房屋内” —— 每一关系统都会随机抽出2～3个任务要求你完成：击杀某房子里的NPC、获取某个房子里的物品等等。当完成这些任务后便可前往进入下一层的电梯。当然你也可以继续探索别的地点，甚至一上来就和所有中立状态的NPC杆上。

说白了，游戏的内容实际上变数很少 —— 道具不算多、敌人种类单调、任务和“迷宫”简单。但它最大的亮点，则是强调玩家在这简单的规则中，利用丰富的手段来玩出各种风格。通过不同职业的特性，手中道具的效果和周边元素互动后的结果，使得游戏呈现出极大的乐趣。

任务目标的单调其实就是为了不限制你完成的手段，直接暴力强取便可以处理绝所有的状况，但是显然敌我双方相对均衡的能力使得暴力玩家存活率大大降低。了解各种技能与物品效果，并观察任务目标的地形，以合理地发挥你选择的人物特性才是本作的精髓。

游戏中进入目标房屋的手段包括并不仅仅有：
[list]
    [*]偷盗：利用穿墙或爬窗以不惊动守卫进入房屋完成目标。
    [*]骇客：利用骇客工具控制各种电子设备，比如遥控电视造成大爆炸。
    [*]拆迁：炸弹、特殊技能、巨人药丸等等具有直接破坏墙壁效果的手段。
    [*]下毒：在房子外头的通风管里灌入各种药水，让该房屋中的守卫不得不撤离。
[/list]
而这些手段在不同的职业特性上，玩家在采用时又有着很多细节上的不同。作为一款伪现实题材的游戏，你既可以见到诸如“酒保医生科学家”等等常见职业，也有机会使用“大猩猩僵尸吸血鬼”一干奇葩种。每个职业简单的两三种独有特性，能让每一盘游戏的变数与玩法发生非常大的变化。体验所有职业在任务时不同的应对手段，是本作最核心的游戏乐趣所在。

虽然并非是以战斗为核心的游戏，但本作却在很多细节上有着非常棒的爽快感。游戏打击感扎实，慢动作和碎尸等等浮夸的特效也毫不吝啬，加上人物的行动模式比较快使得游戏打起来热闹至极。AI的行动模式有一定规律，但弹性也不小，经常会做出很鬼畜的行为让人捧腹大笑。配上动感的背景BGM，摇晃的镜头使得游戏具有奇特的魔性。

虽然商店页面标榜着“可以玩600小时”，但事实是本作的机制、节奏使得平均每盘游戏时间不会超过20分钟。开发组并没有对玩家做太多限制，是我个人对本作最喜欢的一点。你可以通过主基地的黑客，修改每盘游戏的一些机制，来达到你想要的游戏效果。而宽松的任务条件，和并不强制进行战斗的设计，让玩家可以很轻松地了解并熟悉每种职业的不同之处。

玩这个游戏，放飞自己瞎jb搞是最有趣也是最能体验其本质的。没有道德约束，没有底线和原则，物尽其用地获取最大的利益，不仅能让你活下去，还能体验到最原始的快乐。

34474696.review:
This game provides a smooth and visceral twin stick shooter/beatemup roguelite, well balanced to make both melee and ranged combat interesting, and packed with emergent interactions.  But on top of that: randomly generated missions!  Streets of Rogue's random missions, most of which are of the infiltration-ey variety, combine with the generated urban settings to provide you with endless unique challenges, many of which give the modest and not overdone stealth mechanics a reason to exist.  I don't know if the random missions each level idea is original to this game, but it works amazingly well.  It's like taking the emergent complexity of a procedural dungeon crawl and squaring it.  I hope that many roguelite and roguelike developers shamelessly yoink this formula.

The game itself is somewhat of a mid length demo at this point, with the developer prioritizing a lot of core gameplay and engine functionality over making all the levels the game will eventually have.  I support this, because the foundation being built is rock solid, and I see even more awesomeness in this game's future building upon that.  If we ever get modding, be still my heart.

In any case, you'll have to get a fair bit of practice at the game before you can even notice that it's not complete.  Just getting through the first three sets of levels was hard before I had some solid strategies down, but definitely fun-hard. 
 There are great amounts of fun to be had from this game today.  The network co-op gameplay is great fun, though some sync issues are still being worked on, and the local co-op is too, with the ability to switch between split screen and single screen depending on how far apart you are.  It could be a bit better done... see SMBX for a stellar example... but it's still quite good.  And on top of being among a small elite group of stellar endlessly fun co-op games with both split screen and lan support, it's quite addictively fun to play all by myself as well.  Which can be a bit of a problem.

34471338.review:
So uh...
Serious review

Streets of Rogue is a randomly generation RPG rogue-like-like. (RIP)
It doesn't contain the elements of endless gameplay and leveling up your character into a god (Hopefully it will), but it has quirks and many ways to complete a quest. The replayablity of this game is so far only limited to character unlocks along with some unlockable traits and rewards for quests. Since it is still in dev, I respect that, as the game isn't finished and the dev most likely wants to hear feedback.

Good thing about character unlocks though is that it opens a whole new way to play the game. Such as playing with the gorilla you can tear through an entire level with your bare hands and not have to care to much about your character's weaknesses. Play as a hacker and you sneak around hacking computers making it so a person falls victim to their own traps. Play as a shapeshifter and completely abuse the ability to take someone over and use their abilities to accomplish your goals. Either way if you like to have several options on how to approach a task this is a fitting game.

Do I recommend the game?

Yes, I do. Despite only having 10 hours (as of writing this) I plan on having more. I was looking for something a little different than the array of cliche games on Steam (FPS, shitty survival, and clones of other games) and this fufilled that need. If you plan on playing by yourself I would be a little bit more wary of this purchase, but if you plan on playing with people it multiples the fun. Don't get me wrong this game is fun playing by yourself; however, it might seem a little repetitive.

[h1] PROS: [/h1]

Quirks
Any computer can run
Replayability
Depth
Different ways to approach
FUN MULTIPLAYER
Every playthrough is different
It is a different game than most on the market.

[h1] CONS [/h1]

Sometimes an FPS drop when things get crazy
Only 3 levels 
Randomness limited to only a few things

[h1] Things I would like to see in the game: [/h1]

MORE CHARACTERS
MORE VARIATION
MORE WEAPONS
MORE LEVELS
