32377354.review:
Short review:
It's a good game, kinda like mix between GTA and Binding of Isaac with cool pixel graphics. This game has prity good soundtrack too. If you ask me, this game is worth every dollar/euro/pound. 

Longer review:
This game has currently 3 different areas, in the future there will be more. Each area has 3 levels, in the last level of every area there are disaster. Disasters means random bombs dropping from the sky, killer robot trying to kill you and your friends, people rioting outside of their home or people taking damage outside every 20 seconds. All levels are randomly generated, some might look the same but has probably something different, like a vending machine other side the road or something like that. Every time you start a new match, you have to choose a character. There are currently 21 characters to choose from. For example, you can be a cannibal, eat dead bodies to gain health or you can be a hacker, you can hack TV's to explode or security system without going into anyones house. You have 6 characters when you start, rest of them you have to unlock by playing the game.

Only bad thing to say (atm) is that there is no "Kick menu", only way to kick someone is that you type /kick [playername]....yeah, if you have someone afk or trolling with chinese letters or russian letters in his/hers name, you can't do anything....

32355552.review:
Be Rambo, hack the world, smash people into pieces as an ape, backstab people while being invisible, eat their corpses, suck out their blood, send your homies on suicide missions, arrest people, posses people, kill them in their sleep, make them walk into a landmine, make them hate each other and kill each other while you laugh your ass off from a safe distance, poisen them, drug them, and more.

This game is so versatile thanks to its unique characters, abilities, items, Traits and mutators. 
While the missions are somewhat repetitive, you may have to tackle them in different ways when using a different character and their unique traits and abilities.

Send in your homies to do the dirty work, poisen your enemies with gas, hack their turrets, shoot em up with your Uzi, blow them up with TNT or use stealth and sneak past them, the choice is yours.

If the game is to easy for you try out the mutators, give yourself an extreme time limit if you're into that or use the mutator so that you can only see stuff within the cone of vision of your character. Or go crazy and give everyone Rocket Launchers. You hate those Axe wielding bastards? Turn off melee weapons or turn off ranged weapons, make everyone have low HP or make everyone hate you on sight. Turn on/off Distasters or simply play around in Sandbox mode.

The game is still in EA and yet one can have so much fun in the game already, I can't wait to see what the devs will implement in the future. 

The only real gripe I have with the game is that multiplayer (Internet) is sometimes bugged, connecting doesn't always work and sometimes you have bugged Level Designs (in Mulitplayer). Also lag can be sometimes pretty rough, but I'm not sure if it is the games or my buddies connections fault. But thankfully the game is also loads of fun in Singleplayer. 

Blahds forever

32180532.review:
Great promise for a quick multiplayer experience. Sufficient mission variety and randomized puzzles to keep things interesting with a fast-paced focus. Different approaches may be taken to solve each mission based on class and available resources.

Pros:
-Fast pacing, plenty of action. Or take it slow and methodical.
-Randomized events keep up the surprise factor.
-Easy multiplayer.
-Replayability and unlocks.

Cons:
-Class balance. Vampire is OP, particularly with multiplayer situations as you may repeatedly resurrect fallen comrades. Meanwhile, other classes suffer to the point of being not quite unplayable, but just supremely lacking aside from the humor factor.
-Items become less useful. Plenty of item variety, but a lot of it would be called "vendor trash". Sometimes a fist is all you need.
-Classes have stats, but you cannot level stats. Leveling is limited to unlocked abilities, many of these falling into the "sub-optimal" category of "take it if you have no other option".
-AI is weak. This isn't a problem for the mooks, but the bigger bosses (rocket launching robot) can be tricked easily in multiplayer scenarios (target nearest player, alternate who is closest, make use of building corners).
-No option to either continue from where you left off or "save" a character you have progressed.

Suggestions:
-Include a "safehouse" option every few levels to save a character. Permadeath should still apply, but if you need to stop the game or continue with a friend, you could.
-Item to "save character" for later use. So, your friend died and you have no way to save your friend. Or maybe you are in a tight spot. Pull that character out and start the level anew at a later date.
-Balance the classes a bit better, whether this is through level balance vs. classes or with the classes themselves.
-Stat increases with leveling, option to increase stats you choose.
-Make items necessary to use - e.g., some mooks should be immune to fists, melee, etc. Otherwise, there comes a point when there is little incentive to use the fancy gun or sword on just anyone.

32133336.review:
Я однозначно рекомендую эту игру.
В чём она НЕ сильна, так это сюжет, (Он присутсвует только в начале (в обучении)), далее ты просто-напросто забываешь его. Хотя, легче будет всё описать в виде таблицы плюсов и минусов:
Плюсы:
1) Огромное количество персонажей (Около 24, вроде бы), которые имеют собственный свойства и способности.
Вор-может втижую украсть что-нибудь у кого-либо.
Хакер - Удалённо получить правление над компьютером, камерой, холодильником (Да даженад ним) и т.д.
Доктор - Правой кнопкой может усыпить весь этаж.
Полицейский - может арестовать кого душе угодно.
Рестлер - поднять и кинуть любой редмет
Оборотень, Вампир... и это только половина списка.
Это всё даёт огромный потенциал в прохождении.
Ты можешь выбрать военного и просто разнести ВСЁ на этаже. Или выбрать хакера, и тихо, идя в углу соседнего здания, взломать компьютер, отключить систему безопасности, пустить газ, а потом просто взять нужную вещь.
2) Генерация этажей, aka, уровней - она случайна. Все уровни разные, включая задания на них.
3) Количество предметов. Их тут просто огромная куча:
  1. Оружие.
  2. Аптечки-еда.
  3. Средства для взлома.
  4. Наркотики.
  5. Вещества, дающие эффекты. (Ярость, увеличение, уменьшение, смятение и т.д.)
  6. Предметы для помощи в уровне (К примеру, проход сквозь стену, картонная коробка и т.д.)
4) Атмосфера. Игра передаёт атмосферу полной анархии, в которой каждый сам за себя, [spoiler] ну это и понятно, государственный переворот - штука опасная [/spoiler]
Минусы:
 1) Есть некоторые баги в поведении НПС, к примеру, если на тебя напал кто-либо на глазах у копа, то коп будет агриться на тебя, что как бы нелогочно
 2) Неестественное поведение. Допустим, ты разбил окно хозяина дома, и вышел на улицу. Хозяин выйдет, и, даже если около тебя 3-4 НПС, он нападёт ИМЕННО НА ТЕБЯ. Вопрос: Почему?
 3) Больше минусов нет, но если придраться, в игре есть система внеуровней игры. То есть, ты на базе. Тебя там никто не бьёт (Типа интерактивное меню), и есть система расчётов Золотыми Куриными Наггетсами за них можно покупать всякие плюшки, а, если учитывать, что получать их довольно легко, то я думаю это читерно. Впрочем, это неважно.

ВЫВОД:
Hitman на минималках

32022194.review:
This is a short review of the alpha build 25.

Streets of Rogue is a top-down action rpg which focuses on playing short gaming sessions with different characters.

Each character has different strenght and weaknesses. The hacker for example can manipulate electronic objects in the game but is weak and not really suited for melee, you need to be stealthy and pick your fights with caution. The soldier on the other hand starts with a collection of weapons to play agressively. You onlya have one life so its important how to play.

The starting point is a hub linke town. This is the place you use to select your character for the next session. It also serves as a permanent place to unlock skills and items. The unlocks can later be found in the following sessions.

If you like games like Dungeons of Dredmore, Sots the Pit, Isaac or similar titles then this game is for you.

32009214.review:
Before I say anything i would like to preface this with the information that I keep involved with this community, creating wiki entries and actively playing.


[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] Can be slow at times, and way to fast at others, generally keeps a good pace however.
[*] Massive amounts of variety in playstyle, with some characters playing in an entirely different way then others.
[*] Multiplayer works pretty consistenty, no ridiculous desync but it still exists.
[*] Early Access, so, so, so much more content on the way for the game, added on top of the variety that already exists.
[*] Active community, Discord Server, Steam Group, Wiki, ETC.
[*] The unbalance can result in wacky and fun situations, usually doesen't cause any value to be lost.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] Really Under/Overpowered Characters and item combos, Water Pistol+Cyanide/Resurection Shampoo.
[*] Lots of bugs, most of which don't break the game, but they do make the experience annoying at times.
[*] Story makes a sad attempt to be edgy and funny, fails miserably at doing so.
[*] Most items need to be unlocked, though it can be done through just playing the game, my 22 Hours still dont have         most of the traits unlocked.
[/list]

[h1]In Conclusion...[/h1]
A great game with an amazing amount of potential with an amazing community and a developer that actively ASKS for player input into the game and has implemented a lot of the suggestions given.

31942643.review:
Streets of Rouge is pretty cool, what with all its characters, features, and possabilities. The interactions are smart and well-programmed, allowing for players to do unusual things, only to find that the AI reacts reasonably to them. The AI in this game is quite well-programmed, and take some real thought to outsmart. The game also happens to look surprisingly good for what it is. The Lighting is very advanced and is quite beautiful.

The game, of course, does have issues, but these are small in number.

Every third level, there is a challenge that makes the game harder. That's fine, but some characters are incompatible with some challenges. There's one that puts a time limit on the level, you have to retrieve two bombs within a small time limit or instantly die. Some characters, whom are slower, or who are meant for stealth, or otherwise, will have a much, much harder time with this. It may even be impossible.

Some may find the combat unfair or difficult, but I feel that these criticisms are unfair. The combat is very much skill based; without enough skill, you may do very poorly. Saying that the game is unfair because of this is petty. The combat is very easy to pick up but hard to master.

I would compare the combat of this game to Nuclear Throne, the core ideas to The Binding of Isaac, and the difficulty, somewhat, to Catacomb Kids. Like in Nuclear Throne, the combat is fast-paced and almost completely based on skill and quick thinking. Like in The Binding of Isaac, your equipment and items will dictate your strategy and approach, your decisions may heavily affect your future, and resources are important, meaning that you must take advantage of what you have in order to succeed. Like in Catacomb Kids, small choices can have large impacts, and simple mistakes could cost you more than you bargined for.

tl;dr/conclusion:

Streets of Rogue is quite literally, the ultimate roguelike experience. Stealth, strategy, and skill come together so well in this game, leaving players with a multitude of choices that complement a myriad of different characters, skills, and items. The AI is incredibly well designed, acting reasonably based on even the most unusual, complex stimuli, while still being predictable enough for the player to make informed decisions and formulate plans based on their actions. Combat flows smoothly and dynamically, providing a natural challenge that is easy to learn and hard to master. Player's choices are as important as the city around them, meaningful consequences resulting from simple decisions, without being so intrusive as to prevent players from acting spontaneously.

The strange, wacky world of Streets of Rogue, in conclusion, can only be described as amazing in an endless number of ways.

31839280.review:
Gorillas. Hackers. Rocks. Refigerators.

And so much more...

I picked this game up from the current Humble Bundle after seeing Northernlion's review of it. It has surpassed my expectations and, in my opinion, has put tinyBuild as one of the best developers in the PC market to date.

Streets of Rogue is obviously a rogue-lite and features many different ways to play. Some of the gameplay is a little luck-based, but that's to be expected from a RL game with seed-generated levels - you aren't always going to be able to accomplish certain tasks with your character, so it makes you have to improvise and adapt. And Streets of Rogue excels in giving you those options.

For instance, you might need to retrieve an item from a safe in a formidable drug den guarded by patrolling goons. You can introduce a chemical into the airways in hopes it will weaken them then take them out one-by one. Or, perhaps it might be better to just sneak your way through, out of their line of sight. Maybe hack a few systems from afar to make their security go haywire, or off completely. Hell, it might just be up to your gusto and firepower to fire a maelstrom of bullets to turn them into a thin red paste and ransack the place.

tinyBuild's developer Matt Dabrowski single-handedly cemented the idea, to me, that RL's are pretty much at the highest quality of they have ever been, and yet he still finds ways of introducing new ideas.

As far as controls are concerned, it's extremely responsive and I've had no lag in combat - which is very good considering that the one-on-one combat is very fast-paced. Think of Nuclear Throne mixed with Hotline Miami in terms of combat speed, and you'll know what I mean. However, I do encounter some lag when things explode - not sure if it's there for effect or if the threading in the code just isn't optimized yet. This is an Early Access review, after all.

Sure, the graphics aren't astonishing - I've never been one to care about that anyway. It's a darker pixel art aesthetic. Totally works for me. Hell, the game runs at a very consistent 60fps on my system, and I'm sure that lesser systems would fare just fine with this.

The music - it's fantastic. Some 8-bit sounds mixed with modern. Fits the game perfectly, like a good cabernet with a filet mignon.

In conclusion, Streets of Rogue is one of the best examples of multi-dimensional gameplay in a rogue-lite. Fans of the genre should point to this as an example of how it's done right with new ideas mixed in. Even in the alpha state, it's completely worth the price tag.

I solidly score this, as an Early Access title, a 9.4/10.

31838055.review:
Streets of Rogue is a Rogue-lite simulation-esc game in which you grab one of a number of characters with unique traits and abilities in order to traverse a town of randomly generated buildings completing missions in a number of various ways. The game currently being early access means it currently has no end but the fina end goal is to kill the tyranical mayor whom outlawed chicken nuggets and dance parties (The madman!) 


Story/Writing: 
The game has little story, similar to other Rogue-lites. In Streets of Rogue you are a resistance fighter against the tyranical mayor, previously mentioned. You must complete missions for the Resistance in order to ascend through the floors from the Slums to the Industrail area to the Park with more to come in the future. (The game currently has 9 floors, 3 of each with the 3rd having an extra surpriise event) 
Whilst the story is lacking, as expected. The writing and humour in the game truly makes up for it. It's quirky, weird and self aware chock with various pop-culture references. It's a game that all in all, doesn't take itself too seriously and I truly love it for that given the way AAA games have seemingly forgotten that art. 

Gameplay:
The gameplay in Streets of Rogue is relatively both simple and complex at the same time. You can achieve your goals in a number of ways depending on the equipment, character perks and other things you have. For instance, if you play the Scientist, you get a bunch of handy sci-fi esc tools to deal with your foes and can identify syringes (Think the pills in Isaac)  This way you can freeze people and use it as either a way to bypass them or use it as a scapegoat. If that's not working,  you may have some syringes or cigarretes or something similar that you can jam into an air vent to do a number of effects but most of all clear out the building or killl them outright. The best one being Rage potion which causes an all out brawl within whatever building you put it in. 
Optionally, if you perhaps are not the scientist (It's very likely when there are more than 20 characters with more to come)  You can brute force the building as the Jock and run straight through the walls of the building (Some walls are unbreakable) or alternatively play a more stealthy option with the Assassin whom can turn invisible orthe doctor whom can put people to sleep or the gangster who can gain a mob of fellow Crepes or Blahds (Crepes 4 lyfe) There are numerous ways you can attain your objectives and the way you do it is up to you.
You can also just outright murder everyone in the map. Or loot everything, or both. You can basically play however you choose. Player Freedom and ingenuity are really at the core of how you play the game. You are rewarded wuith exp, money or other items for whatever it is you choose to do. (Unless you're the cop, you need to be a law abiding citizen)
So basically, go buck wild and have a good time!

Aesthetic:
The Aesthetic is your typical simple 2D sprites with a 3D background being viewed from a top-down perspective. As I stated it's simple but it manages to look nice and clean with little effects here and there to make it more endearing than anything else. Plus the simple nature makes it elatively easy to tell what's going on amidst the chaos that occurs and is sucseptably deceiving for the sheer amount of gameplay that lay beneath the surface. 

Soundtrack & Sound Design:
I had to mention it. It's wonderful. If you're like me, you'll spend 10 minutes per floor and hear the trakc loop numerous times yet it never gets repetetive. It's interesting enough to not become repetitive whilst being equally enjoyable and melodic with various instruments used throughout the game that you dont usually hear i.e Steel Drums. Equally each floor has it's own track so that also greatly aids with avoiding repetiveness.
As for Sound Design, everything acts as it should and you can distinguish what is happening via the sound, little clicks for when someone is alerted, alarms when tripping sensors or cameras and explosions that are truly satsfying. Punching people into gibs or through walls has never been so satisfying! 

Other notes:
The game has multiplayer but I've yet to try it. This is both local and Online. 
The game has plenty of options to turn on and off to customise the flow of the game and such i.e no slow motion or no blood.
Whilst the game is in Early Access, the price is definitely worth the purchase. The amount of content within the game is very vast and the game has a lot of potential for what could be added bot hby the commmunity and the developer himself.
The Developer. He's great. The game has links to the Wiki, the twitter accounts for both him and the artist, the forum, a link to the devblog and a Discord server too. He's very transparent about the game and is very keen to be involved with the community which is great to see. The game also has a feedback form for if you have any suggestions of what you want added or any bgs that you have found. Also, the games part of a humble bundle already which is pretty crazy.
Updates: The game is updated frequently with fixes and new stuff. I'm hoping to see this continue throughout the development of the game and look forward to how the game turns out in the end.

So, should you buy it? If you read all of that and you aren't going to, then I don't think I can really convince you. The game is truly wonderful and refreshing and I hope to see it grow and be a very successful game. 
One of the best releases of the year already.

31813511.review:
The Streets of Rogue can be paved in gold if you manage to swindle, steal, scare, or beat enough of it out of fellow residents. It’s not all about the gold, of course. Sure, it might be if you’re playing as an investment banker, but what if you decided to start as a gorilla? In that case, the streets are probably filled with the dismembered corpses of anyone who didn’t agree with your lifestyle. 

Streets of Rogue is the only roguelike game that allows you to live out a mischievous, pixelated life across several sandbox-style environments as you complete missions that are as deep, or as shallow, as you want them to be. Hack into computers, tell jokes, recruit followers, do drugs, make other people do drugs, set traps, create distractions, sneak around, murder everyone, die trying – there’s no limit. With dozens of character types and a seemingly endless variety of items, each procedurally-generated world is littered with options. It’s also co-op, so feel free to create your own rag tag gang to watch each stage unfold like a wacky buddy comedy. I can’t think of a better way for you to spend all of your free time. Your next life may not be meaningful, but it’s definitely going to be fun.

31782432.review:
If you're a fan of roguelike/rogue-lite games like Enter the Gungeon or The Binding of Isaac, then you will probably love this game. It is like that mixed with GTA, without the mature content, but even more gore!

The many positive aspects of this game include:

[b]Approachability[/b]:
In this game, you are given missions to complete in a procedurally generated city. One of the best parts about this game is the many different ways you can solve one problem by interacting with people and the environment. For example, your mission is to kill this guy. What do you do? Well, you can blow him up with a time bomb. You could hack the turrets in the building to fire at him. Maybe shoot him with cyanide in a squirt gun. There are many ways to approach a situation, and your job is to figure out which one best suits the circumstances and best suits your playstyle.

[b]Diversity[/b]:
Streets of Rogue gives you several characters with several to start out with, and several more to unlock. Each has their own unique traits and abilities to help you through your missions, and all of them play radically differently.

[b]Environment[/b]:
You can interact with essentially everything around you. Every single person, trap, wall, and trash can has the potential to be useful to you in some way. Each level (cities, parks, etc.) is extremely different and challenges you to adapt, overcome, and maybe even use obstacles to your advantage.

All of these three traits tie into what I look for in a game the most: [b]Replayability.[/b]
Every single run in Streets of Rogue is different. Even after you unlock all of the content, there are always things to be learned and new solutions to be figured out. There is an unbelievable amount of content in this game and is already well worth the price in its Early Access. Plus, there is much more to come: more characters, levels, and items, which means numerous more hours of gameplay.

Overall I definitely recommend this game to anyone, even if you're not into these kinds of games. It has quickly become one of my favorites simply because of the sheer amount of things you can do. It's like this game never ends.

31781963.review:
OVERVIEW-
This game is seriously a lot of good fun. Imagine a Rogue-like game with simple yet enjoyable mechanics and loaded with wacky crap that'll keep you busy for hours on end finding new comedic ways to interact with the NPC's and environment. The classes are pretty straight forward yet also fairly unique and enjoyable. What really gets me is that this game is in ALPHA still. There's a good amount of things in it already and with the regular updates that's only going to increase.

CLASSES-
Going into the city you get to choose from a good range of classes with more to unlock. From the cut and dry Soldier, Slum Dweller and Gangster (Crepes) classes. To the more fun and intriguing ones like Werewolf, Assassin and Gorilla. Each class has it's own unique traits and starting equipment. Some have special abilities which really will help you find the best way to complete your objectives

MISSIONS-
As it stands now the missions in each zone are quite limited. It'll always either be retrieve something, rescue someone, neutrilize some folks, press some buttons or break a thing. But they offer a lot of different ways to accomplish these missions so that buffers the lack of diversity to a degree. I'm sure we'll be seeing plenty more in upcoming updates including the addition of a "Big Quest"

ITEMS-
There's a lot of neat items in this game. Shrink rays, haterizers, dizzy grenades, bear traps, gigantinizers and so so much more. Playing around with them all is a lot of fun. And often creates a nice environment filled with chaos to enjoy.

NEGATIVES-
The only real negative things, I have to say about this game are simply because it's Early Access. Them being the lack of diverse missions, enemy types and so forth. But it seems like the developer is set on releasing good updates for it frequently so I'm not worried. The game is very solid and, I can see myself sinking loads of time into it just for the laughs alone.

COOP-
The Coop is solid with good netcode and very little latency issues. As one would expect with this kind of game it add's a whole new  level of fun and replayability to it.

UPDATES-
This game updates very frequently with new items, classes, locations and achievements. The developer clearly loves his creation.

8.5/10

[b] [h1] **Análise do jogo na versão Alpha 24c** [/h1] [/b]

- Eu como um bom fã de jogos stealth, me arrisquei em comprar [b] Streets of Rogue [/b].
Logo de cara me supreendi com a variedade de personagens jogáveis com habilidades únicas, onde todos são desbloqueáveis, existindo objetivos para liberá-los.

Por ser um Alpha e estar tão bem otimizado e trabalhado, com atualizações semanais praticamente:

[h1] 10/10 [/h1]

31758306.review:
Just a super fur fun game. Really really good, solid mechanically and polished in the sense that it feels like a full/finished game even though it doesn't have all the levels yet, which is pretty rare these days.

Blessedly not a Streets of Rage ripoff, but rather it's kinda like Spelunky, if it was top down and sci-fi cyberpunk/dystopia, mixed with South Park-looking characters and silly humour, and much more playstyle choice. Alright, so not terribly like Spelunky on the surface, but it gives me similar vibes. Spelunky - Spelunking + Deus Ex/Neuromancer + South Park + Ska Studio's old free game Survival Crisis Z???

Has that thing where some classes make it like you're almost playing a different game due to them having entirely different abilities and mechanics (the gorilla, vampire, or my favourite, the cop, wherein it becomes a Vic Mackey or perhaps Cartman-as-cop simulator in my experience), so there's a lot to play around with.

Really big bonus: no end to co-op options, from local to online, friendly fire off or on, and featuring every same/split-screen configuration you could want! Actually, just a great options menu in general, with, you know... a lot of options. It's appreciated. 

Developer seems friendly, active, and committed to finishing/updating it, but there's enough game here now to have a lot of fun with. Refreshing and recommended to fans of the genre.

31740211.review:
Hier und da mag ich das Spiel. Dadurch, dass bei jedem Durchlauf zufällige Level generiert werden, entsteht immer eine neue Spielerfahrung. Also so mehr oder weniger. Im großen und ganzen sind die Aufgaben die man erteilt bekommt irgendwo immer wieder gleich. Nur der Aufbau der Häuser ist anders und die Belohnungen sehen verschieden aus. Im Kern sind sie aber immer das Selbe.
Auch mag ich es, dass es sehr viele unterschiedliche Charaktäre zur Auswahl stehen, welche immer verschiedene Präferenzen aufweißen, und man weitere freischalten kann - dafür muss man verschiedene Dinge erfüllen, was zum Teil nicht sofort möglich ist, da eben zufällige Welten.
Das was mich allerdings hier stört ist, dass man viele Level am Ende nur mit Gewalt abschließen kann. Richtiger Stealth ist nicht wirklich möglich, entweder weil man nicht die richtigen Gadgets zur Verfügung hat oder es die Architektur einfach nicht hergibt. Auch sind die freischaltbaren Fähigkeiten - welche am Ende nur zufällig bei Levelaufstieg oder Aufgaben abschluss erreichbar sind - allesamt eher so komplett "meh" und man weiß gar nicht was man mit den, mehr oder wenig, seltenen Punkten so wirklich anfangen soll. Bei mir horteten die sich irgendwie nur, weil ich mit den ursprünglichen Dingen alle zufrieden war und einfach nicht wollte, dass ich nur mehr Dinge zur Auswahl bekomme, mit denen ich doch am Ende nichts anfangen kann.
Aber ja doch, ich kann verstehen wenn man mit dem Spiel über 100 Stunden Spaß hat - selbst im EA, der etwa nur die Hälfte der Story einem bietet. Ich meine, das Spiel ist schön verrückt, bietet immer mal wieder neue herrangehensweisen sowie viele Dinge zum entdecken.
Meinen Geschmack hat es leider einfach nicht so wirklich getroffen. Dennoch bleibt das Spiel, so wie es bisher ist, ganz solide und kurzweilig. Und für eine schnelle Runde ist es auch da, da ein Durchlauf bis zum ableben etwa 10 - 20 Minuten in anspruch nimmt.

You're hungry, and you have a target to eliminate, who is being held captive in a couple of buildings ahead.

You spot a fridge in a locked house.
You hack the fridge.
The fridge charges forward.
It passes through an entire building before hitting a generator.
The generator is outside the holding cell containing your target.
The generator explodes.
The target is free, and very grateful to you.
The owner of the fridge spots you outside his place, and attacks.
You run away, past the target to find where the fridge broke.
The target gratefully sacrifices his life for you, while you eat a ham sandwich.
A passing policeman witnesses the brawl and brutally murders the furious fridge owner.

Target eliminated, you have been fed, and nobody who knows of your terrible deeds is left alive.

Pretty much pure fun wrapped into a great package that's a mix of the mayhem/destruction of the Saints Row games, the roguelike elements of Binding of Isaac/Enter the Gungeon, and the stealth elements of stuff like Metal Gear Solid.  Among probably other things.

It's such a great mixture of all the right things to where you won't even feel disappointed if you don't make it very far, just because you'll be laughing your head off at how ridiculous things can get in each playthrough.  Every class has their strengths and weaknesses and cater to different playstyles, and the way you can interact with NPCs and environments is SO good.  You can get through areas in multiple ways, and creativity + experimenting are often rewarded with some great and hilarious results.  

Oh and this game has up to four player co-op as well.  Seriously for only $15 this game has so much going for it that it's crazy.  Very much worth the price for the amount of chaotic fun that can be had.

31709281.review:
It's definitely not complete yet (being only about 5 levels long, without applying Infinite Mode), but this game certainly shows a lot of promise... and apparently the past six hours have just flown by. :-D

I haven't really tinkered much with the roguelike aspects to it, rather unlocking and trying out different characters than going heavy on unlocking Traits and Rewards, and I haven't touched Loadouts at all. But it seems to follow in the footsteps of Crypt of the Necrodancer, where you're unlocking reward [i]options[/i] (for when you level up, etc) rather than applying the purchased effect permanently to your future characters. 
This ain't a bad thing at all, though it could definitely benefit from a thing whereby you could toggle on/off the upgrades you've purchased, partly so that you're not being offered skills you already possess (such as Backstab for the Assassin) at the end of a level, and partly so that you don't feel like you've hindered yourself by purchasing comparatively weaker abilities early on.

But all-in-all? This game is just FUN.
Again, it's in Early Access, so 'caveat emptor' - but as the development proceeds and this thing gets completed, I have very high hopes for Streets of Rogue. Even moreso when there is enough content to make it worth introducing to friends for co-op purposes. :-)

31694229.review:
[h1]Streets of Rogue -[i] THE best rogue like game i have played![/i][/h1]

Random generated levels and missions are pretty standard for rogue like games but never have they been done so well as this. I streamed my first attempt live on beam and later switched to twitch for the twitch interactions (and some beam issues at the time forced the switch) after the last “just one more life” i realised 3 hours had passed! Usually a first try stream will be 20 minutes to an hour max for uncomplicated games but this was so much fun i just could not stop playing it...i am debating loading it up again now!
The characters that you play as are more than just different appearances they have actual pro’s and cons, do you go for the scientist that can knock people out but refuses to use weapons? Or a vampire who has nothing at the start but a bottle of cologne and the ability to heal any wounds by draining humans of excess blood (i am more the latter :))
What really makes it stand out though is the missions are random too, they follow a similar pattern but they are damn fun to play and you never know what missions you will get and always have multiple ways to complete them, i actually stole an item from a chest after a killer robot fired a missile at me….missed and opened a new “door” in the wall completing a mission...i then used my new killer robot pal to open new doors all over by baiting him to shoot at me :) sadly he eventually hit me...vampire 0 killer robot 1
I completed another mission by knocking on the door of my targets room and when he opened it i shot him with a shotgun...he flew through the wall behind him...AWESOME! 11/10 would use bad guy for interior redecorating again!
Then there is the wealth of traits and equipment, i love being able to put detonation packs on doors, landmines make for fantastic anti following methods and a fast anti death teleporter is a life saver (see what i did there?)

[b]CONTROLS/CONTROL PAD[/b] 
I played it 100% with an xbox controller and it worked an absolute treat. Controls are perfect.

[b]GRAPHICS[/b] 
Many do not like pixel art style, personally i love it so for me it was perfect. I liked the fact you can blow holes in the wall, gib enemies and even use the a bad guy to open new “doors” in walls :)

[b]INTUITIVENESS[/b] 
It is well documented and has a very cool and well done tutorial (you really do need to play it even if you are a master of these types of game it will let you know the humour you are in line for) i need more tinyBuild games in my life if this is a representative of their sense of humour!

[b]PROS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] Different characters have actual pro’s and con’s not just a new skin.
[*] Random levels and missions mean you will not get bored any time soon.
[*] A ton of traits and equipment.
[*] A clear and awesome sense of humour.
[*] Destructible terrain 
[*] Viewer integration on twitch.
[*] So very addictive and fun
[*] Already more feature rich/bugfree/fun then some released games and it is in early access.
[/list]

[b]CONS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] No beam support for integration, shame as with ftl there is no delay in the stream to beam and interaction is kind of the main goal of their API.
[/list]

[b]VERDICT[/b] 
If you like games to be fun and enjoyable then you need to let this game into your life, simple as that. 
Yes i recommend it, 100% whole heartedly.

31693037.review:
Not a fan of the developer's sense of humour. Even if I was, it's overdone and ruined by trying too hard to be funny. The few jokes I thought were genuinely clever completely lost their impact by being surrounded by all the other stupid jank. You aren't subverting anything if the rest of world is bonkers, that's not how juxtaposition works.

I can ignore most of this pretty easily. The bulk of it is in the tutorial and you don't have to repeat that nonsense. The thing that really annoys me is the item descriptions. About a quarter of them successfully convey what the item does and the rest that message is lost in the forced joke and some don't even try. Now before people in the comments complain it's a roguelike, you are supposed to experiment to find out what items do... Bulldonk. 

First of all, at least half the items try to tell you what they do (and half of those succeed). Secondly, this isn't Binding of Isaac with its billions of unique interesting items where you are constantly thrown things you've never seen before that drastically change the gameplay and have immediately noticeable effects. 

Also to clarify I'm not talking about the syringes either, the one thing in the game that you are obviously not meant to know what they do until you identify them. Also, explain to me how you are supposed to figure out having a four leaf clover in your inventory increases you chance to win at slot machines by exactly 3% so you can use that information to weigh up if you want to keep it using up an inventory slot or not? Explain to me how that's going to be fun. It's just sloppy tooltip writing.

Speaking of the writing you are supposed to be some big hero of the downtrodden saving the city blah blah blah, but you are actively encouraged to murder everyone, scumbags and innocents alike. There is nothing wrong with being able to kill everyone, grand theft auto pretty much gets by on how fun that is. But it's less fun if you feel like you are supposed to be doing it without consequence. There's no slap on the wrist, you don't feel bad for anyone you are killing. They are just walking pinatas that need to be busted open for their weapons and cash and the free bonus experience they bring. You aren't obligated to, but if you aren't murdering every non-hostile in sight then you aren't playing optimally. 

My other major criticism of the game is the pace of the combat. It's clearly going for the Hotline Miami fast paced mayhem vibe. But it's not as visceral or frankly suited to it. Enemies take a lot of beating to take down and the way combat works if you both use a melee attack at the same time they bounce off each other. The AI isn't consistent with its attack timings and it doesn't telegraph so you are mostly just guessing engagement distances to try to predict the timing of the key frames and then you mash the attack button wildly to see if you were right. The high speed pacing does nothing to add to this except make it feel more like futile button mashing without any strategy. But that's okay the game has mutators that let you customise such things to suit yourself, so they have a mutator that lets you turn the speed up by 30% for even more spastic flailing or... Oh wait, that's all. You can't slow it down and have a more thought out tactical experience.

So that all sucks. How come I recommend the game? 
Because in spite of all that, the game is still fun though.

It is an inherently fun game. There's a lot of design choices I disagree with but in spite of those, the gameplay is solid. It's easy to get into, there's plenty of unlocks, abilities, character classes and game modes to keep you coming back and once you do know what the items do the amount of flexibility they give you to your playstyle or for mucking around is great. Whether you just want a short escape to jump into a game and screw around for a bit or you want to settle down for a while and slog away at completing runs and unlocking new abilities, this game delivers. Even on the more invested side of things, you can spend a good hour working on a run and die to a dumb explosion, rage quit, go check facebook, have a snack, get bored and immediately come back and jump back into the game half an hour later like it didn't happen. You are starting over from the begining but the game is that easy to pick up and play and enjoy along the way that it doesn't matter. That's pretty much backbone of any good roguelike right there.

And at the end of the day, sometimes, just being a fun game is enough.

31672643.review:
Streets of Rogue is a blast to play.  You choose a character with predetermined skills and items (soldier, doctor, etc) and are set out in to the world to solve quests and cause mayhem.  The levels and quests are randomized and you truly feel like there are so many ways to solve any situation.  I had a ton of fun backstabbing with the assassin or chloroforming with the doctor; there is truly a lot of promise here, albeit not a whole lot to do with only 2 worlds.  A lot more features are promised and I really hope this game continues to grow as it is VERY FUN.  HIGHLY Recommended!

PROS

+ Randomized levels with randomized objectives keeps things fresh
+ Tons of items, traps, NPCs and factions to interact with
+ Varied characters with useful traits allow you to solve quests in many different ways
+ Witty writing and humor
+ It's a blast!

CONS

- Only 2 areas available at this time
- Aiming melee attacks with mouse & keyboard is sometimes tricky
- Purchasing upgrades between runs feels shallow (items and skills are added to possible rewards)

31662748.review:
This game is only in EA and still way better than most games get after release. I love it and can fully recommend this game, even if it were to stay like it is now.

Pros:

- Objective based levels which are randomely generated
- Multiple classes with special traits
- Factions (some AI characters can either become your friends or foes. They can also start fighting each other)
- Countless different (interactive) items and consumables
- Different possible approaches to clear levels depending on character played (kill everyone in your path, stealth your way through, clever use of items, piting two gangs against each other, ect)
- Unlockables
- An amazing OST
- Beautiful pixel art
- Smooth and easy to figure out controls
- Multiplayer (haven't tried that yet, though)

Cons:
- I don't really like the special random levels for each third floor (bombs fall from above, radiation, chased by a killer robot, riot). It sounds funny the first time you see it, but most are just annoying. The Ai also goes bonkers on those floors too because it doesn't understand what's going on.
- Currently it's very short (but it has many characters so it has a great replayability value)

31569853.review:
[h1] Streets of Rogue [/h1]

DISCLAIMER: I received this product for no cost for the purpose of reviewing. However, this does not affect my views and opinions of the game.

Streets of rogue is a pixel-style rogue-lite title by developer Matt Dabrowski and published by tinyBuild. The objective is to traverse each procedurally generated city until the end in order to find and kill the mayor. The game also features cooperative play, both locally and via the internet. The title has a comedic theme both in game-play, dialogue, and story-telling. The game also has RPG elements as well as action, brawler, and stealth game-play mechanics, all of which depend on the player's play style, and the class they choose. 

--------

[b] Graphics: 8 / 10 [/b] 

Art is very subjective, especially when it comes to pixel-style games. Streets of Rogue has very charming visuals, and even has good effects and animations. All classes have their own design so when things get hectic on the screen, it's a little easier to distinguish the player from the other characters. That being said, things will still become visually cluttered at times, though this is to be expected due to the chaotic nature of the game. Each city is procedurally generated and as the player advances to each new city, the buildings and terrain designs will change depending on the type of city. The game should run fine on any low to mid-tier system, as it's not very demanding on the CPU or graphics card.

--------

[b] Sound: 8 / 10 [/b] 

The sound effects of the game are decent, they get the job done, but where the sound assets really shine, are within the game's soundtrack. The music within the game is great. Composed by Craig Barnes, the soundtrack has very funky, dance-y, blood pumping tunes for each stage of the game. The music very much fits the theme of the game, and is also very well done. 

--------

[b] Mechanics: 8 / 10 [/b] 

The base mechanics of the game are pretty straight forward. The character moves around with the arrow keys, uses their equipped item with the left mouse button, activates their special ability with the right mouse button (if they have one), and uses the number keys for items within the hot-key bar. Things will get a little more complicated depending on the class that is chosen. Classes have their own benefits as well as disadvantages. The different classes will have different traits, abilities and starting items that can really affect the way the game is played. New classes can be unlocked by completing certain objectives. The player will level up by completing various tasks, and will be able to choose new traits upon doing so. 

The game ends when the player dies but progression remains in the form of "chicken nuggets". Nuggets can be found throughout the game and are a form of persistent currency. They can be used to purchase new traits, quest rewards, starting items and other upgrades at the resistance headquarters/main hub. There are also mutators within the game can can be toggled to further change the game-play experience.

Each stage has objectives the player must complete in order to move onto the next area. These objectives are also randomly generated. Usually, the objectives have many ways to complete them. When an objective involves another character or NPC, the player can bribe them, trade with them, threaten them, or just straight up kill them. Some missions could also involve escorting an NPC or sabotaging a building. The player can also recruit other NPCs to fight alongside them. 

There are many items within the game that do cool and crazy things. Knowing when to use certain equipment or tools does have some strategic thought involved. That being said, almost all terrain is breakable, and almost all NPCs can be interacted with (or attacked). 

--------

[b] Final Personal Remarks: [/b]

The game is a lot of fun. I can't wait to see what else comes out of their early access in terms of content for the game. As mentioned earlier, the soundtrack is really good, and I also recommended getting the OST for it. The OST isn't complete, but will continue to add tracks as the game adds content and new stages. Co-op seems like it could be a lot of fun with friends, though online play might be a little too hectic. This is because without proper communication, I feel like everyone would be all over the place and uncoordinated. The game does receive consistent updates and is overall a fun experience.  

Thanks to Matt Dabrowski for giving me the opportunity to review the title, as well as anyone who took this review into consideration, I hope it helped.

31483460.review:
I wasn't sure if there would be enough content in this game before I bought it...
But I found out I was so wrong after I did.

It's a extremely charming Rogue-lite game. I haven't been able to put it down since I started. I haven't had the pleasure of playing in its either (Local 4 player co-op) or its (Online 4 Player Co-op). All my game time has been in single player, and even alone I'm having a blast. The game makes fun of itself in many instances that are sarcastic and humorous, its minimalistic design keeps it simple enough to understand for pretty much anybody. If you value gameplay over graphics then this is a fantastic game for you. There are SO many ways already to tackle all the different missions you'll be given. The levels are randomly generated based on a seed system.

The custom seed system has not yet been implimented but the option is already there (Coming Soon) so that tell's me it's right around the corner. The game has a similar unlock system as Enter The Gungeon. As you complete missions and level up your multitude of characters (20 as of this review with more to come), you will earn chicken nuggets which you can unlock new rewards and traits with in your 
"home-base/Headquarters" to aquire in your up-coming future playthroughs.

As I said, there is alot of content here already. The developer seems to really love his game and I can see that in the game itself. It has quality. I am excited to see what the future holds for Streets of Rogue.

31480836.review:
Streets of Rogue - ахуенный рогалик. 
Начнем с плюсов:
+Абсолютно разные персонажи: от персонажа зависит стиль игры: хакер может взломать систему и к примеру пустить газ в помещение. Военный перегружен оружием и взрывчаткой, и готов убивать все что видит. Оборотень может вселятся в чужие  тела, но его пиздят копы и выгоняют из магазинов, потому что он голый. Вампир невидим для видеокамер и может пить кровь, но стандартные аптечки и еда не восстановят его здоровье. И это лишь несколько примеров, персонажей много, и они уникальны. 
+Огромное  кол-во способов выполнить квест: чтобы пройти на следущий уровень, нужно выполнить 2-3 квеста, которые как и уровень генерируются случайным образом. Часть способов зависит от персонажа, другая часть от ситуации и предметов. Необязательно убить всех на заводе, чтобы открыть нужный сейф. Можно вырезать окно стеклорезом и аккуратно, пока никто не видит, украсть содержимое сейфа. Необязательно убивать самому НПС, можно натравить его на другого прохожего, или попросить об этом местного бомжа (не бесплатно естественно). 
+Мы не в подземелье, мы в городе: обычно действия классических рогаликов проходит в подземельях, но тут у нас улицы города. Местные жители живут своей жизнью, и не собираются сразу вас убивать, если вы не будете их провоцировать. Это позволяет проходить уровни, не проливая кровь. 
+Разрушаемость: здесь все рушится, и не только от взрывов. Что мешает протаранить стену телом противника, дав ему по ебасосине битой? Или увеличить себя до гигантских размеров и пройтись по улице?
+Саундтрек: музыка отличная, не мешает, и ее нравится слушать. 
+Неприятности: каждый 3 уровень вас ждет какой-нибудь пиздец, к примеру,на вас будут падать бомбы (что поможет пройти некоторые квесты, без вашего участия), за вами может охотится робот с ракетницой, или каждые 20 секунд будет проходить волна радиации по улице, и надо прятатся в здании.
+Мутаторы: они позволят еще сильнее разнообразить геймплей. Мутатор "Туннельное зрение" не даст вам видить сквозь стены, вы будете видеть то, что видет персонаж своими глазами. Мутатор уменьшающий всем hp, включая игрока, сделает игру динамичнее, но и сложнее. 
Минусы:
-Ранний доступ: автор игры часто выпускает обновления, но все же стоит заметить, что в игре нет даже половины запланированого контента. 
Оценка: 9/10.

31411149.review:
This is going to obviously be a very rough comparison but I feel if we WERE to compare it with games at a very basic level, I'd say GTA 2 with a blend of Gungeon and Hotline Miami, it is FRECKING amazing. 

Don't get me wrong YES it is early access currently and YES there are bugs and it's imcomplete as with any early access if you don't understand that look it up.
What I like: 
*20 Classes to choose from all feel different (except for maybe the two gang member clones).
*Levels are RNG similar to how Gungeon generates its levels.
*4 Player online & Local co-op makes it even more fun.
*Perks (like RPG perks I guess? extra health, hard to notice etc when you level)
*Hyped up chiptune music
*Mutators (pre-made ones but with future ability to make your own soon)
*Blowing s**t up in a gooey red mess (I love gibs I'm old school ok lol)
*Some classes have to be unlocked I like this, I don't think everything should be available off the bat.
*Daily missions; for example I had to play as the doctor with a massive reduction to my health and could die super easily.
*Leaderboards for times/the daily mission coming soon.

What needs to be added/fixed:
*More gamemodes (currently the normal with/without co-op and the daily mission, though there are the mutators)
*Some Sync optimization while doing online co-op (it's not terrible but it's not perfect).
*More areas, there are I think 2 levels? (I'm going off achievements here) right now;
in each area there are 4 generated levels and each increase with difficulty, don't get me wrong this takes awhile to get through having permadeath with increased difficulty and events like [spoiler]crazy nearly unkillable robots and radiation attacks that nearly insta kill[/spoiler] help prolong the gameplay but more levels do need to be added in at some point

If you're kinda on the fence about it even though the reviews are generally good and you're iffy about early access I can understand that there's been quite a few failures on steam but I think this does have potential, just alone that Tiny Build are backing Matt (madguy90, aka the dev) is amazing and it really shows and I feel like it'll shine through on the final product. 

He's pulling out updates on a biweekly basis, he tweets stuff out, there's always patch notes which I personally like.

TLDR:
At the current state I'd give it a 9/10, my reason being there's always improvement and completion to be had. Matt(the dev) deserves the backing IMO.

If you're Iffy about it he has a 'demo' of sorts, on Itch IO there's no time limit and you can try all the classes below (restricts daily quests and co-op online, allowing only 2 local co-op):
https://madguy.itch.io/streets-of-rogue

I personally played the demo for 3 hours and basically played out the Futurama meme IRL of Fry saying shut up and take my money so if you play the demo and like it I encourage you to help back it by purchasing on steam also.

31408305.review:
(Alpha 23)

Streets of Rogue... Ce jeu que j'ai acheté parce que je me faisais chier, et dont maintenant je guette les MàJs tous les jours.

On est face à un "petit" jeu rogue-lite, graphismes pixels, bourré d'humour et ce du tutoriel jusqu'à la description du moindre petit objet, ou au moindre dialogue avec un PnJ auquel vous parler deux fois et qui cependant n'a pas été négligé.

Streets of Rogue, c'est aussi un jeu dont les possibilités sont infinies. Et c'est assez perturbant, puisque le jeu est trèèèèèès loin d'être au stade final du développement. Cependant, deux nombreux personnages aux gameplays variés sont déjà présents, et plusieurs approches sont possibles pour régler vos problèmes ou accomplir vos missions. 
Par exemple, pour s'emparer du contenu du coffre d'une banque, vous pourrez tenter de vider le bâtiment en y envoyant du gaz pour accomplir votre méfait tranquillement, faire exploser un mur (ou possiblement la moitié du quartier, on est pas à ça près) et accéder au butin, ou encore massacrer toute forme de vie dans le bâtiment, prendre les clés et les codes sur le corps en bouillie du banquier, et vous servir tranquillement.

A l'heure où je rédige l'évalution, deux environnements sont disponibles, et un troisième arriver bientôt. On passe donc de bidonvilles miteux et remplis de clochards et petit trafiquants locaux à une zone industrielle aux pièges retords et aux usines vaguement douteuses (Je suis pas certain de l'origine de la viande qu'on voit passer dans certaines d'entre elles.).

Pour finir, le jeu bénéficie d'une traduction française tout à fait honorable. Par conséquence, même les plus hostiles à la langue de Shakespeare n'auront aucune excuse pour ne pas acheter ce jeu.

Conclusion : Matt Dabrowski est un putain de génie, et je continuerai de torcher son jeu au fil des MàJs.

31387345.review:
A Ninja, Wrestler, and Gorilla walk into a bar. That may seem like the start of joke but that situation is more than possible in Streets of Rogue.

That is the beauty of this title and its mad genius. This game is all about stories, ones you craft and that are usually insane in nature. Vampire Frank and his horrible cocaine addiction. Dr. Dissmelfunay(It’s Belgian) and his constant need to chloroform everybody. Perhaps something more “normal” with cops and robbers. It’s all there and Streets of Rogue wants you to play it with every toy in the toybox.

If that doesn’t sell you alone, then the news that you can play with up to three friends online or local co-op should. Now suddenly that Ninja/Wrestler/Gorilla combo can happen and probably will make a vicious team. To quote Bixby Snyder, “I’d buy that for a dollar!” Okay technically fifteen dollars but that’s beyond the point.

Dr. Dissmelfunay was my character and the start of an hilarious adventure into Streets of Rogue. I choose Doctor as my class primarily as a challenge unto myself. What could I get away with and how far could I go before somebody put a stop to my insanity? Turns out, pretty damn far! Why was this a challenge? Well, the Doctor class is a pacifist, which means he cannot use any weapons at all and his stats weren’t the greatest. He received double the bonus from using medkits, an item I found twice in my whole run. Finally his coup de grâce was his Chloroform which instantly knocked out enemies. It was his ace card and only attack aside from fisticuffs.

The good news is that most of the NPCs in Streets of Rogue are rather trusting and naive. Why is a stranger knocking on my door? Next thing they know I’m raiding their fridge for all the beer and sandwiches I can. Its morally wrong, but hey I’ve got to survive for the Resistance. Between selling weapons I didn’t need and robbing everybody in sight, I made it rather far and almost to the current end of the Early Access. Plot twist was that Streets of Rogue has modifiers that throw in chaos, such as riots, radiation flashes and robots with rocket launchers. What finally did in old poor Dr. Dissmelfunay was that there was three massive bombs to disarm in five minutes. Turns out the Doctor wasn’t good at breaching and entering quickly and thus his adventure ended.

That is the joy of this game though. I had a blast every minute, coming up with new ideas and strategies to use to get my missions accomplished. As the Doctor I had to think outside the box and use poisons, hire hoodlums and sometimes just beat the crap outta somebody. Did I die? Yes but I had blast, literally.

Speaking of the Resistance, the game has a new intro/tutorial since hitting Steam Early Access. Developer Matt Dabrowski was obviously in a snarky mood when he wrote out his tutorial. You are applauded for such things as following basic instructions. Beating someone to death and unlocking a door which makes someones head explode from excitement. In all it concludes with the death of two resistance members, which is terribly anti-productive, but you get the idea.

The story is fleshed out a bit more as well introducing, “The Mayor” character whom I am sure will have something to do with the big mission that we have been promised for a while now. It’s cute and all very tongue in cheek.

The reason this is all becomes so important, is the introduction of the Resistance base. It houses most of the new features. Streets of Rogue has now given a bit of progression to all aspects of the game such as unlocking classes. Accomplished with simple tasks like using only your fists for three levels. There are also chicken nuggets! That’s not a typo. Chicken Nuggets are currency you earn in game to unlock new traits and loadout/reward items back at the base. Letting you fine tune what you start out with or what kind of random skills/items you may come upon while playing the game.

The base also houses the Mutators, which is by far going to give the game some longevity. Mutators allow you mess with the game rules by giving everybody low health, disasters every stage, no weapons, rockets only. There is also an endless mode. You can also create your own Mutators for some chaos and fun. Other features that are present but locked off are the Create a Character feature. At this point, it’s purely conjecture, but I am very excited about this idea. Being able to perhaps choose negative and positive traits to form some unique classes sounds like a blast, especially if you can take those into online play.

Online play itself right now is a hit and miss. While the game does have a listing showing who is playing and whether their game is private or public, connection issues are standard and the game is suited probably best for playing with a close knit group of friends. This may change before the game hits final release. There is also a “Seed” npc which I imagine will allow you to share with others for Binding of Isaac type of action. This feature is currently locked as well.

Finally on more of the development side of things, Streets of Rogue now has a publisher, Tinybuild. This is fantastic news for the future of Streets of Rogue as this gives the developer more time to focus on finishing the game. While I may be a bit biased towards Tinybuild for whats it worth, they’re an excellent publisher and I have worked with them many times. You may know Tinybuild for publishing amazing titles such as Punch Club, The Final Station, Clustertruck, and Speedrunners.

The future is looking bright for Streets of Rogue, if you are on the fence about whether or not you want to get this game, I highly recommend it. As it stands in its current Early Access state, I have played this game many, many times. It’s well made and the developer is constantly taking feedback. I just can’t wait to see the final product and lead the Resistance to victory or more realistically blow everything up.

Over the past couple of years, I was afraid that my love for gaming was going away forever. I'd buy, download, play anywhere from 15-45 minutes and sporadically, or never play again. Streets of Rogue has single handedly reaffirmed my love for gaming. I cannot put it down. 

It is similar in some ways to Roguelands, another excellent roguelike game, but this one is a top down "3d" view where Roguelands is side scrollers. This game also has a lot of charm to it. Has a very retro feel (which as an old fogey I love). Each class has its unique skills, some better than others. 

I believe the game goes for 14.99, I got it on sale for 11, and, had I known how good it was, would have been willing to pay double the current price. This is a rare early access that's good enough as it is. 

Some people complain that it's easy to beat, and fear replayability, but I see it differently. For starters I can't even get past the first world (there are currently 3, and are going to be 5 or 6 total) and I already have 8+ hours in the game. WAY more than 15 dollars worth. 

Plus since the game is simple, that means there is an insane amount of room for improvement, the potential is through the roof. not to mention the inevitable mods. I can't wait to see this game get better and better. My favorite game in at least 3 years.

Do I recommend it? Absolutely. If you enjoy retro games, roguelikes or the combination of the two, you can't possibly ask for more with Streets of Rogues. To put it simply, I absolutely love it. 

I need to alt tab back to the game now, it is so f'ing addicting.

31312998.review:
Of all of the many, many, many roguelikes that have been published in the past half-decade Streets of Rogue is more faithful to the Great Old Ones (NetHack, ADOM, DC:SS) than all the rest in one key aspect: lateral thinking. Most older roguelikes had some element that would force the player to look through their inventory, their skills, or the dungeon itself to find a way to get around an enemy that was too powerful to defeat. [u]J[/u]umping over a pit trap you found earlier, [u]D[/u]rinking from a fountain and hoping desperately that it'll do something to save you from the angry horse that's been chasing you down the corridor, or [u]Z[/u]apping the right wand at the right time. There was always at least one moment (and if you played as a Tourist, every moment) where fighting the monsters was just not the right move.

That's something that seems to have fallen by the wayside in the new generation of roguelikes, but it is central to Streets of Rogue's gameplay. Each stage gives you a set of missions to complete, and often these missions don't require you to kill anyone. Have a mission to steal an object from a building full of armed guards? You could always kick in the door and try to fight them all, but you could also tamper with the air conditioner to spread a sedative through the building. Maybe you could decide to knock on the windows, and then sucker punch the guards one by one as they come to check out the noise. Maybe you've got more money than you really need, you could hire a few of the hobos around town to follow you around. When they fight the security guards, you sneak through the fracas and steal the object.

Streets of Rogue evokes the days when a roguelike meant a game where every key on the keyboard was a command, but it manages to keep everything contained with context menus and a mouse-interface.

I haved 100%d the game. Here's what I have to say.

Streets of Rogue is a top-down rogue-like that's full of absolute anarchy. The levels are randomly generated, and you can complete your missions however the hell you want, so long as you have the materials and/or abilities. If you're a hacker, you might hack someone's wifi-enabled fridge and make it "run", which will make it literally run and destroy a wall. Then you may sneak in and grab the item you need to retrieve. Lots of great jokes too, like upper-crusters saying "I don't understand. Why can't the poor just eat the other poor?". You really can't find anything like this game. The developer is also very active, releasing updates every two weeks since I bought it. He also listens to the community and reads bug reports (and of course, fixes them).

Great for co-op, too. We need more couch co-op games.

31217665.review:
[h1]Finally an amazing early access game[/h1]

Streets of Rogue is an amazing Rogue-Lite game with many unique ideas. You make your way through randomly generated maps with randomly generated tasks while it's always left upon you how to approach them.

[b]Gameplay[/b]

At the beginning of each playthrough you must pick one of many different characters which have a big impact on the way you will play the game as each of these characters have unique abilities and advantages. 
Let's take the doctor as an example,
when playing as the doctor you are unable to wield any weapons but you can disable people from behind with clorophorm. This forces you to focus on stealth instead of relying on weaponry like you probably would with the soldier character.
After picking your character you enter a randomly generated map with many different buildings and npcs while most of the npcs are representations of the characters you get to choose from. There are also objectives randomly genereated for  each map which vary from "eliminate this guy" to "rescue that guy". Most tasks can be solved in different ways. You can use violence and just kill everybody or you could persuade or bribe people to get to your objective. The freedom of choice in how you tackle your objectives is what makes this game so great in my opinion.

As of right now there is a little lack of content as there are only two different areas playable but there are more to be added. The content right now offers enough replayability by giving you the possibility to add mutators and play daily challenges.

[b]Soundtrack[/b]

This game offers unique and good soundtracks varying for each stage. Nothing bad to say here in my opinion.

[b]Performance[/b]

I'm playing this game on the following specs:

Gigabyte GTX1070
I7-3770
12 GB DDR3 RAM

It runs smooth most of the time. I've encountered some performance problems in the Industrial area when there were too many effects and particles at the same time visible on the screen.

I can't say anything about the multiplayer as I have not tried it yet.

[b]Conclusion[/b]

Awesome game for anybody who loves Rogue-like games. It's already worth playing even though it's still in development.  Just try it out for yourself!

31185685.review:
As of this review, the game is in Alpha build 21. Please keep that in mind.

Streets of Rogue is a randomly generated floor to floor top-down pixel art roguelite. In a market flooded with games with strikingly similar premises, Streets of Rogue sets itself apart by giving you an unrelenting amount of freedom in the way you choose to tackle the objectives you're given each level. This "Nuclear Throne meets Deus Ex" gameplay meshes very well with the variety of characters to choose from, from the pacifist Doctor, to the rutheless (and illiterate) Jock, assuring each run will be wildly different from the last if you swap characters. 

How have I gone this far into the review without mentioning the co op. The ENTIRE game is playable with up to 4 people, and is honestly the best way to play the game, in my opinion. While some characters may be a bit lacking in singleplayer, they excel well with another player to fill in your shortcomings. Absolutely a blast. My favorite thing about Streets of Rogue is probably the dedicated developer. Matt Dabrowski's passion for this game is unparelleled, with frequent updates and constant community reachout. Seriously, any indie dev should look up to Matt as inspiration. Overall, Streets of Rogue is a fantastic game, whether you're alone or with friends, you're bound to have a good time.

If you're unsure if you should or not buy it, I recommend you do. I was unsure too; I don't regret it.

31172093.review:
Right now, i have 9 hours and will increase over time because this game is great. The game is a nice take on the rogue-like genre making and open world game that gives you more freedom in the way you do things and when you want to. This is also increased with the fact that you have many different characters that are very different and have specific traits that others don't have. There a character named the doctor who has a trait where you can chloriform people from going behind them and then theres a character where you hack technology from long range; I recommend you hack a fridge. It might be running away; also the variety of items and how you can get them in-game is great; even though I really hope the creators add more variety in missions because you either kill someone, "retrieve" an item, destroy a thing, and thats all really. This also added to the slightly same maps almost every playthrough.

Many times I have seen maps with similar to basically the same map because there is quite low quality of enemy bases, homes, stores, and other places that if had better, different sized, and randomness; the freedom you have to do the missions would be used better and in many ways. Giving a more fun and satisfying feeling when doing missions. This would also help all the characters be played on an equal playing field; the thief is so good in this game! It can go through wall and get into areas that you aren't allowed to go into super easily and this I don't like that its so much better almost every other class. The wrestler, the jock, the hacker, the doctor, the cop and the vampire; just some classes that seem to have a harder time to do the things that the thief, assassin, and shapeshifter do better when they for their core weren't made for that. This can be fixed with more opportunities to interact with characters and better map design. Which I completly feel that the creator is doing and continue to update this game. Though theres one more thing to talk about; the multiplayer that highly increases the fun of the game and fixes one of the problems I spoke about.

The problem that is fixed is that many characters become viable in the multiplayer environment because the game makes characters synergize really well and fun. This is because with multiple people more actions are possible to get some of the classes to work well. I can give a great example of this; me and my friend Terra played together and we really like stealth and gameplay where we don't get caught. So we did a two man team of of thief and doctor. Now, you might be saying "wait isn't the thiedf really strong like you said" yes, yes it is but, we used the strength of both of these classes to make them work. So Terra knocked on the door of a room, I waited and when an enemy i walked behind them and chloriformed them. This is way better than waiting for them for the person to turn around because they close the door and you can mess up the trait. There are many synergies in this game and you can have up to 4 people in the game so its crazy how strong classes can be alone and that's why I really like the multiplayer. So from the great things about the game and the problem here should you buy the game? Get it yourself and see if it is and review the game; no one is the same andI just told somethings of the game but, if this review did make you think of buying it, support the game and right a review because we; the customer are the one that will make quality and fun in our games so hopefully you lie the game and have fun gameing people!

31084487.review:
Positives - A unique indie experience with a developer that updates and communicates with purchasers frequentely. 
+ Intelligent A.I.
+ Rewarding experience
+ Versatile list of characters
+ Unique Indie gameplay
+ Details matter and make sense
+ Developer is open, honest, and responds(frequentely) to the community he has created/Encourages critique so he can add some of those very opinions to his game.

Negatives - Still in Alpha, be prepared to feel lacking in content after 10-20 hours.  
- Expensive for the amount of play available
- Still in Alpha(what can ya do?)
- A few minor bugs

Overall - This is a fun game for those seeking a retro-indie experience.  It has great potential and the developer connects with his community quite often, he doesn't leave us hangin; in fact, he will often take his customers opinions into great consideration when expanding depth to the game.  

If you're short on cash and looking for something to hold you over for the next 6 months, I would probably hold out for a bit on this one.  I play a lot of games and have put more years(by the seconds) into playing games than any addict would like to admit, but being that it's only in Alpha I was blown away by the amount of detail put into it so far.

Fingers crossed that this is the game that breaks the Early Access curse that developers nowdays tend to stop at more frequentely than not.

31078477.review: Ce jeu est excellent ! Il est certes en accès anticipé, mais déjà pas mal complet. Il est très régulièrement MàJ (toutes les 2 semaines si mes souvenirs sont bons). Je ne suis pas fans de ce genre "gros pixels" mais comme je le dis à mes potes, "à ce niveau, c'est presque du Pixel Art" (ce n'est pas vrai du tout, mais honnêtement, c'est joli), tout est généré aléatoirement et est très cohérent (bon ok, quelques ruelles sont juste des impasses inutiles, mais pour les bâtiments c'est nickel) et tout ou presque est déstructible. Je ne me suis jamais ennuyé sur ce jeu, bien qu'il soit arrivé que j'ai trouvé un peu de répétitivité dans les activités, mais eh ! Accès anticipé, les gars ! Il est déjà bon, il ne manque vraiment pas grand-chose pour qu'il soit très bon !

31074648.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VzuucgsnlQI

[h1][b]To jedna z takich gier, do których non stop chce się wrócić na 5 minut, by pograć 55 ;)[/b][/h1]
[b]Więcej - http://broda.tv/[/b]
Wygląda prosto, nie? Ale w prostocie tkwi zajebista mechanika. Świat składa się z pięter, jak lazania - tak mówią nam we wprowadzeniu śmieszkowe pikselowe ludki. Na czele tego świata stoi burmistrz, despota, tyran i paskudnik, który zakazał jedzenia kurczaczkowych nuggetsów (to forma najwiekszej waluty w tej grze). Nasze zadanie? Jesteśmy członkiem ruchu oporu - mamy dostać się na szczyt świata i zlikwidować tyrana. Niestety tutaj gra ma zgrzyt - pięter jest (chyba) coś koło 6. Po 3 na "piętro" - każde z nich jest nieco inne i trudniejsze. Na każdym piętrze mamy wykonać parę zadań - np. kogoś uwolnić, zabić, zdobyc lub wykraść jakiś item.  Co fajne - jest to miks rogala, miks skradanki, trochę rozwałki, trochę na rozkminę. Ogromną zaletą jest wiele klas postaci o świetnie przemyślanych unikalnych perkach, swoboda zabawy, nieprzewidywalność oraz możliwość gry w koopie. Jeden z najlepszych indyków tego roku :-)

怎么玩，由你选！不想滥杀无辜？没问题！想入侵电脑？满足你！
随机生成的世界和超高可玩性保证 600 小时的游戏时间，绝不会无聊！说真的，出门看看吧！！
超先进人工智能，绝不容忍你的废话！用谋略战胜这些虚拟人类，羞辱你的电脑！
扮演超过 20 个（而且还在不断增加）完全迥异的角色！酒保、科学家、黑客、大猩猩。嘿，说不定还有你的职业呢！
种类极其繁多的道具！缩小射线、催眠器、手提音响、捕熊夹、食物处理器…….. 噢，还有枪当然，少不了各种枪械。
4 人在线模式和本地合作模式，让你尽情蹂躏暴徒，告别孤独！
带领黑帮、解放奴隶、大口喝酒、撕碎幽灵、变成吸血鬼，用道具将人类变小并践踏他们。这是史上最疯狂的多元化游戏。

30904923.review:
这款游戏玩了将近二十小时吧。我就说说我自己对这游戏的看法吧
好的方面：
自由度很高。
BUG几乎没有。（反正我没看到过什么BUG）
人物方面还是挺多的。（当然对于这些刚刚出不久的游戏来说）
联机的时候可以让自己没有那么寂寞，至少有人陪你一起死。

不好的方面：
这游戏玩多了会感到乏味（这游戏由于关卡太少，很多人玩了几小时就通关了。假如是全成就通关最多也就十多小时）
由于游戏性过低，我感觉价格有点略高。假如官方能增加一点人物啊，或者关卡，我相信这游戏一定会有很多人买的


灾难
暴乱：不管我的事，没看见我没看见我（捂脸）

辐射：简直让人崩溃，快要到达电梯就。。。

机器人：神烦，一言不合就轰我旁边的发电机（同样让人崩溃）

还有一个灾难不知道叫啥，谁知道的回复我一下啊。（可能没有第四个，知道的小伙伴告诉我一下）



总体：
这款游戏适合平时工作压力大，可以拿来泄愤、休闲的一款游戏。不推荐长期玩。（因为玩久了很枯燥）













（这是本人第一次写评论，大神勿喷）
