30874536.review: Streets of Rogue is probably the best "hybrid" rogue-like I have played to date. I would have lost my marbles if this came out when I was a teenager. Even with a limited amount of levels at this point in development, not only are all the elements of long term playability present, but a game of 5 levels can be a long and interesting afffair. A lot of games that have the rogue-like tag in their description claim that all kinds of "wacky" things can happen. While this can be true, a lot of those games rely on some serious skill and dedication to game mastery in order for that to happen. While I am certainly one who is capable of that due to years of playing rogue-likes and hybrids, it can be frustrating to have to do so in order to enjoy a game when one is on a busy work or life schedule. Streets of Rogue is interesting and allows for a quick understanding of the mechanics but will play out into a varied and multi-faceted experience the more you immerse yourself in the game. The light hearted, seemigly instant gratification element of the game doesn't hide, but precludes an already highly developed game with much to do and many possibilites. I look forward to the continued development and will continue to play. Some pros: 1. Action is balanced and fun. Traits and items play into your success, but your reflexes play an equal part. As of now, the game doesn't skew you one way or another.  This is optimal. 2. Classes present a somewhat unique experience and reward you for tailoring gameplay to a particular class, although you always have the option to just fuck everything up if you're fast enough not to die. 3. The home base with permanent or semi permanent upgrades and the chicken nugget currency are not an original addition to such a game, but a welcome one that will certainly reward multiple playthroughs. A list of cons is not necessary, because I don't really have any complaints worth mentioning. This game has more packed into early access than a lot of AAA games do on offocial release. Great job.

30859278.review:
A very fun top down pixelated Roguelike.

The game itself is quite simple to play, but has a lot of depth to it. You can play the stealth role, sneak into places, crack safes, pick locks, cut your way through windows... you can also drop a cyanide pill into an air conditioner to murder everyone in the building. Never said stealthy had to be pacifistic.

Combat is super fast paced, but not all that complex. Melee is basically a lot of moving around, trying to get into range and hit the enemy and then backing off so you're not hit in return. It can be quite hectic when you've angered several NPC's at once. Guns are a lot more dangerous and require quick reflexes to try and avoid (though something like a shotgun will generally hit you regardless). All weapons have limited uses, with melee weapons breaking after a while and guns running out of ammo. A big part of the game is figuring out when combat is worth the risk.

There are various missions that you will get on each stage. These can involve stealing an item (either from a safe or an NPC directly). Rescuing prisoners. Destroying targets. Sometimes it's simple, other times you'll spend ages trying to figure out how to get around security. Completing missions earns you rewards, failing them simply ends them. To complete a stage you have to finish or fail all the missions given. Though there are sometimes secondary objectives as well.

There's a lot of characters to unlock and choose from. Each having their own strengths and weaknesses. Characters each have stats they're better or worse with, and often some sort of useful special ability, along with some quirks. Who you pick will be a big part of how your game progresses, however there will also be a lot of situations that change how you play based on items you find in game (finding a bunch of lockpicks will let your soldier put his gun aside for a while).

All in all, the game is quick and fun and has a lot of replay value (as most Roguelikes tend to). Definitely a good game to pick up for those who like the genre.

30859104.review:
I'm a fan of Binding of Isaac, the replayability of a game is important to me, so I got this game with that in mind. Having different characters with different skills sets, procedurally-generated floors, and plenty of humor were all positives.

On the other hand, it did seem a little too easy for a roguelike game for me. Certain characters seem to be a little unbalanced to start out with, making at least half of the run, of not more, too easy to muscle your way through.

Regardless, I'm a fan of how it is as an early access game and I'm looking forward to playing it as it continues to develop.

30845288.review:
A really amazing top-down roguelite featuring a wealth of items and a ton of unique playable characters that each support their own playstyle. Wander through the city completing objectives and looting or purchasing equipment, and then use it in creative and sadistic ways to advance through the levels. 
I was hooked the moment I put an electro pill into a building's air filter system, causing those inside to shock each other. The lone survivor of the zappening ran out of the building and attacked the first person he saw, who happened to be a random passerby. Classic.

The game's environments are rendered in crisp, detailed pixel art, and the character art though of lesser quality has its own charm. The sound design is great, making each shot and thump feel nice and heavy. Though its an early access title, there's already enough content and variation in each run to play over and over, and updates are being added to the game at a healthy pace.
If all that isn't enough, it features full online multiplayer so you can share the laughs.

Would recommend to anyone who enjoys roguelites, top-down shooters, stomping through cities as a giant ape, and/or fun.

30816323.review:
[h1][b]Full Video Review:[/b][/h1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sqlzEcAiC3Q

[h1][b]Streets of Rogue – First Impressions / Review[/b][/h1]

•	[b]Steam:[/b] http://store.steampowered.com/app/512900/
•	[b]Title:[/b] Streets of Rogue
•	[b]Developer:[/b] Matt Dabrowski
•	[b]Publisher:[/b] Tiny Build Games
•	[b]Platforms:[/b] Windows, Mac, Linux – Future Rlease on XB1, PS4, Switch
•	[b]Release Date:[/b] Early Access March 10, 2017
•	[b]Price:[/b] $14.99

[h1][b]Introduction[/b][/h1]

A corrupt mayor, an underground resistance, and a slew of crazy characters. I’m Weise, aka Thomas, and I’d like to welcome you, to the Streets of Rogue, a new game developed by Matt Dabrowski and published by Tiny Build Games. Available on Steam for $14.99, together, we can join the resistance and take down the mayor in this action-packed, co-op, rogue-like experience like no-other.

[h1][b]Storyline[/b][/h1]

You are a member of the resistance, a semi-organized group of rebels trying to take down the corrupt mayor and take back the city. After running a campaign full of deceit, the crime rate in the city has skyrocketed and the resistance wants to bring back order, by any means necessary. You cannot let anyone get in the way of your cause as you travel through the Streets of Rogue.

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]

The typical flow of the game has you progress floor by floor through the city, in a procedurally generated world. Each floor will assign you a random set of missions to complete that could include murdering someone, acquiring a specific item, rescuing a prisoner, or more all in order to help the resistance with their cause. You must use any means necessary to complete the mission, making use of whatever special skills your character has.

You start each round by picking a class that you’ll use until you die. These classes include both typical and VERY, untypical characters. For example, you can play as the soldier, a class that starts with various weapons and armor if that’s your play style. Or maybe you prefer to take a stealth approach with the Hacker, tampering with computers and using your hacker skills to benefit you. Perhaps you’d rather be a gorilla and just smash everything with heavy melee attacks. Truly, this game lets you play however you like as you approach each scenario you’re given, assessing the situation, and determining the best route you want to try to take to accomplish the goal.

As you complete certain achievements, you’ll unlock additional characters too. For example, if you bribe a certain number of cops, you can unlock the police officer as a playable character. I found this to be a fun way to get me back into the game for replay ability, trying to tackle one or two character unlocks each run. You earn a currency that looks like a potato based on the progression you made in each run as well that can be used at the home base or HUB area to unlock more skills, weapons, and mission rewards to use in the future. Truly, it’s a fun gameplay mechanic that just doesn’t get old.

Finally, to wrap this section up, the game allows you to play with up to 3 other people in a co-op medley. Combine your skills to form the ultimate team and be able to handle any situation that comes at you.

[h1][b]Visuals[/b][/h1]

Visually, this game isn’t too much to look at. It’s very much a pixel-art game and though its done decently, there’s nothing that set it apart too much for me. Some of the character customization is fun to play with, and the character classes themselves have some extra detail, but in the current version of the world the environments felt a tad more lacking for me. Due to the nature of the procedurally generated levels, it’s very easy to see the various textures and patterns being reused to form the buildings. This isn’t necessarily a bad thing, and really is quite expected, but it is something to note.

I will say that I found the procedural generation to be great however, in that rooms of all different kinds, sizes, etc were found in each playthrough and every floor which really added to the environment of this scummy city you are trying to free.

[h1][b]Audio/Dialog[/b][/h1]

The soundtrack for Streets of Rogue is pretty fantastic, and you can actually purchase it as DLC in the Steam store for $2.99. It fits the feel of the gameplay perfectly. All the dialog in the game is text-based, but the sound effects for the various weapons, doors, glass breaking and more really are great. Voice acting in a game like this isn’t really needed, but the script writing they did for the different interactions is actually quite good. The tutorial at the start of the game sets the tone, full of humor and jokes that continue to come up throughout the game. Overall, my expectations in the audio department weren’t too high and I was pleased with what I found.

[h1][b]Replay-ability[/b][/h1]

There are a lot of unlockables in this game, and its still in early-access. I’ve mentioned the unlockable characters, but you can also unlock weapons and gadgets for rewards from missions, various traits for when you level up, and much more. Additionally, there is a plan to allow for seeds to be entered, daily-runs for leaderboards, various mutators which will change the way the game is played, and a create a character feature to allow you to create your own custom class.
The mutators alone change the gameplay drastically. You can handicap yourself with things like “melee only” or just change the game up by having all the citizens riot in the streets. Combine this with the procedural generation and multiplayer and you have a game you can come back to over and over.

[h1][b]Overall Wrap-Up[/b][/h1]

Overall, I really like Streets of Rogue. At the time of this review, I have eight hours into it and have unlocked almost all the characters. I have plenty of traits and mission rewards to unlock still and have only scratched the surface of testing myself on daily runs or with various mutators turned on. For $15, the Tiny Build name behind the publishing, and the ability to play with up to three of my friends for even more mayhem, I cannot recommend this game enough if you are even the slightest bit a fan of rogue-like RPG action games. Let me know what you think in the comments below, and check out my other reviews from my playlist. If you want to see me play this game, I’ll be streaming it from time to time at Beam.pro/WeiseGamer. That said, thanks for watching. I’ve been Weise, aka Thomas, and I’ll see you in the next video.

30797994.review:
Holdet i firmaet tinyBuild Games er virkelig inde i en god stime. Det er svært at stoppe et selskab der er så villige til at tage chancer med de mest mærkelige spil. Den seneste titel der kommer fra selskabet er Matt Dabrowski’s mega RPG action brawling stealth shooter Streets Of Rogue.

Du vælger ud fra stort udvalg af forskellige figurer, der enten kan blande sig,- eller skille sig ud fra menneskemængden. Du starter din mission i et slumkvarter og blive bedt om at udføre et sæt missioner for at rydde området. Disse kan spænde fra at indsamle informationer, til at befri fanger, eller fjerne den lokale narkobaron der husere i kvarteret. Spillet kombinerer en masse forskellige aspekter. Til at starte med indeholder spillet flere RPG elementer, det sker bl.a. i form af levels som din karakter stiger efterhånden som du får fuldført forskellige missioner. Dette vil resultere i mere health gennem din exp, som du skal bruge for at kunne blive længere i kamp og få mere erfaring. Det er også et spil der indeholder brawler elementer, som udtrykkes kraftigt med alle de forskellige våben du løbende samler op og alle de slagsmål du kommer i, som oftest involvere mange mennesker. Der er bestemt også store stealth elementer i spillet, som fx når du får adgang til udstyr der gør det muligt at hacke de forskellige computere og servere, der alle kan indeholde informationer der kan bidrage til at du når dine mål. Alt sammen er pakket dejligt ind, i det der ligner et klassisk 16-bit dungeon crawler spil.

Samlet set er Streets Of Rogue faktisk et ret fedt spil. Der er meget her for at elske. Dialogen i spillet er underholdende eftersom at du bliver behandlet som en ægte ballademager. Mit problem med det at dø er klart spillets minus, men samtidig giver det også den slags udfordring, som kan provokere de mere hardcore spillere til at forsøge at gennemføre spillet med en karakter i et enkelt forsøg. Plus der er en masse forskellige karakterer der kan låses op for, alle med deres egne særlige færdigheder, så der er helt klart masser af genspilnings muligheder hvilket absolut forstærker mine positive tanker om spillet. Spillet er værd at prøve hvis man kan lide nogle af de genre som spillet arbejder med.

Førstehånds indtryk af min oplevelse af spillet kan findes her:
https://youtu.be/2HgAUceeOrs

30741366.review:
Great game, but not for $14.99.

I'll do another review after more features have been released. However, with disregard to the unreleased features considering this is Alpha, here is what I have to say:

Pros:
- Every level is randomly generated so you'll never feel like you're playing the same level over and over again
- It's not a pay-to-play game. Thank Bruce Almighty
- You have good amount of options in character choice that you get to unlock and play. (Compared to "race" in other RPG's that determines player skillsets)
- Humor. Great reason to play a game. Type? Not a professional of literature, comedy, or entertainment in general; but I'd say satire, juvenile(child-like humor), morbid, and other uncanny things. Ex. You taking a giant pill, walking through a wall, and everybody exploding when you punch them. Satisfying and hilarious lol
- Mutations keep the game interesting after you've defeated much of everything. Similar to Bungie's Halo skulls in campaign where you can turn a feature on like "Cowbell", giving "more bang for your buck", or in other words bigger explosions.
- There's so much randomly unconceived and unperceived wackiness. I wish there was more commentary to the game besides the tutorial and pixel-bubble story line. 

Cons:
- Because it's still in alpha, many features aren't released, but I don't know if you would or wouldn't include this as a con or a side note.
- If you're playing by yourself, it isn't much fun once you've unlocked everything
- Character customization is moderately limited in cosmetic features( i.e. hair, hair color, facial hair )
- Unlocked all the characters, except one, in under 2 hours. Should be irritatingly difficult to get ALL characters unlocked. Also, you can't customize all of the characters.
- The skills you have to unlock with "nuggets", or what I'd like to call expendable skill points, are limited. There's the cool idea of unlocking 2 abilities which reveals a locked ability, but right now there's less than a double digit number; 

IMO
- Sadly, once you die you must restart from level 1-1. I don't know how far the levels go up to because I've only reached 2-x, but I wish there was an option or feature to begin where you've died or started off last in the base. If there is this feature. WHERE?!
- Girlfriend didn't want to buy the game because it was too expensive. I don't want to buy another game because it's too expensive (for what it is)
- fun game overall. I'd buy it if the price was lowered, on sale, or a dozen or so more features were added making it playable for long periods of time alone.

Довольно годный рогалик , который стоит своих денег, что редкость для нашего времени. 
Из минусов:
1. Баги ( простительно т.к. их быстро фиксят, да и игра еще в раннем доступе )
2. Маленькое количество оружия 
3. Однообразность заданий. На каждом уровне задания практически идентичные. У меня было такое, что за весь ран на каждом уровне задания были полностью одинаковы.

Для себя больше минусов пока не нашел.

Из плюсов: 
1. Обширное количество персонажей, которые не похожи друг на друга, которых еще будут добавлять и добавлять.
2.  Свобода действия в способе прохождения миссии. К примеру надо украсть вещь из магазина , дверь к которой преграждает прилавок, за которым стоит продавец. Можешь убить его, можешь отвлечь его на улицу каким-либо способом, можешь вселиться в него, можешь тупо взорвать стенку с улицы и зайти внутрь , можешь вырезать в окне дыру и попасть в комнату с этой вещью и так далее.
3. Довольно хорошая задумка с усложнением прохождения. К примеру может быть "БУНТ В ГОРОДЕ" все друг друга убивают и тд. Или "РОБОТ-УБИЙЦА", который стреляет в тебя ракетами и ходит за тобой по уровню так еще и к тому же бессмертный , но медлителен.
4. Генерация мира полностью рандомна.
5. Количество различных вещей в игре довольно большое и продолжает увеличиваться с каждым патчем. 
6. Игра ПОЛНОСТЬЮ и довольно качественно переведена на русский язык
7. Игра с юмором.
8. Ну и хочется добавить что только в этой игре стенку, которую нельзя никак сломать , будь то даже С4 (самая сильная взрывчатка в игре) можно проломить человеком, которого ты пнёшь в ту сторону, только в этой игре можно надеть прицел и глушитель на огнетушитель и многое другое по типу этого 

Вывод: если вы любитель рогаликов, да даже и если не любите их покупайте эту игру без раздумий, так как поиграя в нее вы их полюбите !

30718069.review:
Alright.
Good game.
Lots of Potential,
But also fun as it stands.
Decently Long review coming up.

Unlocked all the characters a few hours ago. (I have plenty of time offline) last ones for me were the Bartender and
Blahd (red) Gangster... although I wasnt exactly trying to get them.  Shapeshifter is my favorite.    

Characters all have different traits, ranging from l33t hacking skills, Recruiting more people, stubby fingers that cant operate firearms, Being a "scrawny nerdlinger" who's easy to push around, and also a "Drug-a-lug" who knows what all of that good stuff does... there's more- but that's a decent summary.

A few charaters even have special skills, like ramming enemies, tossing objects, telling jokes, camoflage to hide from pursuit, and all out possesion of the npc's.

Gameplay wise-

You have to progress by completing missons on each floor, after that you are allowed to exit through the staircase.
The missions are all pretty simplistic such as "Retrieve an item" or "Neutralize a Target" and  "Free the prisoners."
But the variation comes in when you choose your method on to accomplish your goal, and it's fun to experiment character traits might effect that even.

Only 2 zones for now, but also still has "endless" for if you want to keep going, there is also disasters at the end of each zone, like the killer robot who wants to hunt you down or the periodic radiation blast that can kill anyone who stays outdoors a bit too long, and the bombs falling from the sky that oddly only fall when your around. Just my luck, amiright?


All in all, I would reccomend it, but if you want to wait that is fine, as the game is still pretty early in.
has pretty frequent updates, but it's just one guy to my knowledge so content wont be added THAT fast.
It does have multiplayer, both couch co-op and online multiplayer, if you're looking for that.
I feel like Im leaving something out, and I'm not quite doing this game justice.

It's pretty darn fun, try it.

Rédigée le 24/03/2017. 
Ce jeu est une merveille, loin d'être fini mais je ne m'étais pas tant amusé sur un jeu solo depuis longtemps. Ce jeu est super fun, chaque perso a sa façon d'être joué, en jouant à ce jeu je n'ai pas vue le temps passé. 
Le jeu est riche en contenu et cela ne va pas s'arrêter ( j'espère ).  
Je pense que pour le moment une dizaine d'heures de jeu suffiront à tout débloquer, je vais tester ça et ré éditer cette évaluation. 
Si vous jouez avec un toaster votre pc pourra faire tourner le jeu tranquillement mais je pense qu'une fois que la guerre et le bordel dans la ville commence votre petit proc aura un peu de mal mais ce jeu reste merveilleux. Pour 15 euros le fun que ça apporte est dingue.
Il y a également un mode coop que je n'ai pas encore testé mais qui doit offrir de nouvelles façons de jouer et ça donne énormément envie ! 
Envie de rigoler ? Envie de tout faire exploser ou vous la jouer Mr Robot ? Foncez !
Edit : Après 8/9 heures de jeu j'ai terminé le jeu dans l'état actuel. Chaque persos jouables sont un délice à essayer, bien que le jeu soit bien plus simple avec certains que d'autres. Gros coup de coeur pour le docteur et le ninja.

It's simple:
you can't buy happiness but you can always buy this game. It's not much of a difference. This game is a roguelike, when you dead, then you dead. People dead when they are killed right?

Gameplay:
You pick a character with different set of skills, depends on what you choose, e.x a gorilla is a tough character, lots of health and delivers massive raw power. You could just smash everything that stands your way to your mission, but it couldn't speak english, so you couldn't hire someone or buy something.

The main objective of this game is to clear every levels. There are missions in a level, you must complete them all in order to advance. There are lots of ways to get it done. You could sneak past the guard and free the prisoner as mission asked, or ask no question and just hack away those guards, or poison them, hire someone to make ruckuss to distract the guards. There are many many possible way to complete your mission. Use your creativity, ideas, and lil' bit of evilness.

Score:
9/10 , it's a good game. It's in early access but I'm sure you can enjoy the content as is.

30645459.review:
"Each level of the city consists of a diverse variety of buildings and locations. There are shops, bars, prisons, gang hideouts, arcades, homes, slave shops, and more. It is more akin to something found in an RPG or open-world sandbox game than your average roguelike.
That similarity to open-world games extends beyond the environments, and into the gameplay as well. When you enter a given level of the city, you are assigned a few tasks, which can vary greatly. How you accomplish that task is entirely up to you. Like an open-world game, you have complete freedom to do as you wish, and there are numerous ways to accomplish any given task. Each level is basically a small sandbox in which to play. If you have to free a prisoner, for example, you have a variety of options at your disposal. You could go in guns blazing and kill the abductors, or hack into their security system to unlock the cells, or bribe them with money or alcohol, or pretty much anything else you can think of.

Of course, your best course of action will probably depend largely upon your character/class. There is a pretty large cast of diverse characters to choose from, some of which must be unlocked by meeting certain criteria during your playthroughs. Each class has unique attributes, skills, starting equipment, and strengths and weaknesses.  The soldier, with his health regeneration and arsenal of weapons, lends himself to an aggressive playstyle. The doctor, on the other hand, is better served by avoiding combat due to his inability to use weapons, although he can sneak up on people to knock them out with chloroform. The investment banker starts with a large sum of money and has the ability to borrow more from any merchant or shop owner, but also has a drug addiction that constantly drains his health until he gets his fix."
...
(S)treets of Rogue is a fresh and inventive take on roguelikes. It shares as much in common with the likes of Deus Ex as it does with, say, Binding of Isaac, combining elements of roguelikes, RPG's, and even open-world games. The distinctive setting and environments, the diverse inhabitants of the city and the fact that they aren't hostile by default, and the open-ended nature of how to approach any given situation, combine to make it feel like something new and completely unique. I've enjoyed every single foray that I've made to The City, and i plan on making many more."

Please check out the full review at:   http://thecrankymessiah.com/streets-of-rogue-review/

30627830.review:
https://smartpcgaming.com/streets-of-rogue-review-2017/

On the surface Streets of Rogue seems like a mixture of GTAIII, Deus Ex, with the graphics of the original Zelda series, but what makes the game truly stand out is the fantastic and hilarious game play.  The game has unlimited possibilities and opportunities, which gives you endless ways to attack each mission.  Each level is randomly generated so you will never play the same level more then once.  I was giving an Alpha edition to review so all the missions that I was given were randomly generated without any actual story line to follow.  Story line or “Big Quests”, as they are called in the game are going to be appearing at a later date, which makes the depth of the game at this early stage in development that much more impressive!

The staggering number of options that you have at your disposal is one of the major aspects of this game.  Items that you can pick up and use, the ridiculous ways you can approach a mission and the many different ways you can interact with your environment, give this game a depth and replayability that is often not seen in Indie games. The other critical aspect of the Streets of Rogue is the emergent nature of the game play.  This is because of the fantastic AI characters.  They all act on their own, which creates many different situations for you.  The way they interact with the player, the environment and other AI characters leads to truly hysterical moments.  Streets of Rogue has done an incredible job combining both of these elements which leads to an amazing game with endless situations and endless game play.  You have so many different ways to approach each situations and every one of them is challenging, and most importantly loads of fun

streets of rogue
streets of rogue
At it’s core, the goals of the game are pretty simple: On each floor, you are given 2 to 3 missions. These appear on your map screen, and there are a variety of different objectives that each mission can be comprised of. Each floor is almost like a small town, with a variety of different buildings filled with all sorts of things, and each individual mission will always be given it’s own building. Once you’ve completed the required missions, you can then access the elevator that takes you to the next floor. Each mission also gives you a variety of possible rewards, and some floors will contain a character that can offer you a totally optional mission as well.

Missions differ in how they work, including ones that have the same objective.  For example lets say your current mission involves neutralizing a character.  The character could be inside of a well protected building with guards, cameras, and trip mines or he could simply be a shop owner and just be sitting behind his desk.  Your first thought would be that the shop owner is an easy kill, but he probably has a high powered shotgun at his disposal, as well as other thugs in the store.  You blow up the walls and come in that way, or you could use stealth or maybe even become a vampire and bite him from behind.  The opportunities are endless. Your schemes will not always work out. There are loads of people in this bizarre city, each with their own agenda, and they can often screw up your plans in ways that you never expected, bringing you new troubles and causing chaos, adding to the emergent nature of the game play in a very dynamic and fun way. And you have tons of different ways of interacting with all these characters. Hire some goons to do your dirty work, or even bribe the cops on the current floor to ignore your crimes for awhile, among tons of other options.

When all else fails, pure combat is the only answer!  Thankfully, the shooting/combat system in Streets of Rogue is fantastic.  You move your player with the keyboard while the mouse acts as your aiming sights.  This concept gives you versatility while running away or strafing your enemies, while still allowing you to fire back from any angle.  There are numerous melee weapons to use.  The normal ones are there such as punch, knife, and bat, but you can also come across battle axs, swords, police batons and many more insane weapons. The same can be said about all the guns in the game there is a huge variety of guns and most are way over the top!  You also have the ability of using grenades, land mines and other explosives.  These explosives add aspect to the missions because they allows you to blow up most walls, giving you straight path to your objective.

streets of rogue
streets of rogue
You gain XP for completing missions and many other things.  Gaining XP allows you to give your character a new trait.  These traits give your player different abilities ranging from paying less at the store, to making ugly faces during combat which ends up scaring your enemies.  You can also activate mutators that change the game in a huge way.  These range from having very low health to other crazy ideas like no ammo.

The character selection is very diverse in the game and allows you many options.  You could play as a soldier, who has extra health and many guns or you could play as a doctor who isn’t allowed to use weapons. My favorite character is Dracula, his signature trait allows you the ability of biting other characters to regain health.  Each character has a different feel to them and changes your approaching significantly.  Fortunately they are all a blast to play with and it truly shows the creativity of the developers.

Streets of Rogue is a fantastic game that I would highly recommend. It is currently available thru Steam early access and I very excited to see what other amazing features the devs come up with!

La progression en rogue-like est vraiment agréable. Il y a de nombreux personnages à débloquer et chacun offre un gameplay unique. Vous pouvez y jouer de manière casual ou non, de manière violente ou non. À vous de choisir !

Le(s) développeur(s) regardent activement le forum de discussion et sont capables de faire des changements en temps réel. Je recommande vraiment ce jeu, spécialement pour son humour et le gameplay agréable.

30622998.review:
Streets of Rogue es uno de los juegos indie de Acceso Anticipado más divertidos que hemos probado. Tiene tanto, pero tanto por hacer, por ver, muchas cosas por experimentar a la hora de realizar misiones, cosas muy chistosas, diálogos que nos harán reír, es simplemente fantástico.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=upZTWlJ3MjM

Streets of Rogue es un título rogue-lite que se centra en la libertad del jugador para hacer lo que quiera a la hora de enfrentar los distintos escenarios, un juego de acción,  de arte en pixeles, creado por una sola persona al que se le nota el esfuerzo puesto con el único fin de entretener a los jugadores.

El desarrollador comenta tener inspiración de títulos como The Binding of Isaac, pero dotando al jugador la posibilidad de jugar como quiera, le deja experimentar utilizando las distintas mecánicas, con elementos de rol (al estilo Deus Ex) o creando un caos total (un poco de GTA) destruyendo cosas o haciendo añicos a quien se le ponga en frente.

Todo esto, sin tener calabozos, en su lugar tenemos ciudades generadas proceduralmente totalmente funcionales, coo una IA muy bien trabajada, con NPCs que se dedicarán a hacer sus actividades diarias normalmente. Para progresar, el jugador necesitará completar desafios o misiones específicas, claro, de la manera que considere conveniente mediante el uso de las habilidades del personaje que elija -podemos escoger dentro de una lista de hasta 15 personajes, cada uno con habilidades especiales, artículos distintivos de su estilo, con la posibilidad de desbloquear nuevos objetos y ventajas al final de cada nivel. 

La pequeña trama del juego nos cuenta -mientras nos enseña como jugar, cómo fuimos aceptados como miembros de la Resistencia, un grupo local que se ha levantado en contra del nuevo Mayor de la ciudad, un personaje vil, que nadie quiere. Tras el tutorial que nos muestra los conceptos básicos del juego (en poco tiempo) con mucho humor, que nos hace ver lo divertido que sera este titulo, somos enviados al cuartel general de La Resistencia, estando en dicho lugar, podemos comenzar a jugar.
 
Hablando de nuevo de los personajes, podemos escoger entre muchos, además de sus habilidades, podemos cambiar su aspecto físico, su estilo y color de cabello, tipo de bello facial, o el color de la piel. 

Aprender a jugar es sencillísimo; el juego tiene una vista top-down. Después del tutorial nos explican que la ciudad está construida “en capas como una lasagna”, y que debemos empezar nuestra cacería (o golpe de estado) desde “abajo”, en los barrios bajos, hasta llegar a la parte high class, en la cima de la ciudad, donde se encuentra el Mayor. Existen modos multijugador, local o en línea, aun que de momento, el juego en línea no es funcional.

Lo mejor de Streets of Rogue es la cantidad de situaciones en las que podemos meternos gracias a que cada mapa tiene muchas casas o edificios para buscar objetos, dinero, cajas fuertes, y muchos personajes no jugables que andarán por ahí, dispuestos a darnos una mano, o a sucumbir bajo nuestras garras, las posibilidades se limitan a la imaginación del jugador.  Entre los NPC’s, encontramos científicos que nos ayudaran a identificar objetos raros que encontremos por ahí, nos toparemos con “comerciantes” que venden sustancias ilícitas, las cuales nos dan pequeños pluses en las habilidades a la hora de realizar misiones.
El modo multijugador es probablemente lo mejor.

Algunos edificios pueden ser habitados por mafiosos y si queremos entrar a lootear ha de ser por la fuerza, o simplemente por diversión aunque no sea parte de nuestra misión. Hay muchos NPC’s con los cuales pelear e interactuar, algunos otros también nos pueden dar misiones secundarias si hablamos con ellos. Cada misión realizada satisfactoriamente otorga recompensas como dinero, objetos o habilidades.

El elemento principal de rol viene con un sistema de experiencia. Obtenemos XP tras realizar distintas acciones, como matar a alguien, robar cosas, encontrar “objetos interesantes”, y rescatar NPC’s (hay algunos atrapados que no forman parte de nuestras misiones principales) por comentar algunas, incluso uno que otro personaje no jugable se unirá a nosotros para luchar. A estos que se nos unan podremos dotarlos de armas, curarles si le necesitan o pedirles que monten guardia en ‘x’ lugar; aquellos que nos acompañen nos harán compañía hasta que mueran. Dentro del mundo de Streets of Rogue hay cosas que duelen, pero nada como ver morir a tu amigo NPC, ese puñado de pixeles coloridos que te acompañó durante una hora mientras tirabas balazos y golpes como si el mañana no existiera – D.E.P. Gorila.

Hubo un momento dado en el que decidí usar al personaje del gorila (se vuelve jugable cuando lo rescatas!) para jugar,  cada vez que intentaba hablar con un NPC no podía y me saltaba un mensaje que decía “no sé hablar Español”, tremenda sorpresa, delirio de realidad y lógica en el que me vi envuelto, pues no podía hablar con los comerciantes para comprar munición o comida, ni conversar con mis compañeros NPC, porque obvio, ningún gorila puede hablar -Dah, fue realmente chistoso caer en razón. Incluso, este peludo personaje no puede empuñar armas porque sus dedos son muy grandes.

Tenemos tantas variables con las cuales divertirnos en Streets of Rogue, si queremos podemos comer una banana, y darle uso a su cascara para que algún pobre transeúnte o un enemigo caigan y se debiliten, cuidado, podemos caer nosotros también.

Lo más preciado en el juego son los nuggets de pollo, alimento prohibido por el alcalde después de que un dolor de estomago causado por una de estas deliciosas comidas le hiciera pasar un mal rato. Así que si encontramos nuggets, tendremos literalmente: oro. Los rasgos y habilidades especiales se desbloquean con los nunca bien ponderados nuggets. Dependiendo del personaje que escogemos, podemos llevar mas o menos inventario, usar o no armas, etc.

La rejugabilidad del juego es alta, esto en parte debido a que cada escenario es generado proceduralmente, teniendo niveles diferentes en cada nueva partida. Por otro lado, parece que las misiones principales en cada nivel no varían mucho, lo que hay mucho son posibilidades de realizar las mismas de la forma en que queramos. Lo probamos con con teclado y ratón, pero también se puede jugar con mando.

El juego tiene de todo, en algunos niveles hay ciertas mecánicas que cambian el juego, de ejemplo, existe la de radiación, dicha inclemencia en el ambiente envía radiación a lo largo del mapa que nos hiere, y sólo podemos evitarla entrando en edificios, recordando que algunos edificios no podemos entrar porque son de criminales recelosos con sus propiedades, causándonos problemas si entramos en el edificio con dueños equivocados. Esto hace del juego un corre por tu vida super divertido e hilarante si llegas a entrar a alguna casa “prohibida”. En Streets of Rogue, como en cada juego de su genero, una vez morimos, empezamos de cero.

Haciendo un recuento a modo de conclusión, la diversión en Streets of Rogue está asegurada, un juego independiente creado por una sola persona (Matt Dabrowski), al cual se le ve un buen futuro, siempre y cuando Matt haga las cosas bien y haga crecer su juego. Si te gustan los juegos como Hotline Miami o el mismo GTA, pues entonces Streets of Rogue también te puede gustar. De momento se encuentra en Early Access  de Steam, a un precio de $14.99 y una puntuación de “Muy Positivo”.

30621208.review:
I wish I could give a neutral review. Meh.

Let's start with the trailer. I hate it. The premise that this is not even "a", but "the world's only" co-op shooter action roguelike stealth brawler rpg. Brawler, just because you use melee weapons? Shooter, just because you use guns? Action, does that not simply mean "non-puzzler"?

The Steam store description isn't much better. The "This new game I [b]is inspired by[/b] <insert classics everyone will know>", which feels like a scam every time I read it. Most of the time games that say that don't deliver.

And indeed, I never felt it was worth comparing to those games. When Single Playered, the game is mediocre at best. There are many different playstyles, but the character+whichever valuable drops you get+the semirandom levelups dictate which playstyle to use.

It shines in MultiPlayer, even though I merely glimpsed at the possibilities there, and this is also what sets it apart from the referenced games. Just like e.g. Broforce, the game gets stale very quickly when alone, but dicking about with your friends makes anything more fun.

TL;DR: Get it only if you reliably have a group of friends to play with. Local is even better. Even then this is steep, get Hammerwatch instead, that has a 25% off four-pack version. Any game full-priced in EA is another red flag...

I love this game.  It is an amazing gaming experience.  I like the graphical style.  The environment effects are visually pleasing.  The audio is great.  Deep bass in the explosions.  My wife complained and made me mute it... and she's generally very tolerant.  You want explosions?  Boom, it's too much even for coolWife.

The structure of the game is very appealling.  I like the starting balance... some classes are available, others unlock.  You progress through the levels in a very engaging manner.  Open world.  Go at your own pace.

Quests are fun.  I started as a homeless drifter, stalking other individuals as they wandered into the dark alleys of the procedural generated world.  Using my fists, I gain access to their inventory. BAP BAP BAP... for three dollars and a banana.

Cold world.

I tried the warfarer class.  "CoD class" essentially.

One of my missions, I was tasked with eliminating three or four targets in what looked to be a hospital.  The doctors.  They had to go.  Presumably over prescribing opioids in rural America.  I tried to place a land mine for the first time and ended up throwing it across the room at the person behind the front desk.  They got startled, briefly, but didn't become alarmed, as the land mine didn't blow up or appear to be much of a threat.

I got right with my next try.  I set that sucker up in the door way.  One of the doctor's assistants actually set it it off.  The thing blew up and took out half the main entrance.  Environment destruction.  Top notch.


Even just talking about this game now, I feel like I'm having fun playing it.

30601311.review:
Hot dang this is a cool game. I didn't understand what it was at all before buying, but it's definitely up my alley.

Basically, you're thrown into a level with several missions (rescue this person, kill this person, retrieve this item), and they can be completed however you see fit. Literally any way you want to. If you want to be a soldier, you can just shoot everyone on the level. If you want to be a ninja, you can sneak past people and backstab targets. My favorite is the shapeshifter who can change to be anyone they see.

Each level is filled with different NPCs of different roles, and the AI is fairly sophisticated (at least, it's better than I expected). If you are a gangster, watch out for rival gang members. You can speak to friendly gang members and recruit them. If you're a thief, shopkeepers will be hostile to you. If you're a crazy naked guy, literally everyone hates you. For good reason.

All this means you have to navigate the level, and constantly assess your environment to see how you want to achieve whatever it is you want to achieve. There are tons of items to help you do this (from EMP grenades to teleporters to a simple crowbar), acquired either through theft, murder, barter, or mission completion. 

The game also has a lot of humor and doesn't take itself too seriously.

Definitely a lot of fun, and I'll keep this in my Steam favorites for play every once in a while.

NOTE: This game is not completed. There are only 2 zones to go through (I believe there's supposed to be 3 for the base story). From what I can tell, the developer is pretty solid, but this Is an early access review after all. I'd recommend you buy it on sale if you're a penny pincher, as it's not something that you can play all day every day. But I definitely recommend getting it at some point if it seems like it's up your alley.

[b]Disclaimer:[/b] Ich habe den Steam-Key kostenlos direkt vom Entwickler enthalten! Es wurde keine Gegenleistung erwartet und alles folgende (einschließlich das Youtube-Video) entsprechen meiner persönlichen Meinung!

[i]Meine Spielzeit beträgt mehr als hier angegeben, da ich bereits frühere Alphas außerhalb von Steam gespielt habe.[/i]

Schaut gern mein Video für eine detailierte Meinung! Das Steam-Review ist lediglich ein kurzer Abriss!
[b]Zum Video:[/b] [url=https://youtu.be/eSf0QanWkjw]Klick mich![/url]


[h1]Was ist Streets of Rogue?[/h1]
Streets of Rogue ist ein Rogue-Lite Titel der sich, wie viele Titel aus diesem Genre, nicht sehr ernst nimmt und hauptsächlich Spaß machen will. In Echtzeit wird geschlagen, geschossen, gehackt, dinge in die Luft gejagt, Menschen ausgesaugt, Leute mit Gorillafäußten verhauen, (Liste beliebig fortsetzbar).
Aktuell im Early Access und daher nur mit einer knappen Hauptquest versehen, macht das Spiel trotzdem schon Spaß, denn alles ist Over the Top und ausschließlich auf den Spielspaß ausgelegt.

[b]PRO*:[/b]
[list]
[*] Spielspaß wird über alles gestellt
[*] Viele Klassen und Objekte
[*] Quests auf viele Arten lösbar
[*] Mutatoren können das Spielerlebnis individuell anpassen
[*] sehr umfangreiche Optionen und Einstellungsmöglichkeiten.
[*] CoOp (bis zu 4 Spieler) Online und im LAN
[*] Twitch-Integration
[*] Sehr aktiver und community-naher Entwickler
[/list]

[b]KONTRA*:[/b]
[list]
[*] Multiplayer läuft noch nicht gänzlich Rund
[*] Missionsziele wiederholen sich zu oft
[*] generell (noch) zu wenig Variation der Levels
[*] kein FOV-Regler...?! ;)
[/list]

*= Alle Aussagen beziehen sich auf "Alpha 18" (Release-Version Early Access | 10.03.2017)

[b]Empfehlung...?[/b]
Definitiv ja! Es sieht nicht danach aus, als wird SoR eines der Spiele, dass ewig im Early Access bleibt (Erinnerung: subjektiver Eindruck!).
Außerdem bietet das Spiel schon im jetzigen Zustand eine der wohl launigsten Chaos-Simulationen diesen Jahres! In 2D! In Farbe! Und bei 60FPS!

30595487.review: Don't be fooled by my incredibly small amount of playtime; I played this game quite a lot in the pre-release. It really is a fantastic game, and the amount of variety is insane. You thought Terraria had something for everyone? Streets of Rogue will blow. Your. Mind.

30594028.review:
Fantastic game. However right now it's a little light on content. It's like deus ex if deus ex was a level or two and lacked all it's systems and content back in 2000. A demo/beta. That's totally expected for early access so it's not a complaint. However the game is priced as if it has a LOT of content. An abnormally large amount of content. 

Until that fills it's shoes, perhaps hold back. Unless you feel there is a guarantee from the DEV that this game is going to be heavily content rich. Yes, i know you see the character roster and you go, but it's already content rich. Not exactly. The game lacks content in it's systems, it's items, the mechanics, etc.

Give us more things to play with, and the price will be MORE than worth the high asking price. And it will be a completly fresh game to boot. 

If the content never meets or surpasses the price : 7/10 overall with a 10/10 for the idea and systems.
If the content does surpass the price (in other words there is about 10x more of everything) 10/10 overall on all fronts. 


Will it meet it's potential? I sure hope so. I'd like to have hotline deus ex be fantastic.

30588633.review:
SoR-рекомендую!"Простенькая" на первый взгляд (на первый взгляд!) игра затянула меня на много часов.Просто хочется перепробовать все-все возможные варианты действий на карте,а также открыть,уже наконец, всех игровых персонажей (таких как вампир,качок и.т.п.,открываются по мере получения достижейний).
Плюсы:
+Множество способов выполнения задач
+Играя в эту игру-ты реально развлекаешся (очень хорошо повалять дурака после работы
+Можно учинять полнейший беспредел с разрушением всего и морем насилия.Причём насилие не натуралистичное,как в Хатред,а игровое, пиксельное. Иными словами, в этой игре можно хорошенько выпустить на ружу всю злость,если вас ктото сильно выбисил за день.Эфект "груши-начальника"-очень полезно.
+Рандомно генерируемые карты. 
+Планирование действий.Если вы решили пройти "без шума", то необходимо продумать план действий и изучить планировку помещений, а так же траектории перемещения охраны, их вооружение, и не попадаться на камеры (ну Payday, не иначе). Иными словами, интерсно проходить задания по стелсу, но сложно, ибо запросто можно запороться, и тогда у вас получится полноценный раш или полу-стелс, что может быть смертельно, если вы ещё не раскачались.
+Всего 1жизнь (типа рогалик ведь)
+Хороший ИИ. Компьютерные враги могут реально вам навалять :) ..Особенно если вы с самого начала "голым"полезли на банду головорезов с битами-пощщады вам не будет.К пример, у героя"бомж" в начале игры в инвентаре только бутылка виски :) ..Бухнуть и пойти е**шить всех на лево направо? Неплохая идея,но это не Блэйзер.
+Бонусный плюс:+В игре можно включить мутатор "у всех низкое здоровье" (35hp Max) и тогда игра станет как ХотЛайн. Иными словами, все(и вы в том числе будут погибать от:2 выстреолов из пистолета,2-3 ударов кулаком, 1удара бейсбольной битой (а не4-5 пистолетом,6-7 кулаком,3-4 битой, при 100хп). Режим не прощающий ошибок. Сам я играю только с этим мутатором. Это добавляет интереса. 
+Игра сделана с чувством юмора.
+Есть ещё плюсы, но это уже мелочи.В этом пункте стоит сказать что разработчики работают над игрой - постоянно чтото добовляют и анонсируют будущие нововведения в игре.
Минусы:
-Лично у меня, когда я первый раз зашёл в игру и начал уровень, было так: "Б**ь, что это вообще такое!? Что за х***рню я приобрёл (опять)". Кароче - игра с самого начала немного пугает своим визуалным видом - угрюмый синий цвет первого (а также второго и третьего) уровня "трущобы", на карте мы обнаруживаем здания, фонари, урны, бочки ..а где дороги, деревья и машины? да и скамейки были бы не лишними, нам же вроде город обещали в описании. Становится ясно - на карте слегка нехватает наполнения. Но недовольство всем этим бесследно проходит когда начинаеш понимать игру. При всём, что есть в этой игре (и что ещё будет), на этот минус можно смело закрыть глаза. Можете считать предостережием перед первым входом (чтоб батхерт не испытать).
-Музыка - непонравилась. Выключил. ..Непонравилась не вплане вкуса или мелодии, а в плане того что под неё начинаеш просто бежать и раздавать всем налево направо. ..Хотя может кому-то это и норм...Незнаю, потом может попробую с музыкой поиграть, пока выключил.
-Иногда на уровнях (но не всегда) происходят "неприятности". Этакие случайные сложности для игрока. Например: бомбёжка - по всюду падают бомбы, робот убийца - ходит за вами и стреляет по вам из гранатомёта, радиация - каждые 15 секунд нужно укрываться в любом здании. Непонравились. Заставляют бегать, метаться по уровню из стороны в сторону, не дают сконцентрироваться на задачах. В моём же случае (я играю с 35hp max) эти "неприятности" становятся фатальными. "Неприятности" можно отключить в опция (в мутаторах).
-И ещё один маленький минус. на уровнях "завод" есть такая особенность: по всей карте расположены решётки из которых переодически бьёт огонь(!).ОГОНЬ! Карл... Вы гденибудь в индустриальных зонах своих городов видели нечто подобное, чтоб из уличного люка бил огонь и поджаривал проходящих мимо людей? Я вот лично нет. И это не отключить. Лучше бы деревья добавили, или кусты, в которых можно прятаться. Или я чего-то непонимаю. Минус кароч.

Общий итог: неплохую игру сделали.Да что там неплохую-хорошую и замечательную.Игра в общем и целом оставляет положительные эмоции, а минусы и вовсе незначительные.Единственное что, хочется чтоб в будущем всётаки наполнили карты побольше (ну там машины, деревья.и.т.п.) ну и убрали уже эти решётки (ну бред же).

SoR ^ 9 кровавых дестроев из 10

30583818.review:
[h1]Street of rogue is a roguelite immersive sim with 2d pixel art style and I must say I really love the game and bought it when it still in free weekend . [/h1]

 [b]Now to the review (early access state)[/b]

+About the game current state(alpha 20e)
-SOR at this current early access state is really stable and playable , both single and multiplayed .
-The game optimized well , i had a really smooth gameplay with my old I3 laptop.
-There is still bug in the game but not much and i can said there is no game breaking bug right now , quite impressive for a EA .
-You can expect a smooth playthrough without any proplem .

+About the gameplay 
-SOR is the mixed between immesive sim (like DEUS EX) and roguelite that make the game very interesting and fun .
-This game can satisfy alot of different player with different playstyle can you can door kicking gun blazing , steath through the mission without alarm , do a pacifist run without killing , be a joker who make people do work for you , be a master assasin that assasinate people with cloak and dagger , be a gorilla and started the rise of the planet apes , be a charming bartender who neutralize people with poisoned drink , a shapeshifter who possess human body as a disguise , a hacker who can hack a fridge to run away.
-There is ALOT of way you can do to solve a problem , just said you need to neutralize somebody in the shop , easy , use your melee weapon to slash the poor guy , fill him with lead , cloak and backstab him , served him a drink with acid , put cyanide in his air filterating system , blow his house up , hire somebody to do so  , hypnotize him to get him to danger by your commend , hack his TV to blow up  , lure some danger in his house , shrink him and step on his tiny body , theres is alot more , and that is just my experience in 8 hours of gameplay .
-The combat and movement system is smooth and refine , if you are into top down shooting game , the shooting is just like bullet rain game , if you are in to melee , the melee system is smooth and can be master to avoid any imcoming melee damage .
-The game had multiplayed and local coop , up to 4 people that mean there is a hundred more funny way to play the game with the combination of 4 player .
-The game contain light-hearted humour and there is alot of funny reference in the game , the game dont make it self to seriously .
-The progression and unlockable content in the current version  is few , i unlock every mutator , character ,trait , reward , complete every level in 7 hours but not a big problem because the game replayability is really good , i played the game when it only alpha 10 and my actual playtime is close to 50 hours but i dont get boring .

+Remaining problem with the game ( Please consider the game current state is early access)
-There is still some minor bug 
-Need more content , level , unlockable , achievment ,...etc
-There is some balancing issue with class and item .

30583560.review:
I played this game for free over the weekend and it is one of the few games, ever, that I have just immediately been like:  "This is fun." There are plenty of games I have felt were cool, or worth the money, or played solidly right away too. But this game was just immediately and purely fun to me.

Based on that and what I've seen from the developer, I threw caution to the wind with it being Early Access and said:  "I want to support this guy, this game has tons of potential,"  so I bought it. 

From my experience, the missions are limited and repetitive, and there aren't many stages in the game currently. But this is an Early Access title, and you can see the developer is trying very hard and is very active with his player base already. 

I also applaud him for shifting his focus away from adding things to the game temporarily and instead toward fixing the issues such as multiplayer, and various other bugs. Even if he has all that fixed by the time you read this, it's a solid vote of confidence in his favor that he knows/knew what he is/was doing.

Do I recommend this game? Yes, because to spite being in what feels like the early stages of developement as of my writing this, the game plays very quickly and smoothly. It's fun to run around blowing people, and things up, shooting them .. or beating them down .. or breaking and entering .. -- I have found that on average, unlike many games that limit your options to tackle an objective .. this game has supported my every approach to a problem. If I have wanted to try something, I have almost always found my approach to be doable and effective.

I also recommend it because this guy really, honestly, seems to be working hard to both make a great game and earn the respect of his playerbase, through positive and affirmative action. The game has tons of potential and all he has to do is keep some of his promises in the not too distant future of more levels, more weapons, and more mayhem.

The point is, even if there isn't alot here to do right now. What is there is fast, fun and polished, with a strong and positive developer behind it. If you have the money to burn and the trailer makes the game look fun, that's because for me, atleast, it is fun. 

I don't regret my decision at all and I don't think you will either, if the trailer caught your attention.

I will try and remember to drop by and update this at the end of this year, or around there, to see how far he makes it but right now, the ship floats wonderfully and is chartered in the right direction, so I'm on board to see where the ride takes me.

**Update: 1**
He's been steadily adding to the game within the time frames he's been saying he would. Since writing this, he has made many improvements to the game and has added the new levels he promised he would and to the best of my knowledge, he has corrected the multiplayer issues that were brought to his attention, to the best of his ability.

**Update: 2**
I've thought about fully updating my review but I've chosen instead to leave it as is to reflect my initial feelings on this amazing game.

He has added several new playable characters, added to the amount of tactical options and mayhem you can create to accomplish objectives, and fixed tons of bugs/balancing issues/etc. He's even reverted a few changes based on the community feedback posted on his news updates. 

He's also commited to a bi-weekly update schedule, is sticking to it and seems to now also be looking at more ways to engage his playerbase and get their feedback as he continues to work on the game.

**Update: 3**
I'll leave my updating this review by saying:  He's still doing a fantastic job. He's kept up his commitment to this game without question.

I was slightly skeptical of this one at first glance. After all, roguelikes flood Steam like crazy. But guess what? This one isn't like most others. This one offers something different. To begin, it's fun. Remember the first time you played GTA 1? The freedom you felt wandering a city, doing stuff the way you wanted? This has that. This has crazy mutators that let YOU change the rules of the game how you want. This has awesome classes you can unlock by doing clever and sometimes goofy things while already playing.

And, most of all, this is fun. I cannot state that enough. It's lovingly done, and it shows. From the humor, to the way you can change small things on your character like hair color, and style before beginning. If your looking for something different that you won't regret buying, then buy this.

30573056.review:
[h1]Introdução[/h1]

 Bem, o jogo tem um potencial enorme!!! e por incrível que pareça, mesmo ainda na Beta, não vi absolutamente NADA de negativo no jogo (só o fato de não ter Checkpoint, mas uso isso como um desafio, então go)

[h1] Dificuldade e Gameplay	[/h1]

-A dificuldade de Streets of Rogue é bem interessante, pois é necessário estudar os objetivos, pegar recursos e bolar uma estratégia para que você não gaste muita munição, vida e até mesmo não acabe matando indivíduos desnecessários.
 E sim! jogar no Modo F0d4-s3 talvez ATÉ dê certo, mas garanto que custará munição, vida e DINHEIRO!

Voltando á falar de Checkpoint...
É de fato uma coisa super CHATA você passar de várias fases, morrer e voltar para o inicio.
Mas ao mesmo tempo que é chato você voltar tudo de novo, é gratificante você terminar o jogo sem morrer! então repito, é um desafio, coisa que tá faltando nos jogos atuais.


[h1]Referências/Inspirações[/h1]

 Nuclear Throne é a primeira coisa que podemos pensar ao jogar Streets of Rogue, mas é apenas uma inspiração no gênero em si, pois ambos abordam coisas bem diferentes.

Além de GTA também, pelo fato de você poder tentar (TENTAR) suceder seus objetivos sem conflito com supostos inimigos e NPCs simplesmente baterem o olho em você e começarem a te tampar na porradaa kkk, e vice-versa né.

30571966.review:
NOTE: This game is Early Access and is at best 20-25% finished.  It is, however, fully playable - and fun.

SUMMARY: A comedic roguelike/lite mission-based game where the focus is solving the missions your way, from killing everyone to hacking computers.  Currently Early Access, it's a great deal of fun, with emergent gameplay, many solutions, and unlockables.  This is to stealth/action/puzzle adventures what Dungeonmans was to fantasy adventures.

In Streets of Rogue you're part of the Resistance, fighting against the evil Mayor who took over the many-layered city (think of it as a kind of archology).  You pick a character, sally forth into various random levels, and complete missions from freeing gorillas to stealing computer chips to generally killing people.  The difference is you solve problems your way.

Streets of Rogue provides you with various characters, situations, and equipment options to help you complete your missions outside of killing people (not that it's not viable).  Depending on your character, the random level you're on, and the equipment you've collected you may:
* Poison scientists by shoving cigarettes into an air filter so you can sneak into their lab.
* Hack a security gun to blast guards.
* Bribe someone to give you a special device.
* Hire people to help you out.
* Take a lot of drugs and go on a rampage.
* Shoot people with a shrink ray.
* Sneak through a dangerous lab.

Streets of Rogue's emergent gameplay comes from combinations of many elements, from layouts to equipment to inhabitants, and always feels fresh.  There's rarely one way to solve a problem (though if there is it's probably violence), and you can find some truly imaginative solutions - like starting a mini-riot with a holographic bigfoot.

You also get a variety of characters to play, and unlock more as you proceed.  Be a fast-learning Slum Dweller, a smart but lanky hacker, a high-tech scientist, a gorilla, a vampire . . . each with their own advantages and disadvantages.

Of course you'll die, but you'll hopefully score the currency of the future - Chicken Nuggets - to unlock abilities and equipment for your next character.

On top of this is the game's humor, which is just plain silly and funny and self-mocking.  This is a game that feels like you and your friends were joshing around about games.

The result is simple - the game is incredibly fun.  It's a good game made in the spirit of people that love games.

As noted this is Early Access.  It is not finished, so you're signing on for a fun but incomplete game.  The author is open to feedback and is quite nice, so if you sign up expect to both have fun but actually have a chance to help out.


So who's this for:
* First someone willing to support Early Access.  Kind of a given.
* If you like Roguelikes with variations on the classic dungeon theme, this is for you.
* If you like emergent gameplay with action/puzzles, alsoa  great choice.
* If this review sounded like it's about a game you want - the game has a certain "something" to it.

I think this is up there with Dungeonmans on the comedic-take-on-a-genre-thats-fun.  A great game.

30565811.review:
#####
9.0 hours playtime as of release of review. 
This review is for alpha version 20d, and may not accurately reflect the current state of the game.
#####

[b]Discovery:[/b] A friend
[b]Method of acquisition:[/b] Review Copy
[b]Completion:[/b] All characters and achievements unlocked

[h1] [b]Overview[/b] [/h1]

Streets of Rogue is one heck of a roguelite. Everything from the graphics, gameplay, challenge, unlocks and music is superb. This game was a huge blast to play and even more so with a friend. So what is this game? Streets of Rogue sets you up to kill the mayor, and you must make your way through procedurally generated levels split into different unique stages. And of course, since it's a roguelite, there's permadeath. But don't worry, every subsequent run is more fun than the last as you unlock new items, characters and entirely new gamemodes!

[h1][b] Components[/b] [/h1]

[b]Visuals[/b] - The visuals of Streets of Rogue are charming and beautiful. The menus and UI are sleek, and are especially polished considering this game's still in Early Access. The art of this game is eye-candy. Everything from the cyberpunk-esque lighting to the character design is well refined. The different stages all look visually unique which sets them apart well. I'm personally quite a fan of this kind of pixel visual style so I loved the graphics. 

[b]Audio[/b] - Streets of Rogue offers a unique song for every level in the game. This helps levels become familiar despite their random generation. The soundtrack is absolutely phenomenal and I enjoyed listening to the OST outside of the game. It's a really unique, retro-styled yet modern sounding electronic kind of music. The sound effects are pretty cool too. They give great feedback to your actions and are quite comical. Overall, Streets of Rogue delivers an impressive audio experience.

[b]Gameplay[/b] - Streets of Rogue is a rogue-lite, and one unlike any other you've played. It has a unique modern style setting with procedurally generated streets. There's 3 unique stages, each with 3 levels. The stages ascend from the Slums, where all the peasants abide, to Industrial, with wealthier and more standard class citizens. More stages are planned. The actual gameplay is hugely addicting, highly polished and very rewarding. Each level requires completion of several missions, and maybe some optional missions, and how you go about completing them is entirely up to you. Generally the character you choose dictates your style of playthrough, but they're still fairly flexible. For example: the cop is strong and proficient gun-wielding character, however I love to use this character for stealth, as it possesses a unique non-lethal takedown ability. There's a plethora of characters to unlock and they're all so different and fun in their own way. Despite some negative connotations with procedural generation, each level does feel very unique and fun especially with the random missions. This game also allows you to unlock more items using a valuable currency earned from playing. This helps keep the game fresh as you find even more things to do. In its current state, Streets of Rogue has extremely fleshed out gameplay which offers huge replayability that never feels repetitive.

[b]Story[/b] - After a humorous tutorial, you join the resistance and are tasked with eliminating the mayor. First you have to make your way through all the levels. The story  sets up the game nicely but currently it's fairly underwhelming. 

[b]Functionality[/b] - There's almost nothing I can fault the functionality of this game for. Streets of Rogue is nicely optimised and is able to run smoothly and consistently. There is very minimal bugs, and I myself encountered none. One small annoying however, picking up ammo for a gun removes it from your quick-selection bar. The multiplayer of this game is awesome and syncs pretty well despite some latency. Overall, Streets of Rogue runs impressively well even in is Early Access state. 

[h1][b] Pros[/b] [/h1]
[list]
[*] Beautiful visuals
[*] Awesome soundtrack
[*] Many unlockable items and abilities
[*] Hugely replayable
[/list]
[h1][b] Cons[/b] [/h1]
[list]
[*] Only 3 stages so far
[*] No more story after the first tutorial
[*] Fairly easy: all characters and achievements can be unlocked in just a few hours
[/list]
[h1] [b]Conclusion[/b] [/h1]

If you're looking for a fun top down game that you can play with your friends, then you should definitely give this game a go. It is very enjoyable and easy to get into that even people who don't like this genre can still enjoy the game.
I give this game a 8/10 - a massively fun roguelite with dozens of characters and unique ways to play.

30534901.review: My time with Streets of Rogue was, interesting to me. I downloaded the game during a FtP weekend, and was blown away by what I initially thought was just a cheap grab for youtube fame. The game was actually, incredibly fun. Despite the current semi-lack of content (ie, only nine "levels") I still had a blast. The best part is creating strange plots to break into certain areas. Yes, you could just blast your way into the compound, but where's the fun in that? Wouldn't it be more fun to plant an explosive on the door, give it a knock, and then giggle as the poor soul who answers the door explodes into a viscous goo? Hell yeah it would. Streets of Rouge provides such maniacal moments in spades. I thoroughly reccomend this game to anyone who likes silly fun. 10/10 would murder/prank again.

30534858.review: Fantastic game. Fun multiplayer! Can't wait for more content! Also badass soundtrack! If you like Hotline miami then you will love this game!

30534839.review:
Currently, this game doesn't have the content to back up it's asking price but I'll definetly be following it as it continues to be developed. Note that I reccomend this game as promising, if the developer continues to add content, this game is gonna be great as the groundwork is already solid.

The game is a top down, 2d, move with WASD/aim with the mouse shooter. Very similar to Enter the Gungeon but rather than a level that has to be completed one room at a time, you are presented with a 'level' of the 'city'. There are randomly generated NPCs and buildings. Each level you are given a handful of missions before you can move to the elevator and proceed to the next level. The focus being on the Rogue like elements, survival is the number one priority. You don't need to succeed at the missions in order to unlock the elevator to the next level, you just have to complete them. If you succeed, you get money/equipment/food. 

You have an inventory and gain xp and unlock passive traits. There are lots of different classes, all with unique passives and special abilities. For example, you can play as a Gorilla! You get extra health and a super cool punch ability! But you're a Gorilla so you can't speak, so you can't interact with NPCs in the city and they usually attack you on site if you walk into their buildings. The differences between the classes are fun and meaningful. For every bonus a class has, that class also has a negative passive, this makes the unlockable classes fun and engageging rather than just 'better'. 

The game encourages experimentation and usually presents several paths to a goal. Hack a buildings security system and turn the turrets on the guards? Sure! Put a bunch of unknown drugs in the ventalation system so everybody inside will OD and you can collect the loot? Oh wait that unknown drug made them invulnurable for 15 seconds? RUN!

Game's buggy right now and realistically only has like 2-3 hours of content at this point, but I really like what I see and can't wait for more content to be added to this game. Multiplayer would be amazing.

30529873.review:
Amazing game! I wouldnt have played this, wouldnt it be for the initial two day trial period on release day. I immediately bought the game after playing and its one of my most favourite rogue-likes. Its just one of those games you have to play and cant really judge on the screenshots.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]

+ cool soundtrack
+ good controls
+ a lot of unlockable characters that change the whole game in how you approach certain goals
+ randomly generated levels that are interesting
+ randomly generated goals
+ so many items and weapons
+ it has rpg elements, where you level up your character and choose power ups
+ you can unlock more and more power ups that will than come up randomly ingame
+ open world
+ not every character is an enemy its more of a city/town you roam around
+ hire random npcs to protect you and join your party
+ the characters make this game, a gorilla for example cant talk to people or a thief isnt welcomed in shops, making you change up your playstyle each time you play
+ mutators to change up the gameplay
+ local coop multiplayer! you can play in splitscreen, single screen or a mix of both, absolutely awesome
+ online multiplayer! you can have private locked matches or play with randoms
+ items and gadgets are very well thought out and useful in various situations
+ when you clear all the goals you can stay in the level and do additional missions or loot peoples houses
+ npcs also have logic to them, like gang members will automatically attack other rival gang members
+ customize each characters look to your liking
+ designing your own character with unique traits is going to be a thing (not included yet)
+ the levels are designed to represent bioms in a tower, slums, industrial and so on up to the richest folk
+ random hazards can happen (curses) for one floor, like having to hide indoors every 15 seconds to not get nuked :D
+ the difficulty is spot on, I loved the difficulty and failure is almost always your own fault
+ the graphics are minimalistic, but you can always determin what is what
+ a map and teleportation system to a point on the map to not waste your time with walking (super cool idea) teleportation is of course prohibited once you are in danger, have to escort someone or stuff like that


[h1]Cons:[/h1]

- playing online with randoms is caotic and most players will just do their own thing rather than cooperating, but there is an official discord channel to counter that

- some characters are extremly easy to play compared to others, I hope there will be rewards for completing the game with a more difficult character


Amazing game, absolutely amazing. I love it. One of the best rogue-likes right now and totally worth the asking price. even better with friends but super fun in singleplayer nonetheless. I recommend it highly, even in Early access right now!

30523533.review:
16年10月看逆风笑和老菊的视频知道的这款游戏，一眼就喜欢上了这款游戏，第一次看到的当天是开着VPN用流量把测试版本下到手机里再传到PC上玩，感觉自己也是蛮拼的。

现在版本跟那时候相比多了大本营和人物解锁，昨天还更新了每日任务，不过游戏内容方面还是只有两大关（虽然可以通过大本营开启无尽模式，但从很多方面来看这个游戏现在并不完整），但这并不妨碍我喜欢这款游戏。

这个游戏中文翻译的不好，机翻。其实除了看人物的背景介绍以外，游戏过程并不需要太多文字量，毕竟很多道具就算没有说明试试也就知道了，任务也无非就是摧毁/解救/释放/关闭开关/取得道具。

可以在大本营的NPC一些对话看出以后可能会出现自创人物，这个游戏人物虽然多，但还没有出自定义人物。还有自创地图等等，我很看好这款游戏的未来发展空间，强烈期待这款游戏的后续更新。

30523415.review:
게임하면서 미리 알았으면 좋았다고 생각한 점.

첫번째, 로봇은 로켓런처를 날려대는데 죽여도 1골드밖에 안준다. 그냥 적당히 이용해서 미션깨는데 쓰는게 낫다. 그리고 로봇 죽이는 방법중에 가장 쉬운건 금고는 로켓런처에 안깨지니까 그걸 중심으로 계속 왔다갔다 하다보면 지가 알아서 스플데미지 입고 죽는다. 30씩 닳는데 좀 오래걸린다. 

두번째 게임 플레이 하는데 상점주인이 제일 좋은거 같다. 상점주인해봤는데 아이템이 사기다. 기본으로 샷건에 셀프 마켓에 ..

세번째 유령은 어떻게 죽이는지 모르겠는데 일단 부두인형을 판다. 

네번째 의사나 그..빙의하는 캐릭터는 노크하고 잠시 뒤로 뺐다가 다시 들어가서 넉아웃시키거나 빙의할 수 있다. 인식 못함.

다섯번째 슬레이브는 사서 풀어주면 밑에 헬멧을 남기는데 데미지 50짜리 폭발물이다. 원하는데 던져놓고 멀리서 터트리면 완전범죄 가능. 

멀티플 한번도 못해봐서 논외고 혼자 즐기기엔 괜찮다.

This game is extremely fun, I love the huge diversity of all of the classes, the procedurally generated levels and the objectives are nice and open enough to have multiple ways to complete them, it is a true mini open world game. Plus not to mention that the game can go up to 4 players offline or online, I haven't had the chance to try it out yet but I could imagine it being really fun with all the different outcomes you could get by just combining the different character classes alone. All that I know is that I have got to try to gather some of my friends to actually buy this game, multiplayer just seems like an idea worth a million replays just by itself.

30519372.review: Street of Rogue is a dynamic open-end action adventure game. The game is brutal and has some elements representing dark side of humanity, but it still has a great amount of humorous dialogues and characters. Each time you load into a mission; the map, tasks, NPCs, traps, and tools will randomly placed, making this game unpredictable and increases the replay ability to the maximum. You will be a part of the resistance fighting throughout the slums in order to put an end to the major. There are many different characters you can play as; each one will have his/her own ability that can make certain missions a lot easier. However, this game is still in an alpha stage, and I hope it will have mods support in the future. Should you buy this game? Yes, this game is the boredom's killer.
