30511579.review:
Je vais essayer de rédiger une évaluation complète sans être trop lourde. Si vous avez la flemme de tout lire, je vais faire une CONCLUSION plus courte, tout en restant assez complet :

-Tuto rapide et efficace. On apprend les bases, sans pour autant savoir ce que font tout les objets.

-niveaux générés aléatoirement, sans que cela soit pour autant impossible par moment. Il existe toujours au moins 1 moyen de réaliser les objectifs, si ce n'est plusieurs... On peut même s'amuser à tout casser, et réussir ! Seul hic : pour le moment il n'y a que 2 niveaux, donc 6 "stages" 
par contre il manque une possibilité de save une partie genre entre chaque stage.

-Immersion assez moyenne, histoire basique des gentils qui veulent défaire les méchants, mais la façon reste drôle, avec des missions redondantes ( peu d'objectifs différents ) à la GTA des premiers opus, des dialogues décalés, sans pour autant être hilarant. Mais bon, on est pas là pour ça... Pour le moment on va dire que ça passe... Pour le moment...

-Nombre de personnages déjà très élevé. Les capacités ( traits dans le jeu ) sont moindres, en revanche chaque perso à des capacités uniques, ce qui compense.

-IA assez incroyable pour un jeu du genre ! Les PNJ réagissent à la moindre de vos actions, et même pafois entre eux ça castagne. Ne vous mettez pas au milieu car vous deviendrez une cible après ça !

-Diversité des objets assez grandes pour une alpha, ce qui permet de bien se familiariser avec les bases. En espérant que ce nombre augmente avec la progression du dév. du jeu.

-Graphisme pixel qui plairont à tout les joueurs fans du genre. ça renverse pas un mammouth, mais c'est coloré et dynamique, donc c'est déjà très bien.

-Bande son très sympa, electro rétro dance ( si ce mix de genres existe )

-Jouabilité au top avec clavier + souris. Voir si avec une manette c'est sympa aussi, je n'ai pas essayé ( à partir du moment ou on peut cibler, je préfère la souris ) 

-Multi : Je n'ai pas encore testé le multiplayer à ce stade. Mais il semble faire l'objet de beaucoup de travail à chaque MàJ, donc je pense qu'il va être bon quand le jeu sera bien avancé.

-CONCLUSION : physiquement beau et bon, contenu déjà très varié, avec plein de persos, de traits, d'objets et de mods, vous donneront envie de refaire les stages différemment plusieurs fois. Les soucis que je trouve étant l'histoire trop clichée, l'impossibilité de save, qui rebutera les joueurs avec des dispos limités, et le peu de stages, qui finiront par lasser les joueurs qui auront "farmé" le jeu. Ces pourront cependant passer en mode multi, qui offrira certainement des possibilités très compétitives, qui plairont aux joueurs chevronnés.

30510310.review:
This game is the poster child for you don't need flashy graphics to have a hell of a fun time.  This is a quick, enjoyable, time waster of a game.  If you have 15-30 minutes to kill, you can't go wrong with this.  The developer had a genius move... Release weekend made it free to play.  Other indie developers should take note... I played for free and was hooked.  I bought the game immediately.

Even though I've completed all the content available so far, the replayability is off the chain.  Multiple characters, different strategies to unlock additional characters, the rogue like elements and RNG level design make this infinitely replayable.  The developer is on top of listening to community feedback and seems to be very interested in developing a high quality finished "retro" style product.

Can't recommend this highly enough if you want a quick, simple, fun game to kill some time.

这游戏比两个月前完善了很多，工业区地图也有了更新。沙盒模式下不能解锁新角色。

多玩几次应该就能找到技巧，欢乐向多一点。

灾难篇：
全屏辐射：进屋里就行了，墙壁坏了也没事，系统是根据地板颜色来判定是屋内还是屋外

机器人杀手：利用系统自带的喷火器可以干掉机器人杀手，然后就有火箭筒捡了

近战武器：除了小刀是单点的突刺攻击，别的都是扇形的挥舞攻击

You're probably curious already, but I know you've been hurt before.

   "Early Access?" you ask, the words laden with memory and loss. "I don't--"

   SoR places a finger across your lips. Its dark eyes fix on your own with a gaze so sure and warm that your reservations begin to fall away. At first speechless at the game's audacity, you find yourself strangely comfortable within the silence. You've never seen this game before, but at the same time... it feels like it could be an old friend.

   The game steps back and reaches into unseen pockets.

   "For me?" you ask, anticipation creeping back into your voice as SoR places its gifts into your open hands: a baggy of cocaine, a baseball bat, and a breaching charge. "But... I really don't understand."

   "It's okay," it says, chiptune artifacts whispering through pixelated orthodontia. "You will."

30503302.review:
This is more a feedback than a review, but it's also a review. My overall impression though is that it's a pretty solid game, especially for an "alpha" build.

The way the game is presented (the intro video with the genre soup) and trying to shove in talking points like "Nuclear throne (did it change from Isaac?) and Deus Ex with GTA" was pretty offputting, but it was free so I tried it out. Going off of that, the tutorial is also pretty bad. Mechanically it's a fine way to learn the mechanics but the 'narrative' of it was also kind of off.

Despite early misgivings I think the game's actually very good. There's "only" 2 zones currently but as I messed around with a handful of characters for a while, it took me till nearly the end of my play time to realize that (and it was only because I was specifically trying to get to the end). That play time was 6.3 hours, and in that I played through like 5-6 of the characters and got all the current achievements. The 6 that I played (Thief, Assassin, Hacker, Doctor, Jock, Police, and the Scientist to unlock the ghost) seemed pretty fun, though as I saw someone else comment, a lot of the classes are defined mainly by items they have, and those run out relatively quickly. 

Thief can still pickpocket but will run out of his other tools, and while that actually won't happen much in the game because of the 2 zones, it'll most likely happen with other classes and more frequently later on. Classes whose quirk is a permanent thing, like the hacker, assassin, and jock feel much better because you don't have to be very stingey with it. I'm not entirely sure how you'd balance around it, (and it might be because of the classes I ended up playing but I didn't actually run into this almost at all) but that seems to be the main balance issue. Assassin is also super overpowered (though fun, through that).

The only other issue I can think of is the relative lack of variety in mission types. There's a small handful, and while they don't seem that bad because of the random generation, I'm sure they'd get very tiring later on. I'm assuming that later on in the development more might be added, as this is an alpha.

Streets Of Rogue. A game that combines many mechanics into one, unique style of gameplay. I've tried it when it was launched and on it's free weekend, and 2 hours into the game convinced me to fork up that 13$ that it was at the time, as I believed its content and enjoyment will go up in price as it's development gets further.

For those who haven't read the description yet, it's a game where you can come up an seeming endless amount of tactics to try and accomplish missions throughout the small town area. (It's actually a huge city, cut off into 3 regions for each sector. There's currently 2 sectors, but as development continues, more sectors will be available to play, making longer runs.)

This game actually has a story as well. In a nutshell, it's simply about a major whos gone curropted with power and greed, and a faction who calls themselves; "The Resistance" has been formed to kill the major and turn the city back to normal. You, the player, has recently joined the resistance was put up with some training. Once your training was complete, you went out into the city doing whatever it takes to complete the tasks given to you. Trading a rare currency called Chicken Nuggets, that lets you be able to gain powerful traits as you level up (which resets every time you die on a character) or unlock new types of rewards to find new ways of completing missions. You could also use a small amount of those nuggets to grab a useful item that might come in handy when you go out next time with your character.

The gameplay itself lets you be able to do an seemingly endless amount of tactics/strategies to complete your missions.
Oh? Need to take out the shopkeeper in that building? Distract it by hacking into its computer, walking out of the building with suspicion, then BOOM! a landmine to the foot. Or, you could silently kill him as an assassin. Hmm.. How about shrinking the fellow and crushing him good under your shoes. That seems satisfying.. I could rant on and on about the strategies you could do to finish the mission, but that would take quite alot of your time.

There's also Classes. Characters that have their own personality, stats, starting items, and even special abilities. You can be able to unlock more classes by doing certain things on your mission. Like taking out many members of a single gang, getting drunk, or even breaking tombstones.

There's also Multiplayer for the game as well, both Local and Global. Have more chaotic fun with your friends. However, I did encounter a few bugs and only one of them broke the game. Didn't have as much problems in singlelayer.

The developer also has plans to release lots of more content as well in the distant future, some of which I have probably mentioned earlier and more of these below:
-Being able to create your own character.
-SEED. Have no idea what it does to be honest.
-More items, buildings, and even sectors.
-Obviously bug fixes.
-Probably more mutations? (Normal runs with a twist in them)

Now for the Pros and Cons of the game:

Pros:
-Amazing gameplay. I already mentioned this several times.
-Gives you the ability to be creative in handling missions.
-Has good stability. Haven't gotten a crash yet for me. People who have slower pcs might run into issues.
-Has decent content that lets you be able to deal with certain situations in many ways.

Cons:
-Lack of Content. It's kind-of both a pro and a con because while it does have some content that can keep you busy for a while, it doesn't seem endless after many hours of playtime.
-Bug issues. It's normal in alpha, and I tend to see them more in multiplayer.
-AI can be idiotic/stupidly smart. This one time, I try to attack a theif in self-defense while a cop is cruising by and it suddenly starts attacking me because I was "breaking the law". Kind-of resembles real life tbh. Not something major, but forces you to make certain decisions you otherwise wouldn't. Probably just my opinion however.

Overall: The game has great gameplay, loads of hours of replayability, started out a decent plot for the game, and is constantly bringing in more content with each month or so. (Whether that be bug fixes or additional content). Though be open-minded about the seemingly lack of content it has at the moment and the multiplayer bugs it has. (they're also in singleplayer but are minor things that don't impact much)
This is a game that you can currently buy for at a small price right now. And it's price will casually rise as it soon gets closer and closer to full release. You'll be paying for the amount of quality it has to offer, and you will be getting more of it in enjoyability profit as the game continues to expand and add more content.
It's also a good game to play if your in a bad mood and just want to do things your way. Bug your friend to get this game, and trust me, you both won't regret playing this game. If your friend is being a ****, then shrink him and crush him due to annoyance.

Highly reccomended for an indie game. I haven't played one that makes me keep on playing for a long time.
9/10.

30499719.review:
They made this game free for the first 3 days and is it fun. Besides the brilliant move by the just as brilliant tinyBuild, this game reminds me a ton like Binding of Isaac, with the addition of GTA or something like that. A mini RPG but if you dont dig RPG games this is still for you, probably just as much as those who love 'em.

2-3 Objectives per floor, 3 of every floor before a new "Level" and theres 5 level. Do simple math for 15 floors. Third floor on every "level" includes a difficult twist. This game isnt finished as of I'm writing it, but its still great. Up to 4 players per (computer?) or Local/Online playing also being up to 4 players. Several characters already implemented and more to come, I'd assume the same with levels but I'm not sure.

One thing I enjoy is that this game isn't like your average game where your enemy will leap at you without reason. They need a reason. Whether you enter an area you're not allowed to be in, you didnt leave an area when the owner said you needed to, or you decided you wanted to pick the fight and hit them. Keep in mind if you hit an enemy the friends of your enemy will also attack you (Ex. Hit a cop -> All nearby cops attack OR Hit a goon at peaceful place -> All possible hostiles begin to attack). Another nice touch is that they run away at low health, as tedious as it may be it's still cool.

Several interactions, even more items. This game comes with a tutorial so you won't get lost around the place and after the tutorial everything new is easy to understand. 

My one complaint is to adjust the "Disasters" which, like mentioned before, is an event on the third floor of each "level" and carries a difficult challenge thatll haunt you throughout the floor. I dislike the intensity of these disasters because they go as followed;

Disaster 1: A robot practically indestructible and can wipe a third of the possible chosen characters health (at least half of available characters come with 80 to 100HP and the robot does 30HP per shot) the robot fires an RPG (with infinite ammo?) and can also be used to your advantage, if you can take a hit or two just for the upper hand on a different problem. If you're thinking "Well its an RPG shot, cant it kill itself?" I did mention it being indestructible, which is an exaggeration. It has tons of HP (perhaps 1000HP to the average 100HP of your character) and 30 is nothing to its HP (34 shots will do 1020 damage, the least required) with that damage, unlike your 5 shots at most to die.

Disaster 2: Raining Bombs. God is this tedious. Not even that lethal, it comes to your advantage greatly cause you get the shadow of a bomb. Unless you're busy with an interaction longer than the 5 seconds it's gonna take you to hack this computer, or maybe you're in a fight and both you and the enemy take a hit. This is more bad then good because regenerating health isnt that easy.

Disaster 3: Radiation (or whatever?). Also tedious, standing outside there is a timer. Every 15 seconds there will be some sort of poison that'll do 20 or so damage to you if you're standing outside, and must be inside a building. This doesn't work well because of the "Rescue Character" means you have to be extra careful or they'll probably die outdoors. Otherwise it just makes the floor time consuming.

30498357.review:
** I feel like i had to go back and rewrite this little review... And maybe a final time for the Finished Product.

Think of this game as a GTA 2ish with RPG and Rogue-lite elements mixed in with the modern Pixel Art band of games. Tons of classes so far with more in future im sure each with thier own abilities and attributes to mix up the game experience. Complete 2 to 3 objectives on each floor to procede to the next in [b]ANY[/b] order, to [b]ANY[/b] playstyle your little heart desires. You can go Rambo-like as a Gorilla and smash s*&% up or capping heads with your crew as the gang leader. Or maybe you want to do a little pick pocketing and commit B&Es as the Thief or Mettle in ppls afairs without being seen like the Ninja would... Each randomly generated floor is filled with weapons and tools to be rewarded, found, stolen and looted from people and chests. All this can be done Solo or with 3 others. Now its not perfect and things can get out of hand with s*#& flying around and accidently killing your teammates but its fun. So far the variety has been great and the audio...Well its got a Nice soundtrack that keeps the game bumping and smashing.

I cant give it a numerical value coz its not finished yet but so far its 2 thumbs way up your monkey A$$.

30498247.review:
I played the game for a few hours on a "free weekend" deal an thought it was amazing. Basically it's a retro graphics style 2D game that pays homage (often very directly) to free-form games where you can tackle a situation in many different ways, like Deus Ex, Dishonored and System Shock. There is good variety already, even though it's an EAG, and some good, lighthearted humour that I'm quite sure most people will appreciate.

The game also seems to be getting good dev support and frequent updates. While I haven't purchased the game yet, I intend to do so as soon as I finish a bunch of other games I recently acquired - and my next paycheck comes in - to show my support.

Only con I can think about is that it's very short, right now, but even inside the game the devs tell you more content is coming soon, so that's promising. Let's hope they keep their words! It's probably the game with the most potential to be excellent I have ever played on Early Acess.

30497305.review:
jugue el juego en early access , y me parece muy divertido, a continuacion voy a explicar que me gusta y que no me gusta del juego :

lo bueno: 
es en general entretenido, sus mecanicas son adictivas y gratificantes , y desbloquear a clases no podria ser mejor , la manipulacion del entorno y la interaccion con los personajes es sumamente entretenida, el humor es fantastico, y las batallas son,si bien basicas, graciosas y bastante divertidas, la gama de personajes a elegir es vasta, y las habilidades de cada uno son interesantes de usar, por no decir que son bastante buenas y bien diseñadas.

lo malo:
el juego tiene una traduccion a el español casi completa, exceptuando algunos detalles por aqui o por alla, pero no es la mejor , los personajes tienen un aspecto de sigilo muy limitado ya que pocas clases son algo que podria ser efectivo en el sigilo, esto pues los enemigos tienen vision aguda , la mayoria de los personajes carecen de algun aspecto que los haga un candidato a sigilo, como una habilidad que les permita aprovecharlo (un ejemplo de un personage que si lo tiene es el cambiaformas) los caminos que siguen los enemigos dentro de espacios cerrados es: o indefinido, o dificil de aprovechar (dejando de lado el detalle de que los interiores -que es donde se deberia de poder hacer algo con el sigilo- no estan diseñados para permitir tal mecanica, ) y que los personajes usables tienen una falta de stats , teniendo todos solo 4 .

lo que yo recomiendo:
-la inclusion de mas stats, y mas variados  una recomendacion para añadir seria :
 -sigilo, el silencio y efectividad general de los enemigos en escaparse o esconderse de sus contrincantes -fuerza, la medida de la capacidad fisica que influencia el daño cuerrpo a cuerpo y la capacidad de carga -carisma. capacidad de convencer a alguien de hacer algo, determina el numero de seguidores que se pueden tener y puede hacer que transeuntes aleatorios sean seguidores tuyos, dejen de ser hostiles un medio de un combate, y que no les importe tu precencia en un espacio restringido -punteria, es inecesario explicar -suerte,inecesario de explicar -resistencia ,determina la cantidad de daño que se ignora  -agilidad, determina la velocidad de movimiento y velocidad de los ataques cuerpo a cuerpo - percepcion, aumenta la cantidad del minimapa que se divisa conforme uno se mueve a travez de el mismo y el daño con armas de fuego

-mas habilidades secundarias para los personajes 

-mas gore

-menos efectos negativos en las jeringas o mas efectos positivos 

conclusion: es un juego con sus errores y faltas, pero aun asi me encanto el producto que jugue y disfrute cada segundo que lo tuve, muy recomendado 
PD: obtuve este contenido en early access, asi que lo mas probable es que todo lo que me disgusta cambie a mejor con el tiempo y solo lo jugue por 2 dias antes de que la alfa acabase y dejase de ser freeware, por lo que no puede disfrutar todos los aspectos que se ofrecen en este interesante y entrentenido titulo

30495453.review:
Ich hatte die Möglichkeit, Streets of Rogue am Release-Wochenende auszuprobieren. Hab es Samstagnachmittag entdeckt und mal eben 9 Stunden darin verbracht. Gerne hätte ich mehr verbracht, aber das Wochenende war zu Ende. Dachte nicht, dass das Game so viel Spaß machen würde. :D

Die zufällige Generierung der Städte jedes Mal, wenn man ein neues Spiel beginnt, lässt wenig Langeweile aufkommen, weil immer neue Konstellationen entstehen. Deine Mission ist es, den Safe der Bank auszuräumen? Viel Erfolg, wenn neben der Bank die Polizeistation ist. Und lass bloß nichts explodieren..

.. explodieren. Ja, die Sache mit den Explosionen. Macht es BUMM, splattern alle Körper der Toten in der Nähe erstmal in tausend Teile. Plötzlich ist überall Fleisch und Blut. Was nach einem FSK18-Ding klingt, ist an sich gar nicht so schlimm, man lacht eher darüber. Außerdem ist es Pixelart. :)

Aber am besten finde ich ja immer das dritte Level jeder "Ebene". Ein zufälliges Ereignis. Eines davon: Aufstände. Alle gegen alle. [b]Das[/b] macht Bock, das sag ich euch. :D

Kaufempfehlung ja, aber nicht für 15 Euro. Soviel ist es mir noch nicht wert. Obgleich das meiste schon im Spiel da ist und auch funktioniert und lustig ist, fehlt es noch an Inhalt. Ebenen drei bis mindestens fünf (was mehr oder minder geplant sind) sind zB noch nicht da. Manche täten das Spiel womöglich als [i]zu einfach[/i] ab trotz des Roguelike-Labels. Holt es euch ein paar Monate später und wenn es unter 10 Euro kostet.

30494399.review:
This looked interesting to me and it looked like something my brother would love as well, so i told him about it and we  played this during the free weekend.


I am listing my experiences with the game in the order i experienced them or noticed them:


Im not a fan of the writing. I don't find it funny. Not my cup of tea. Its generic 'humor' where some people laugh at something because its SUPPOSED to be funny, as opposed to actually being funny. The good news is this is only a problem in offline mode. And i only did the tutorial and went to the home base in offline mode so there may not actually be too much of that we have to worry about.

But i LOVE the gameplay. The gameplay is EXCELLENT. And with more levels added where it gets harder and harder its only going to get even better. Its chaotic. No matter what it will be chaotic at some point during your play. And i had the privilege of playing both in a passworded room with just me and my bro, and i also made Open Game rooms where anyone could join.  It was a good time in both cases. I very much enjoyed myself. I guess in online mode you only really have to worry if your team members are incredibly selfish. But if you want to do special quests like unlocking characters and such, or trying to beat the whole thing without alarming anyone, or just beating all floors, you might want to play with people you know will try their best to accomplish this, because its so easy to mess up the level for everyone on your team. Which right now, i didnt run into anyone who intentionally tried to, but eventually there will be.

I also suggest that you all open yourselves up to playing with people you dont know, sometimes. I saw only 1 or 2 open rooms at any given time. ALL the rest were passworded. Come on people. I was one of the few who hosted open rooms. And when i joined one other players room i got kicked because the game didnt move to the next level because a new player had joined the room but not the game. And they blamed me for it. Which was dumb, and a sh*t move. Dont be a**holes. This game is too cool for that. WHich brings us to the next point: in online play, currently, if you finish the level and go into the elevator, but someone joins the room at that time, the game will not progress until the new player joins the GAME. They have to be loaded into the floor and possibly even run to the elevator youre all waiting in. If you know this, it will save you all alot of anger. Try opening your minds and not assuming so much. It does the world good.

The music is excellent. So simple, but so lovely, and catchy as all hell. Very reminiscent of the Spelunky soundtrack.

The only issue preventing me from getting it right now is that I think 15 dollars is a lot for a game of this type in Early Access, where its not a full game yet and there are TONS of frustrating bugs. There really are limitations that you can feel within the game because you know how big the game is supposed to be. And thats fine, but not for 15 dollars a game. I really want to buy this for 3 people and that would be ALOT of money for such a small early access bugged game. I will probably wait until it goes on sale for a decent price.

Bugs:
I had a lot. 
* I couldnt kill myself using a banana peel. So sorry to say we tried several times. My brother got it but i couldnt. It kept saying i killed myself with fist. Which is impossible. (It would be great if it wasnt impossible though) 
* At the end i hosted an open game and people were joining but once i finished a level they couldnt seem to join me in the next level. And it never said they left. I think my whole hosted game was bugged at that point.
* We couldnt see door detonators when placed by anyone, or mines when placed by another player.
* in online play, currently, if you finish the level and go into the elevator, but someone joins the room at that time, the game will not progress until the new player joins the GAME. They have to be loaded into the floor and possibly even run to the elevator youre all waiting in.

I cant remember them all but there were alot.
So if youre playing at this right now during early access just expect it to be very buggy. Im sure the developer will fix all of that eventually but right now it is an issue. Be sure to report everything you come across in the feedback to help him/them to fix all of the issues. Theres a feedback option in the main menu of the game. You can do it at any time, including while in the middle of an online game. Lol but even that is wonky. 

Requests:
* PLease add a witch? Think of all the fun things you could do with a witch. And give her a witchs hat? : D ?
* Please make it more affordable considering its still in early access and short and bugged to hell.
* Make it possible to kick players without having to type their names in. Anyone with special characters cant be kicked because you have to type names in, and you cant type wierd names. Which obviously makes it easy to get around being kicked.
* Please allow us to move around when our inventory is open. This game is way too crazy to stand still most of the time. Like, move around with WASD/D Pad, while going through inventory with the mouse/Analog.
* PLease allow us to choose how much money to drop. Or to just give directly to another player because in order for me and my team to buy things we sometimes had to drop money for each other, but it would be best if we didnt have to submit ALL our money to them, in case they dont give it back after they buy what they want, or if things are too chaotic and they dont have time to give it back.

I know i had more things i wanted to ask for in this game so i will edit this when i remember because i can no longer ask in feedback since the free weekend is over.


Overall, i love the game. And you need to know its 100 times more fun than it looks like in the video. 

PS I warned my bother that if he told jokes the people didnt like they would attack him. I was right.

30494374.review:
A game that shines and comes to life when everything goes completely off the hinges. The simple synopsis is that you control one dude, get objectives and have to complete them in a manner you decide yourself. 

Pick from a selection of various classes like doctors, hackers, thiefs, assassin's (and many more ) each with individual traits, strengths and weaknesses, and roam about randomly generated cities. You can play alone or with up to three other players in co-op (locally or online) and truth be told this is the way to play this. Along the way you find various weapons, useables, health items and much more for benefit or demise. Some of them are truly bizarre. 

While the game name inspires you to use "stealth", and you surely can enjoy the game that way, the true marvel of Streets of Rogue is when everything goes to hell. There is so much great content coming from the dynamic systems at work here that it must be experienced to be properly appreciated. Random NPCs suddenly beating each others, axe-happy slavers, Gorillas with rocket launchers, hobos throwing grenades, a myriad of followers and freaking nuclear bombs dropping from the sky! And that's only the beginning. Oh, and did I mention you can clone yourself? Stupidiously awesome.

In short; Haven't had this much fun in a long time, and I've only seen a small portion of what's on offer. Awesome!

Rating: 9/10 - Must play

Предисловие: 
Да я наиграл мало, но все же высказаться надо. (Обзор делаю на основе бесплатной версии которую дали на выходных)

Основа: 
Что тут у нас. Механика трона с тем что лвл это этажи. Ну тут ещё исуком пахнет. Стилистика персонажей вроде из побегистса, но она вообще не похожа на побегистс. 


Плюсики:
• персонажи. Их много для ирли аксес. За каждого разный геймплей. А большинстве играл за хакера из за его возможностей, так же попробывал вора подконец. ДРУГ НА ДРУГА ПЕРСОНАЖИ НЕ ПОХОЖИ (способностями)

• этажи. Каждый этаж может быть большим, так и мелким. И на каждом этаже что то новое. Например на 1-2 появляются копы, 3 миссия, и доп квест от нпс. 

• объекты для взаимодействия. Можно потрогать что угодно. Сломать что угодно и тд. Вообщем на высшем уровне.

Минусики:

• сложновата. А вы чо думали все так просто? Неееееееть. Если вы нападаете на врага у которого огнестрел то лучше одумайтесь. Либо старайтесь увернуться. Шотганы тут убивают быстро. Группой зажмут убьют если будешь без оружия.

• ирли аксес. Надеюсь хотя бы не на 5+ лет.



Итог.

Игра хорошо выполнена в плане графики и геймплея.

Рекомендую к покупке!

Скажу сразу, игра мне очень понравилась т.к. я всегда любил игры подобного жанра. В этой игре есть ОЧЕНЬ много всего, учитывая что игра находится в альфе (на момент написания обзора)! Сюжет говорить не буду, лучше сами купите или скачайте. 
По поводу геймлпея, геймплей очень интересный, на каждом этаже есть 3-4 задания за которых дают деньги, оружия и т.д. Спасибо что прочитали!

30492377.review:
I played this over the free weekend, and really enjoyed it. It's a great addition to the rogue-like category, with solid gameplay that's just diverse enough to be interesting. I can't speak to the co-op elements, but as a solo game it has a lot to offer, particularly for an early access title. Overall, it's a game I highly recommend. 

My only significant criticism is that there are only a handful of mission types at present. You'll be rescuing a lot of gorillas, neutralizing random dudes, opening safes, freeing slaves, and escorting people to the stage entrance. I'm sure there will be more missions types and variety to come, and for a game that's still in alpha there's a lot to like, but at the moment the stages very much feel like something generated by an algorithm. 

Pros:
+Great soundtrack
+Fun selection of playable characters
+Well-executed retro art
+Never the same mission twice
+Tons of opportunity for different play styles
+Dev has plans to add Workshop and mods

Cons:
-Can be repetitive
-Some missions are virtually impossible to complete non-violently
-Not as much emergent gameplay as you might expect

30490143.review:
[h1]TL;DR at the end[/h1]

I played this game for 7 hours in the free weekend. Boy , did I have a blast. They didn't lie when they said that the game is like Deus Ex mixed wiht Nuclear Throne. I'll just go over a few things that you can do. Let's assume that you need to retrieve a certain item from somebody. You can bargain for it , steal it , hack into the building's system and have the security system kill that one person or kill them by yourself. Want to hack everything ? Want to go sneaky beaky ? Want to go guns blazing ? Want to posses people ? Want to punch your way through ? Want others to do your dirty work ? Well , you can do all of them and many more. Just look into the game's steam achievements and look how many classes there are to unlock. They all play differently , with their strenghts and weaknesses.

[b] PROS [/b]
> Really good tutorial
> Many classes
> Freedom of approach 
> Good progression and unlocking system (you choose the order you unlock stuff)
> Mutators
> Plenty of humour
> Controls feel really intuitive
> Huge replay value

[b] CONS [/b]
> As it is now , it only has 2 levels and no main quest
> Some classes are unbalanced (for me , Investment Banker feels extremely weak)

[b] TL;DR [/b]
If you liked Nuclear Throne , Deus Ex or just rogue-likes in general , get this one. There is so much content and so many things to do.

This game reminds me so much of immersive sims from the late 90's to early 00's, that being Thief, System Shock, and most prominently Deus Ex. And despite being in early access, the game is incredibly rich and its world is full of depth.

You're playing as a brand new member of the resistance, who's goal is to assasinate the leader which has decreased the amount of alcohol and put an embargo on chicken nuggets. But the game hasn't been developped to that stage, so right now you're only operating in the slums and the industrial area.

Despite that, you've got access to a lot of different classes all with unique powers, allowing for a very varied amount of playstyles. Use your laptop as the Hacker to get access to various electronics such as turrets, cameras, and computers (just don't read their emails, that would be rude). Sneak around as the worst Thief ever and pickpocket items from passerbyes. These are just two classes I've tried so far, but even so, you've got a lot of opportunities and abilities from only this.

Overall, it's indeed very promising and I hope to see more of this game in the future.

30489262.review:
The live, real-time nature of absolutely everything is astounding and fantastic fun. I've always enjoyed games that kind of "play on their own" through a Michael Bay-infused rube goldberg machine of AI strings and this one really resonates with me. I'll outline a quick story that made for one of the most memorable runs in my short time of playing this game:

I need to access this hospital and toggle a couple of switches. Unfortunately for me, I'm the thief, rendering my presence in any sort of public building met with hostility. There are also three goons armed with various melee weapons capable of bringing my demise. I have an RPG, luckily found through a vendor, as well as a syringe that has an unknown effect. My final weapon of choice will be a banana that I plan on using either for health or for some sort of advantage to be gained in a 1v1 scenario. So, I head over to the side of the hospital to the air ventilator and drop in my syringe. The effect turns out to be strength, but regardless the gas seeps through the vents and the 10 or so bouncers and doctors flee outside the one entrance and amass in a large pool of bodies, waiting for the gas to end. I pause for a moment and then realize I have an RPG, and seeing an opportunity too juicy to pass up, fire at the clump of people. The rocket connects and I gib 6 of them, while the rest flee inside. I scamper in and annihilate three with a police baton with relative ease, but a goon with a pistol is moving in and out of rooms, attempting to search for me. I drop my banana right outside the door of the room he's in and lo and behold, he sidesteps the banana with ease and opens fire. Having the strength bonus I gave before, his shots take me down from 40 or so health to exactly 5, just enough time for me to stab him to death. I flip the switches, congratulate myself, and then proceed to slip on my own banana peel while staring at my inventory, trip, take 5 damage, and die.

Moral of the story? Buy this game. Even if you manage to kill yourself with a banana peel.

30486532.review:
I think the best description for this would be "Deus Ex the 2D Roguelite". Maybe a bit more chaotic than that though.

Realtime, 2D, tongue-in-cheek game where you have to do random missions in a procedurally-generated portion of a city. Tons of character options all offering different approaches to objectives, tons of little systems to discover that produce a layered gameplay.

This game is technically still in alpha, but its systems already have a ton of polish and the artistic vision is quite cohesive. Note that for now (2017-03-13) only a slice of early content is available. But that's already plenty of game to be had.

Game features co-op, both local and online, and also Twitch integration (for people seeking extra punishment from their viewers as they take over some random / player choice aspects of the game).

Also, it's one of those games when 2 minutes into the tutorial I said to myself: "Okay game, you've got my attention."

30483428.review: Played for a few hours on the free launch weekend and was convinced to buy the full game. If you're into roguelite action/shooters like Neon Chrome, Nuclear Dawn, or Hammerwatch, Streets of Rogue will feel familiar but with enough clever innovations and polish even on the Early Access launch to make it worth your money. There's gang factions, neutral NPCs, bribeable cops, plenty of permanent unlocks via currency (chicken nuggets) and through achievement goals. The tongue-in-cheek tutorial gets newbies going with winks to veterans, level generation seems to be pretty fair and bug free from what I've seen, and the overall style of the game is well executed and consistent. II wish every Early Access game was this ready for prime-time, just looking forward to more content after the first big round of bug fixes.

30483322.review:
Change the name! Its misleading. I suggest calling it Syn..Grumpy Streets of Genocide...Dicate. That ones free, by the way.
YOU'RE WELCOME!

I bring this up because I was expecting a brawler type game and what I got instead is MUCH better than the games title would suggest. This game is very close to the original Syndicate on Amiga. I imagine most of you have no idea what that means but basically it was great. It was Grand Theft Auto before that game had even been invented yet AND you had a group of 4 (if you wanted) goons and unleashed mass carnage.
That is this game, it's huge carnage if you want or silent take downs if you prefer. Its kind of great but uh-oh I said 'kind of' instead of 'it's totally awesome!' and there is a reason for that. Not all options will be available at all times. for example  You might prefer the stealthy no kill option only to be presented with a situation that cannot be resolved outside of mass genocide. 

I like it, it creates a think on your feet kind of gameplay and if you use the time-limit mutator then things get really hectic as your calm and collected approach might go out the window as you need to get things done, quick!
Infact it might sound odd but my biggest worry is that the large scope of the game will not be filled out. I enjoyed what gameplay there was but there was no denying that after I went full carnage, full stealth and finally full killing by proxy, I was "done".

It isn't that the game lacks content, its randomly generated so that won't be a problem but its more the ways you can approach the missions is limited. You either pickpocket the item, buy it from the person in question or you kill them and loot it from their corpse. It sounds like you have a lot of options but you typically have 3 to 4 objectives a stage so it really gets repetitive regardless of approach.

Sadly I don't think this can be fixed. Not with the random generation system in place. Overall the game is fun, a lot of fun. I had a blast playing it and placing cyanide down an air vent and watching the people inside the building explode into giblets is great fun but this is closer to a party game than a deep single player experience. On that note the netcode? Grade A. It is better than Street Fighter V although thats not saying much! But I could connect and play and only disconnected twice which sounds negative but it really isn't. I had way more issues with Starbound netcode!

Do I recommend this game? I do! But do I recommend buying this game? At least right now? Eeeeeeh, thats not so easy to answer. What we have so far looks great, I'm really digging it but I did get bored 2 hours in and only kept playing to unlock things. That is a bad sign and that was in multiplayer as well!
In singleplayer I got bored even faster and started speed running stages just to make unlocking things go faster. Maybe its due to years of me playing Syndicate so I might just get Deja vu but if you never played or even heard of that game then you will probably fall in love with Streets of Rogue.

That jab about the name at the beginning wasn't unfounded by the way. This game needs to change its name because it is not a sidescrolling brawler which its name might lead some to believe. I know I certainly went in expecting a side on brawler and while I enjoyed the game regardless, people looking for a brawler are going to be unhappy and people looking for a spiritual sequel to Syndicate are certainly not going to look at the title of this game and expect it to be what they were looking for!

Join Grumpy reviews for all your gaming needs
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/grumpyreviews

30482384.review:
Reviewing as a Early Access : Version 20.
I would recommend this game but not for $15 in it’s current state. I expect significant and rapid changes to take place given the sudden popularity and obvious developer engagement. I would wait until the developer puts a bit more down on what the vision of the end product will be.
After playing through the game once on my own, and once in a 2-person coop, the game definitely has replay value. In its unfinished state I wouldn't pay $15 for it. I also do not see a plan put forth for where the game is going, so I wouldn’t invest on the hope that in the future the game is worth $15. I expect to get about 20 hours of game play per $10 spent, so with this game I think it would begin to feel grindy after the 5th or 6th play through and lose its charm after the 10 hour mark.
The level generation is well done, but lacks the cause/effect mechanics I would expect from a Rogue style game. Case in point, there are really only three tasks: (1) Kill someone, (2) steal something, and (3) rescue someone. Of these the solution to tasks are very straight forward and free form, but lack depth and consequence. Usually a one step approach either succeeds or fails; IE: Go in kill everyone take the safe. The map layout, door mechanic, and ownership are well done to produce a living world. 
NPC’s feel alive due to their interaction with the environment and reaction to different character types. The actions of your character causes reactions and ‘problem solving’ logic in the NPC’s that caught me a few times thinking, “How’d they catch me?!” Many of the items to buy or pickup feel like they run off of a simple algorithm and are less useful than initially expected.
The multiple characters’ with differing skills and starting items is an excellent touch. The leveling system is bare bones, with little control over how the level up progresses the character. I would expect more customization in this regard as the game is flushed out.
Notes on Improvement to get me to buy the game:
1)	The levels should get more and more difficult and essentially go on forever. Sub floors, and larger structures that require a combination of hacking, brute force and manipulation to get the job done would make multiplayer significantly better.
2)	The tasks need to have more depth. An example would be;  you had to free a hacker to break into a special computer that would then open a door so you could steel an item that would be used later in the game to save a leader of the resistance force you are working with. Another example would be to free a scientist that gives you a special weapon that is needed to fight a boss.
3)	Bosses.
4)	Added character leveling depth. I would like to see maybe 20 core attributes (speed, strength, hacking skill, language, etc..) that you would get a couple points to allocate per level, plus a general point bonus based on level and type of character. If you were a soldier you may get a weapon upgrade per level, or be able to gain a skill in explosive weapons so you could use grenades more effectively.
5)	Larger map with larger field of view. It would seem reasonable for a game that allows warping in a mini-map that would allow scrolling out then ctrl-clicking on a location to jump. The minimap seems redundant. The map in general seems like it could be larger by maybe 2x.
6)	Use the idea of a greater mission to have long term tasks and short term tasks. Like bribe 20 cops and take over the district, or run a drug trafficking ring to make 1,000 gold. This sub-game then builds to a higher leveling tactic for each type of character. Like the soldier could pick up goon’s by the intimidation skill and level up his rank to general which would allow him to command the cops around later in the game.

Do you enjoy roguelite games? Harken to my words as I help you decide if Streets of Rogue is for you:

Cons: (Yes negatives first!):

*It's in early access.


Pros:

*So much roguelike elements that if it had turn-based combat it wouldn't be a roguelite. 

*You decide on how you want to clear and what objectives you want to fail or succeed at. (You can play this game purposely failing the objectives and still proceed to the next floor.)

*Tons of Unlocks (Characters, items, loadouts, mutilators, rewards, and more!)

*Every time you play it is different.



There seriously is more. In its early access phase there is enough bug squishing and content to get you many hours of enjoyment. I rarely touch E.A. games since DayZ, 7 Days To Die, and Rust kind of took the air out of my sail, so to speak. So for me to be glowing about this game shows that, at least for me, this game has merit. Right now you can drop 15$ USD and get HOURS of entertainment. You could get more out of this game for the same price of Logan movie tickets right now and the game would still be here entertaining you. 

Support the developer that offered the early alpha free to players Q4 2016 to have them be the victims....I mean testers. So many people played it and enjoyed it that many were waiting for this day! Glad it came. Drop that money today and be entertained for many tomorrows!

30481580.review:
It's promising, but suffers from the RNG more than benefits from it. 

Most of the time, randomly generated instances will provide no solutions besides bruteforcing your way through, making some classes (*ahem* thief *ahem*) completely useless.
Even then, many levels look and feel the same. In this game, randomness doesn't make for an unique experience, but for a more generic one. 
The levels blend in kaleidoscopically, with nothign to change besides the positioning of various objects.

A shame, since the classes are fun, seemingly broken, but quite manageable. The vast array of weapons is fun, and the flavor text is fun to read (at times).
Some of the most amusement I got out of this was when I was shooting ghostbuster lasers at ghosts to unlock the werewolf, breaking gravestones to unlock the vampire, dumping myself to 10 health so I can banana suicide to unlock the comedian.

The unique and nonsensical ways to die are what makes this. Unfortunately it loses its charm when you start noticing a method in the madness.

Maybe this flaw will be fixed in future updates, but after almost 8 hours, it's become unplayable.

30480264.review:
I do kinda like it. It's got an impressive breadth of content in some areas, but seriously lacks in others. Specifically, there are dozens of consumables, tools, buffs, weapons, and even character classes. There's an insane number of ways you can approach most mission objectives... provided you're actually afforded the opportunity to do so, which, this being a randomly generated roguelike-like, you often aren't.

Example: You need to loot a safe or detonate a generator in the back room of a shop staffed by an armed owner and two hired goons. The back room lacks any access points besides the door from the main room. There are no computers, no vents, nothing in the area you can use to your advantage. You're playing as a thief, which ironically further limits your available options as all shop owners will accost you on sight even if you're behaving yourself. You COULD use a blink tool to phase into the back room through the outer wall, do your thing, and use another blink tool to get back out -- but now you're down TWO of those precious and often irreplaceable tools for one dumb mission. Short of that, your only real recourse is to brute force your way in through the front... through three armed guards, as a thief. Good luck with that one, champ.

It's really nice when through whatever oddball combination of RNG elements you ARE given the opportunity to MacGyver your way through an objective. Unfortunately, all too often you just don't have that sort of opportunity no matter HOW you play your cards with what you're given. Loot from containers is an absolute crapshoot (spend a hack tool and a lockpick getting at a treasure chest and it has $3 inside; examine a trash can outside and find $13 and a sandwich), and utilities cost way too much given how quickly you have to burn through them and how slowly you get money.

I also can't figure out how to access online co-op for the life of me.

Insofar, missions lack variety (loot safe; detonate generator; obtain an item someone's carrying; neutralize someone; rescue an NPC) but I'll give the dev benefit of the doubt here and say that'll be worked on soon enough. The free launch weekend is a nice idea, it's given me an opportunity to see what I think of the game without shelling out for and subsequently refunding it, and given the overall reception, it seems to be working out well.

I'm sadly having more frustration than fun with it in its current state, but I will say that if you do like it, you should probably spring for the collector's edition. It has a pretty legit soundtrack.

30480177.review: I cant believe how much fun this game is on single player. BUT it also has multiplayer does that mean 4x times the fun. If only I had some friends who werent cheap :D

30479966.review:
Streets of Rogue is an engaging roguelike where you traverse different, city-like, generated dungeons and complete objectives for upgrades, new weapons and level progression. The game provides different ways to tackle objeectives, compounds and situations with friends or by yourself. With that in mind, get ready to use the Endless mutagen after completing what little there is in the standard game at the moment.

While I find the game to be fun for the schenanigans that occur when playing with friends and the Mario Party-esque friend loss that will occur depending on a player's choices, the game still has some work to do. So, here are my gripes and feedback for the game:

1. Issues with the gamepad

When playing the game on a gamepad, I experienced issues where action menus sometimes disappeared and the camera locked into place. This is an issue because some actions are outside of your character's inate traits and skills. For instance, the hacker has a ranged hacking move. While others do not have this special move, there are items that allow for remote hacking. This is an issue when you may only have one chance to hack a distant computer and end up losing that chance thanks to the menu disappearing. My guess is that the game has issues with understanding when the mouse is not in use.

2. Bar Blocks

Sometimes when dealing with vendors and retailers in the game, the person you are talking to will ask you drop an item or cancel out your shop menu in other ways. I understand if a building a block away explodes and the seller wants to check it out; however, when they ask me to drop an accuracy mod again and again by canceling out the menu, it becomes annoying.

3. Progression Traits

Please remember, I understand this is in early access and more should be coming down the road. That being said, some of the progression traits for each level may not benefit your character. Cherry picking a scenario and using self-reference criteria here: I did not find the early skill traits when playing as the Doctor to be useful towards my gameplay. Having extra crit hits and the ability to identify syringes does not help me when I am playing as a pacifist character that can already identify syringes. While a trait like increasing followers and the ability to not trip lasers and floor traps seems great alternatives, I hardly found any use in them when playing as this character.

4. Seed Generators (Feature Creep)

It may not be out yet and may even be the greatest thing ever for the game depending on how the community uses it. That being said, this is more of a cautionary: watchout for feature creep. This isn't  a negative, just a reminder that the community is here and some want to work with the developers by helping the game become better through feedback and opportunities. Sometimes those opportunities may not be what the community really wants or needs, but what the loudest group desires.

TL;DR

Streets of Rogue is an engaging rougelike in early development stages. There may be issues with the game, such as minor blocks and progression issues here and there; however, the game does a great job at combining multiple elements into a fun experience for you and your friends. Warning: you may lose friends depending on your playstyle.

30478067.review:
Streets of Rogue é aquele jogo que tem potencial e este potencial pode ser aproveitado. Por enquanto fica por isso mesmo, ao menos até o momento (versão alpha 20b).

Não é que o jogo seja ruim, muito pelo contrário, me divertiu absurdamente no launch, quando ficou free pelo final de semana, mas ainda não tem muito conteúdo disponível. Pelo que deu pra perceber, eles pretendem por 5 mundos, criador de personagens e mais uma porrada de coisa bacana. Meu desejo é que tais "coisas bacanas" realmente apareçam porque a jogabilidade é fluída e o jogo tem umas putas sacadas.

De desvantagens, não esquecendo que ainda é alpha:

-É fácil demais. Mesmo sem usar o soldado (extremamente op), ainda não é muito difícil chegar longe, mesmo na primeira run.
-As missões no cooperativo não aumentam ou ficam mais difíceis, então jogar com amigos é para, literalmente, tornar o jogo bem mais fácil sendo que, como falei acima, já é fácil demais.
-Tem personagem pra cacete, mas poucos deles são realmente legais. Não me refiro a "legais" por serem "badasses" ou parecido, mas sim "legais" de realmente úteis. Muitos personagens tem desvantagens tão absurdas que não existe razão alguma para usá-los.
-A variedade de missões é pequena e normalmente fica em: resgatar alguém, neutralizar alguém, recuperar algum item ou apertar botões.
-O jogo conta com 2 mundos de 5 e esses 2 mundos não são tão diferentes assim.

Não recomendo a compra no momento e é melhor acompanhar os criadores pra saber se as atualizações serão realmente dignas e rápidas, mas se for bem feito, tem potencial de se tornar um dos melhores roguelikes disponíveis na steam. De qualquer forma, devo pegar no futuro, quando o jogo tiver mais conteúdo.

30475892.review:
ランダム生成されたマップでミッションをこなし階を進んでいくローグライクアクション。
3/22時点で有志の日本語パッチなどないですが、特に難しい単語も出てこず文字を読むゲームではないので英語のままでも十分楽しめるでしょう。

与えられたミッションを臨機応変に解決していくことがこのゲームの肝と言える。

例えば、NPCからあるアイテムを手に入れろというミッションを、
ドアを蹴破り周りの用心棒ごとマシンガンで薙ぎ払い死体からアイテムを回収するのもよし
NPCのいる建物の空調に毒を混ぜ全員毒殺して(略のもよし
平和的に賄賂を渡して譲ってもらうのもよし
と様々な方法がありプレイヤーは操作キャラの性能や所持アイテム、周りの状況からより良い方法を判断し実行していく必要がある、

最初は正面突破がちになるがゲームに慣れていくほどにクレーバーな方法で少ない損害で解決していく自身の上達に喜びを感じる。


スタート段階から戦闘用の各種アイテムを所持し正面での戦いに強い兵士、
貧弱だが機器をハッキングして防衛設備を止める、毒ガスを室内に充満させるなどの芸当が可能なハッカー、
銃やコンピューターなど文明の利器は使えないが最高のステータスと強力な専用格闘攻撃をもつゴリラ（！？）
など様々な強み、弱みを持ったキャラ達を使え、立ち回りも変わってくるのでリプレイ性は高い。

장점: 단순 은행털이에도 수 많은 방법이 존재할 정도로 높은 게임성과 자유도, 찰진 타격감, 캐릭터마다 뚜렷한 개성으로 액션, 스닉, 두뇌 플레이가 가능함. 정말로 문 하나 따는 것에도 락픽을 이용하거나, 노크해서 문 열어 준 사람바로 쏴 죽이거나, 폭발물 설치, 텔레포트 기기로 문을 넘어 버리기, 해킹 원격 조정으로 문열기 등. 진짜 온갖 종류의 도둑이 된 기분이 느낄 수 있음.

단점: 아직 컨텐츠가 너무 적다. 단 두 스테이지(1-1,1-2 세분화는 있음)의 컨텐츠는 익숙해지면 1~2시간만에 다 볼정도고, 미션 종류도 아직 몇 가지 없다. 다양한 캐릭터들을 절반정도 밖에 언락하지 못했고 다 플레이 해보지도 못했지만 볼륨이 적어 계속 플레이 하고 싶게 만들지는 못함.


점수를 매기자면,
컨텐츠 1.5/5.0
시스템 5.0/5.0
재미  4.5/5.0

총평 4.0/5.0
얼리엑세스 알파 버전치고 이 정도 재미를 선사한다면 앞으로 정말 기대됨. 다만 지금 볼륨이 너무 적어서 아직 선뜻 구입에 손이가지 않음.
하지만 앞으로의 발전 가능성은 무궁무진 할거고 컨텐츠 문제는 어차피 얼리엑세스의 시간문제일뿐 볼륨이 추가된다면 정말 꼭 구입할 예정.

I haven't played this all the way through, but it seems very entertaining. The first time or two are pretty straightforward... you're probably gonna end up duking it out a lot... but some of the other classes really open up your options! Once I got the Scientist, it was a whole new, much more entertaining game, full of different tactics, but even the Gorilla was fun (he can't use guns, but I got a Food Processor and just turned all my guns into Bananas and Bacon Cheeseburgers. Yeah, I know, I know!), especially when he found a growth item (forgot what they're called)... hilarious destruction!

Disasters will also keep you on your toes, but can still add another level of tactics, to boot. Why steal a key and unlock a room when you can just trick the Killer Robot hunting you into blasting the outer wall open? I also had a blast when a mission asked me to get an item from a guy in a fortified building full of thugs... and I just dumped Rage Poison into the vents and let them wreck each other and, when the fight spilled into the streets, the local police.

I won't be able to afford this full price, but I'll definitely be looking for it to go on sale! It's a very entertaining game full of playstyle options!

30471187.review:
Tive o prazer de jogar esse jogo na fase alfa, e no momento em que estou escrevendo isso, joguei durante o fim-de-semana gratuito, e já adianto que estou esperando cair o saldo na Steam Wallet para comprá-lo.

Como fã da franquia Deus Ex e amante de jogos que deixam as possibilidades para concluir fases/missões ao gosto do player, digo que esse jogo simplesmente é excelente nesse quesito. Um exemplo básico: possivelmente você vai ter que neutralizar um alvo específico constantemente. Como Hacker, você pode abrir as válvulas de gás venenoso da sala onde ele está, o matando. Ou ir como policial e algemá-lo. Ou talvez comprar uma seringa de drogas, levar a um cientista para descobrir o efeito dela e injetá-la no sistema de ventilação da sala, o deixando drogado, envenenado ou até mais forte. Pode atrair o mesmo para agredi-lo, desviar do golpe fazendo com que ele acerte outro NPC e o mesmo cuide dele. Ou pode simplesmente tocar o foda-se, usar o Jock e sair quebrando tudo como um Sonic Bambam GONNA GO FAST!

As possibilidades são infinitas, e no multiplayer então, nem se fala. Vale o dinheiro!

[h1]很喜欢这款游戏，认为她的潜力是巨大的！[/h1]



[h1] 这游戏有毒，玩了上瘾，不玩还想着玩。[/h1]

优点不说了，因为[spoiler] 去掉下面的缺点，全是优点。 [/spoiler]

[b] 不足之处：[/b]
BUG不少：汉化字体小，望后续修正。
教学关通关后上电梯错误弹出一次。
联机太卡不能愉快的联机，这游戏不能联机乐趣减半。
关卡太少，希望尽快增加。
内容不多，虽然后期会增加更多区域但是任务千篇一律，就是那几个任务和玩法，希望增加玩法和更多的游戏模式以及角色。
暂时想到这么多。

现阶段来说，感觉这游戏单机10个小时左右基本就可以AFK了，联机虽然能延长游戏时间但是模式太少，没什么配合协作，大家基本在里面各忙各的，甚至有捣乱的。所以感觉联机模式比较乱，更何况联机卡顿的问题没解决，想好好体验游戏真不如单机。

总之是一款不可多得的好游戏，喜欢像素类的玩家不要错过。现阶段BUG问题比较多，观望的玩家可以等后期修复后再入也不错。什么？你说现在买有优惠？那好吧。我的想法是[spoiler] 毕竟10%的优惠折扣可有可无。 [/spoiler]

游戏潜力很大，期待后续内容。

30468817.review:
不得不说，游戏是好游戏，
画风很容易产生亲和，游戏创意很棒，
roguelike的游戏方式也很容易中毒，
个人从某智商高达50的主播那里得知此游戏时就一直关注了。

--------以下是ALPHA23评测---------
之前的一系列问题逐一得到解决，很好，很不错。
食物制造机相对的削弱也保证了平衡，
之前医生+近战perk+食物制造机简直横行。
关卡进展缓慢仍然是个问题，保证质量而降速这可以理解，
但也就意味着正式出来如果不如预期将引起公愤。
游戏虽小，但本身的潜力巨大，
按目前的框架可以增加的要素应该是很自由的。
希望看到更多脑洞。

顺便提一句，目前版本最喜欢的职业：
医生：
虽然食物制造机削弱了，但不妨碍这个拥有背后一击必杀
还不会引起骚动的强大技能的发挥，本身由于不能用武器，
所以到处搜刮武器，制作食物保证生存，
加近战perk保证有刚正面的资本，仍然是大方向，
当然没有以前那么imba就是了。

大猩猩：
食物制造机收益者2号，直接刚正面不BB，血少了啃食物，简直不要太安逸
然而食物制造机的削弱，这个职业刚正面就没那么轻松了。
加上这个版本地形杀有点多，大猩猩的冲拳容易悲剧，就更显得雪上加霜。
但是仍然还是那个硬派风格，直截了当。

刺客：
刺客就是浪漫，就是暗杀美学啊有木有，背刺的巨量输出不要太强，
本身能潜行，单杀基本没顾虑，
但是不像医生那样悄无声息，逐一击破。
背刺是会引起他人注意的，
虽然破隐一击如果杀死敌人则会继续隐形，
但和医生的技能不同，医生的技能是不会空掉的，
而刺客的背刺需要自己判断位置，稍微偏一点就空了，
相对之下更讲究操作，这使得很多时候只能刚正面，
有点悲催，不过总体来说很有特色的职业。

--------以下是初版评测---------
既然已经正式发售了，关卡数量却依然和测试版无异，
这就很操蛋了，港道理光这一点给差评就不冤，
中文加上了就是好的嘛，然而，字体时而大得相互挤着，
时而小的无法阅读，这是闹哪样，文本的意义一下子就没了啊喂

当然，本人真的很喜欢这个作品，所以还是给个好评，
希望后续内容能尽快补完，这样无限吊胃口很糟糕。

30466843.review:
Lo probé en su versión gratuita de 2 días. Por el tiempo que he jugado, he de decir que me encanta, es el típico rogue-like, generando las mazmorras en una ciudad, pero no cereas que es otro del montón, las características y habilidades, junto con los objetos disponibles, hace que sea un juego con mucho potencial. También he de decir que no es nada fácil, si quieres pasar los calabozos, has de ser muy cuidadoso con tus acciones, realizando las misiones y pasando al siguiente nivel. Si haces lo que yo hago, es normal que no lo pases xD.

Tiene muy buena música de acompañamiento, lo que hace una inmersión total. Cuando se pase el periodo de prueba, obviamente lo compraré. Para mi gusto, no he visto aún ningún error, solo que en alguna ocasión la traducción al español está mal escrita, pero no afecta para nada. Teniendo encuenta que aún está en una versión alpha, le quedan muchas mejoras por introducir, y corregir los pequeños bugs que haya. Pero vuelvo a repetir, que he jugado ya bastantes horas y no he visto ninguno.

Si quieres jugar un dungeon a lo loco haciendo lo que te plazca, asesinando, o sin asesinar, sobornando, drogando, etc, este es tu juego, no te vas a arrepentir. Y si lo juegas online con los amigos será aún más bestia!!

30466487.review:
Streets of rough простите rogue*

В Retro city Rampage играли? Так вот, эта штука что то подоное, но обширнее по возможностям.

За свои годы я повидал уже не мало инди поделок от независимых разработчиков и уже мало, что может меня заинтересовать.

SoR тот самый случай, который доставляет много фана, который заключается в больших возможностях.
Поэтому попробовав игру на бесплатных выходных, сразу же купил её.

О чем игра? Ну вообщем то, нам нужно избавить город от тирании какого то мэра, выполняя задания на случайно генерируемых уровнях.

Задания не блещут разнообразием, но компенсируется это все стилем прохождения.
Чаще всего люди почему то разносят все в пух и прах ( Частенько видел в мультиплеере ).
Куда интереснее, например стравить копов и бандюков друг на друга.
Взломать систему безопасности, и аккуратно пройти внутрь за искомым.
Нанять армию бандитов и пойти разбираться с должником.
Усыпить всю охрану и тихо спокойно вскрыть сейф.
Вселиться в копа и выпустить пленников на свободу.
Торговать рабами.
Воровать.
И даже....быть умным ( ученым ), ну может у кого то комплексы по этому поводу = )
Я могу перечислять бесконечно.

Ну конечно это не мешает взять вам в руки гранатомет и разорвать все к чертям собачьим.

Для всего этого предложено 20 классов - профессий, каждый со своими особенностями, плюс
мы будем получать умения прокачав себе уровень, перков тоже достаточно.
Стафф здесь огромный, предметов полно ( от всякого оружия и до туалетной бумаги ).

Для альфы - просто огромное разнообразие, оно определенно того стоит, видно что человек старался.
То ли еще будет?
Хотят завести кастомизацию, добавить больше мутаторов, больше возможностей итд итп.
Не забываем, что пока что это альфа, поэтому здесь есть баги.
Но на них можно закрыть глаза, учитывая столь обширное разнообразие.

Ну и конечно здесь есть мультиплеер, как локальный ( на одном пк ), так и по сети.
Это значит, что вдвоем можно спланировать еще больше всякого АХТУНГА.
Хакер взламывает систему безопасности, наемник перестреливает всяких ******сов, грабитель вскрывает двери и сейфы.
Разве плохо? Не думаю.

Для тех у кого есть что то в голове ( кроме палить и убить всех н****й ), тому эта вещь придется по вкусу, и интерес не пропадет.


В этой игре я выпил крови у всего города!

PROS:

-So many unlockable characters, items, traits, and more

-Every portion of text tries to be funny, from the tutorial to the shops to THE ITEMS.

CONS:
-The entire soundtrack is one or two songs, remixed over and over again, or at least seems like it

Overall, I give it 7.4/10.

Played during the free weekend. Put in a good bit of time.
I really enjoy it, honestly.
It took me a bit to get into it, but once I got the hang of the internal logic, the game really opened up for me.
There are definitely things left to tweak. The game is pretty far from finished.

The ultimate question though: Is it worth 15 bucks?

Right now, no. When finished? Probably. As it stands right now though, no, I can't suggest you put 15 bucks into the game.
Perhaps if I hadn't been burned by early access titles so many times before, I'd be more generous. Unfortunately, I have. So at the game's current asking price, I have to say no.

What would be my threshold? If the game were on sale for about 50% of it's current price, I'd probably be into it.

TL;DR - Game is fun. Game will be more fun if completed. Not currently worth asking price.

30462083.review:
This game took me by surprise, to be honest. I was expecting an unbalanced death trap with broken mechanics and simplistic graphics. Instead, I got a beautifully made game with multiple playstyles to choose from and a reward system that, unlike other rogue-likes, makes dying less frustrating. As well, I can begin to see how much potential it holds, especially with its customization. To put it simply, Streets of Rogue is a diamond in the rough that all gamers can enjoy.

Pros:
 + A wide range of characters/playstyles to choose from.
 + Gameplay is adaptable and allows for creativity.
 + Never a dull moment, especially when Disasters kick in.
 + In-game factions that are balanced in their benefit-to-consequence ratios.
 + The art style, though simplistic, has its charms and is very atmospheric.
 + The music is extremely fitting and it pumps me up beyond belief.
 + Multiplayer and Co-op for those who enjoy teamkilling and slaughtering your friends.
 + Make your game harder/easier by implementing 'hacks' such as everyone despising you or Creative Mode.
 + I was too lazy to break into a house so I blew it up with the equivalent of a nuke, killing at least 15 people and a gorilla.

As for the cons, please take into account that they are not meant to criticize and more to point out what Early Access (as of me writing this on 3/11/2017) has to offer at the moment.

Cons:
 - Missions can get a little repetitive.
 - Only two zones to play through (though this can be 'solved' by turning on Endless Mode).

Where it stands now, Streets of Rogue is an exhilirating experience but I can imagine how much fun it will be to play Co-op once I get my pals to play with me. It can be a little monotonous after a few hours but that is remedied by striving to unlock everything the game currently has to offer. I would give this enjoyable experience a 7.9/10.

30461682.review:
This game is really fun! I played this during the free weekend thing and I plan on purchasing this later.

There's a lot of attention to detail in this game. For example, in the tutorial, you could break down the door with your FISTS instead of opening it normally and the tutorial guy reacts with a "WOAHHH THAT WAS AWESOME I'VE NEVER SEEN ANYONE OPEN A DOOR LIKE THAT" (or equivalent). If you bust down the shopkeeper's door, she scolds you. If you kill her, the tutorial guy has a line of dialogue for that. If you kill a guy the tutorial guy wanted you to tranquilize, there's a different line of dialogue there too. If you walk into the ladies' bathroom, your boss reprimands you for it later on. It's really interesting seeing all the different reactions the characters have.

The dozens of classes allow for many, many different possible playstyles, and I've still yet to fully explore them all. So far, I've only really "played" one class- the doctor. That speaks to how much replayability is in this thing.

It's a really great game, and I definitely recommend it if you liked roguelikes like Wayward Souls or Pixel Heroes: Byte & Magic. Heck, even if you didn't like roguelikes I'd still recommend it, just for its humor.

30461484.review:
I'll be blunt, It's pretty damn good.
The game gives a lot of freedom to the player, there are a number of ways you can accomplish your main missions and the number of characters [spoiler] plus your own [/spoiler] allows you to play a variety of different playstyles.

FREEEEEDOM, uh yeah there's a lot of it. Play how you want to. Be a verteran soldier that has had too many wars for her/his lifetime and maim and blow things up or you can just do the missions and not disturb the "peace" that's cool too.

Main point of the game is to kill some corrupt president (I know it's a mayor, president sounds cooler) dude, and to complete questionable tasks. You are allowed complete freedom on how you are going to complete (or fail) them. For example, you have to neutralise a few people, you can either just barge into there and be a brawler person and kill everybody or you can hire some gangsters to do the dirty work for you. Though be careful, everyone has hyper-alien intellect and can identify who hired the gangsters so, yeah keep that in mind.

Each character is mainly different from each other, they each have their own unqiue ability which can assist them in some aspects. For example, the bartender (Probably my favourite character, I swear I don't drink, well in irl) can make some cocktails, which are some syringes or pills you use to make them, this disguises the syringes or pills as some cool drink you made in hospitality class. 
Note: You have traits for each character so like the "Drug-a-lug" trait allows you to see what effect each syringe does.
You can then give them to random people (test subjects) or drink it yourself to give you that certain effect after 5 seconds. The practical use of this is to give all the bad guys the bad cocktails and allies and you the good ones.

Thanks for reading my essay-like review thingy, I hope that you didn't fall asleep while reading this and you learnt a thing or two about this wonderful, creative and wacky game. Dev is very actively working on the game and accepts feedback. Is gud game. Go buy now.

30459925.review: Imagine Deus Ex combined with The Legend Of Zelda: A Link To The Past in a rogue-lite, and you'll end up roughly at Streets Of Rogue. The sheer number of classes is impressive, especially given that they tend to perform as described by the in-game text, in practice. And there'll be a create-a-class mode someday, which I'm quite excited about. And just like Deus Ex 2 (the really buggy, crashy one that everyone but me hated), you'll be able to interact in a very straightforward way with your surroundings and with the NPCs. Bribe guards, sneak around, hack terminals, shoot it out, punch it out, swords it out, recruit NPCs to fight with or for you, blow up the entire area, or chloroform the opposition one by one. This game's got all of that and more (somehow, in Early Access). And you won't be burdened by online-only singleplayer, microtransactions, extraneous DRM, requests for information, or its collection while playing Streets Of Rogue (as of 3/11/2017). It's hard to overemphasize just how much more fun I'm having with this game than I did Deus Ex Human Revolution (the game that convinced me to give up on Deus Ex as a series). Streets Of Rogue is a game that, in its current state and and along its apparent development trajectory, I very strongly recommend.

30459846.review:
For Early Access, it shows quite a bit of potential. The missions so far are really basic (kill x number of NPCs and/or retrieve x number of items), but the tight controls and freedom given to the player makes up for it. It also has a wacky sense of humor that, if fully realized with 100% complete levels and co-op, can keep players hooked for hours. Think Miami Heat meets a Saints Row approach to sandbox gameplay: the more creative and obsurd you play, the more fun you'll have.

HOWEVER, right now the game is probably 25% complete. Characters and items are locked, and there are only two levels with 3 stages each for a total of 6 stages available. There is a hint of a story present, but it barely gets out of the introduction. Plus, the NPCs have typical filler dialogue that breaks the immersion (although this could be a design choice).

Overall, it's hard to justify buying this at Early Access, but once it's completed, it'd be worth the $15.

30456093.review:
Played a bit of this on Free Weekend, and it's pretty damn good- So good it might actually be worth a purchase even in this state.

Currently the primary thing missing from the game are additional floors- There's planned to be 5 zones in the finished product (and presumably 3 levels per zone like we have currently), but as of yet there's only 2 zones.

However, what we have now is seriously so top-notch I really can't see a way this game could turn out badly from this point forward. Even if the rest of the zones are just carbon-copies of the others and don't offer much new, this game would still be decent. I'll illustrate this by describing a typical in-game scenario:

One of your "Missions" for the level is to rescue a prisoner from his cell. (The game is not a traditional "get to the exit/beat the boss" roguelite- To actually leave the level you need to resolve a set of random objectives) Here's a list of the ways you could do it:

[list]
[*] Insert cyanide (or any other poison item of your choice, provided it's strong enough) into the ventilation system to kill every guard in the building, and then proceed to get the keys and free the prisoner
[*] Cut one of the windows out and lockpick the cell door
[*] Blow open the wall
[*] Stab yourself with a syringe of invisibilty to walk right into the building and rescue the prisoner from there
[*] Break the door down and kill everything you see
[*] Consume a pill that temporarily turns you into a supersized giant, and then proceed to literally stomp the building to pieces
[/list]

That's probably the #1 strength of this roguelite- Choice. Generally the only different scenario approaches you get in roguelites is fight/flight or which combat playstyle you pick, but here you're given a massive array of different potential options and told to do what you want with them.

The massive variety of characters is also really amazing even at this early point in development: The Werewolf can become a combat god for 15 seconds, but that has a 20 second cooldown and makes him unable to do anything for 5 seconds after the ability runs out. The Cop can handcuff enemies from behind for a nonlethal elimination and is allied with other cops, but handcuffing/killing law-abiding citizens will give you heavy exp penalties. The Jock has huge levels of health and general strength, and can charge through walls, but is completely incapable of using computers. The large amount of characters (And the fact that this game already has mutators) gives it massive replay value already, and that's not even beginning to imagine what could come later.

Do I have complaints/nitpicks at this point in development? Well:

[list]
[*] IMO the Syringes aren't done quite right yet. They're the standard "Consumable item, and you don't know what it does when you first find it" trope in other roguelites, but IMO their effects at this stage are pretty underwhelming. Several of their effects can already be reproduced by other items obtained in similar ways (For example, Cocaine gives you the "Fast" effect you'd sometimes find in a Syringe, Steriods grants "Strength" ecetera), and I've yet to find one that grants more permanent effects, which if you ask me is a bit lacking. It'd be cool to find Syringes that do really weird stuff or have permanent stat changes. Or better yet, be able to make your own ;)

[*] This might just be because the game's currently quite short but I'm not personally feeling very much progression yet. Your character does level up, but the use of these levels is to get "Traits" at the end of the level, and while they are seriously awesome (eg. Wall's Worst Nightmare, that gives you a high chance, especially on critical hits, for knockback you inflict on enemies to physically slam them through walls, destroying the wall in the process) they don't do much for granting the feeling that you're growing stronger, at least for me. That might change as I play more, and the dev might not want the player to have access to things like higher HP values and so on, but IMO if the system's meant to give me the feeling like I'm significantly stronger at the end of the game than when I started, I'm not really feeling much of it.

[*] IMO, security systems are really quite weak ATM. You'd think automated turrets would feel like a significant threat, but they need seperate surveillance cameras to even see you, and both the camera and the turret can be smashed in like two hits- And floor traps like crushers and trapdoors are so small in their activation range that it's unlikely you'll step on one (I think a tripwrire would serve as a better trigger). While they do an alright job at setting off the alarm, when I'm playing a hacker and set an enemy's security systems against them, I'd expect pretty big rewards for doing that, but in my experience the enemy just punches out the turret before it can kill anything.

[*] In my experience, items like safe crackers aren't useful enough at the moment as just getting the safe combination is really easy in most cases. IMO safe combinations should sometimes come in 2-part chunks (Or even be in seperate buildings, with the building it's contained in revealed in a note on the safe), as just knocking out the shopkeep when nobody's looking and grabbing all his cash is about as easy as teleporting through the wall and cracking the safe, which probably shouldn't be the case.

[*] More nonlethal options are kind of a must currently- Your #1 source of nonlethal will be your character's ability (if it caters to nonlethal), and if you're lucky you'll have a tranq gun. IMO we should have things like chloroform canisters, gas grenades, tasers, and ecetera.
[/list]

However, pretty much all of that is solveable by more content- And if that's what this game gets, it'll be a seriously great game that stands out among other roguelites. And that's saying a lot, as this game has no shortage of competition.
