30455979.review:
This is one of those ideas that I'm amazed nobody had sooner. It's definitely a roguelike, but this game focuses on more completing mission objectives as opposed to just killing all the enemies in the room. The mission objectives can be completed any number of ways, lending the "Deus Ex" feel that the creators mention. 

Pros-

Tons of classes, each with distinctive stats and abilities

An equal amount of different ways to approach gameplay. You could do the missions and leave the level, or you could hunt down and kill every person on it. 

The actual gameplay itself feels good. It's super satisfying to throw someone through a wall or blast them all down with a shotgun

An infinite level generator once you beat the current content

Cons-

The current "campaign" is very short, with 2 different stages with 3 levels each. You can do a full run in an hour.

This means you're basically doing the same content over and over again

Price is a bit high

Overall, I'd recommend at least trying this game while it's free. I myself will admit I'm not planning on buying it until there's a bit more content at the 15 dollar price tag, but I'm definitely gonna keep an eye on it. I imagine they're setting it high because down the road this game will be worth at least 15 bucks, assuming the devs don't let this game stagnate. Personally, this has has the potential to be a fantastic game and I hope the devs keep at it!

Se habla de muchas empresas, que si Bugisoft, Hello Games (las dos para mal) o Psyonix (a pesar de que solo tenga un juego en Steam, pero qué juego y qué bien gestionado) pero poco se habla de tinyBuild. Juegos de calidad, distintos, buen soporte, los tira casi cualquier PC y económicos. Tienen muchas cosas que elegir, de carreras con Speedrunners a viajar entre dimensiones con No Time to Explain o destrozar fiestas en Party Hard. Pero la culminación ha llegado en este juego.
Streets of Rogue, un mundo procedural donde tienes que ir pasando misiones con distintos personajes para acabar con la tiranía del alcalde. Acción frenetica, si juegas así o sigilo si juegas asá. Es tu juego, ellos solo te ponen las bases. Cada planta es algo distinto, al pasar alguna planta te ofrecen algo distinto, es así. Y tiene su gradillo de dificultad, también dependiendo del personaje que te eligas. Compra asegurada en cuanto tenga unos centimillos sueltos.

[b]Wow, [i]Streets of Rogue[/i] really delivers.[/b] Outstanding title, and I didn't really expect it.

Now be warned though, as of 3/2017, there are only two levels with three floors each. So, if you are decent, I think you'll complete nearly everything within, oh I don't know, five hours.

[b]With that being said, there is a metric *ton* of detail and content and just overall fun to be had.[/b] For starters, this has got to have one of the best tutorials I've ever played in a game. Engaging, and that tricky little thing just greases all the wheels to get you sucked in. There are a ton of high points in other areas, too. The combat is flawless, and just oh-so fun. As with any good game, I always felt like it was probably my fault when I died. For a modern roguelite, I don't even find it all that difficult, which is fine by me. The music and art are crisp and fitting. The meta-game upgrades are great and will keep me coming back. Love the unlockable characters - they all feel so different.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Truly addicting
+Outstanding tutorial
+Controller support and overall menu stuff is flawless; this has a lot of polish
+Unlockable characters all feel great and different, and there is a ton of them
+Meta-game unlocks are always a welcome addition
+Gameplay is super smooth and really fun
+[b]The emergent gameplay is fantastic[/b]
+You can literally go about completing any given objective in probably half-a-dozen legit ways
+Tons of items that are all functionally really cool
+There are dailies
+I bet local co-op is a blast - 4 players?! Nuts

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Only two levels right now, but that will change

[b]This is a must have if you enjoy modern roguelites.[/b] I'd throw that soundtrack in the cart, too.

Streets of rogue a phenomenal game where you take to the streets to fight the oppressive mayor.  A dungeon crawler where you accomplish missions for a group called the resistance, you can steal, murder, or nonviolently pacify your enemies.  The streets of rogue are full of citizens, criminals, and police officers; some will be hostile toward your character based on the activities you participate in or areas you break into.  The dialogue of npcs in the game is nothing short of comedic.

The game does suffer from some bugs and expoits however it doesn't detract much from the overall quality of the game.  In short I would give the game [b]8.75/10[/b]

*Played this during the free weekend, will amend this review after I purchase it and play it more*

I first off want to say that I will be purchasing this game after the free weekend is over. I think this would make a very excellent live streaming series for my livestreams. So now that those things are out of the way...on to the review.

I don't leave many reviews because sometimes I let my streams speak for the game. This game however I wanted to see if I liked it before I threw the 14 bucks at the game to play it all the way through. There are more pros than cons to this. I love the easy tutorial. I understood the controls on my gamepad very quickly and the fact this has full controller support in early access is amazing because it makes it easier for me to grasp the controls. I love how each 'maze' in the level has missison that you have to complete, and the mutations make the game very funny yet challenging to me.

The only con I have for this is the multiplayer. I tried to invite a friend of mine to a game, and she was unable to connect to the game. So we tried it the opposite way, and still no connection. Overall....I am purchasing this game soon and I can't wait to see what this game has in store!

30451833.review:
Wow, I'm impressed. I played this during a free weekend and liked it so much I bought it. This here is a game with A LOT of a potential that does well with what it has. It's not even remotely done and it's still *very* interesting. I also see a lot of positive attributes in the development team and that makes me extremely optimistic as to the future of this game.

Gameplay is a free-roam hotline miami/river city ransom/GTA 2/roguelike. The roguelike park is not fleshed out yet; you can play an endless mode but players currently have no problem getting into the hundreds apparently. It's very early though and it is obvious he has plans for this. The gameplay is rad and satisfing regardless.

-The developer is endeering and focused. He is active and responsive on the steam discussion forum, is constantly working on the game, and he's very accepting of feedback. There's even a main menu function to submit feedback on the fly. This is a man that tries hard, works hard, and deserves that cash.

-Sound design is pretty solid. Music fits the game, although there needs to be more. The sound effects all sound good and satisfying.

-Graphicals are adequate - they don't impress or bother (the levels are procedurally generated: while the textures all look good, the level generation needs detail work. It is very functional, just needs more props and interactables)

I only have two formal complaints:
1. The banner art needs work (which has nothing to do with the game): http://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/512900/header.jpg?t=1489647124

2. I'm not even sure if this has anything to do with me buying this game, and it especially has nothing to do with the game itself, but ever since I bought, favorited, rated this game up, etc, my steam store keeps showing me every single pixel roguelike in the steam store and my god they are all just utter trash. How many do I have to "Not Interested"? Sorry games, you just don't compare to this one.

I cannot recommend this game enough. I want to see these guys flourish.

30451527.review:
AI、道具、可选角色是本游戏最核心的乐趣所在。
每种AI都有自己的行为模式：
警察会警告玩家不要破坏公物，但是你可以贿赂他们无视你的犯罪行为；
店主、酒保会把小偷赶走，对破坏他们财产的人更是拔枪就射；
红蓝两党见面就是死斗，遇见了同党的尸体，他们会四处寻找凶手；
打手被打到剩一丝血的时候，会大叫着不干了逃走，但被玩家追到墙角的时候会背水一战狠狠反击……
许多神奇道具都值得一试：
偷弹器把敌人的武器瞬间蒸发掉，即使是杀人机器人，没了火箭筒也只能任人宰割；
把有毒的针剂放进排风口，让防御重重的敌人失去抵抗能力；
麻痹陷阱、地雷、甚至香蕉皮，提前布置好（或者直接扔到对方脸上）这些陷阱都能在战斗中让你把握主动权；
还能用笛子把全图的人都吹成聋子，用电磁脉冲雷把设备都破坏掉，用全息影像引诱敌人的攻击，从容地完成任务。
玩家还能选择各种角色，利用他们的能力：
使用店主可以买走NPC身上大部分东西，可以先买走敌人的枪，再朝他们开火。
使用医生敲开平民的门，在他们转身的一瞬间迷晕他们，就可以为所欲为了。
使用大猩猩不断袭击各地的研究所，杀死科学家，救出同类，组成猩猩部队。
或者成为警察，逮捕罪犯，保卫和平，所有的警察都会是你忠诚的战友。

30448803.review:
Holy. Crap.

Bear in mind I've been playing this game since it's Itch.Io days, so the hours shown here are about twice as low as it should show, and that I'm not a guy who enjoys rogue likes at all.

With that said, this game is AMAZING. The amount of things you can do in it is beyond massive, and every session can feel different.

So basically, what is this game about? You play as one of around 6-8 available starting characters and you start climbing through randomly generated floors to (eventually, probably, and not in the alpha...ly) kill the corrupt mayor of your city. During each run, by performing rather easy tasks, you unlock characters, and earn chicken nuggets (a form of currency with which you'll be able to purchase traits that could possibly show up whenever you level up).

Gameplay: It's a top down brawler. You can get access to guns, flamethrowers, machine guns, shotguns and a variety of science weapons and melee weapons. Each character has it's own benefits, Gorillas, for example (and yes, you can play as gorillas), are very powerful and tanky, but can't use computers and speak to humans, Assassins, on the other hand, can become invisible and backstab, but have limited HP. Shapeshifters can steal NPCs bodies and use them against other NPC, however be warned, because if your NPC is killed while you're using it, you'll be thrown out and have a portion of your HP removed as well.

If the characters don't provide enough variety for you (and, like I mentioned, there are more available characters for use I haven't even mentioned), you may get a kick out of trying the random drops of loot and items, syringes, for example, may provide buffs, or debuffs, depending on the syringe  (which will most likely be unidentifiable for you unless you have special traitrs or identify wands). You can either inject them directly to yourself, polute the air ducts of a building with them, or with one of the crazy unlockable consumables (like shrink pellets, or rage bottles).

Even with all the possibilities I mentioned, it's hard to imagine the game is only in alpha, and includes both online and offline co-op, and in the future, more features will be added (Map seeds, Player-made mutators and your own custom character!)

I can't recommend this game enough, it's fantastic in it's current form (Although there are only 6 levels, highly replayable, though) and there are more things to be added on top of it.

Lovers of the roguelike genres will highly enjoy this game, even if it's a bit easier than most roguelikes (Which, in my book, is a benefit).

Took me about an hour to complete the content currently available. No I did not see all the weapons/items in general, but I got enough of the roguelike expierence in one playthrough to really enjoy the game. I feel the game is totally worth 15$, for someone who really enjoys this type of game. I can at least say I'm excited to see the full product, and very much look forward to picking it up eventually. 

I found the difficulty to be somewhat lacking, but I didn't see any immediate options to increase or lower it, though I'm 99% sure there is. 

My first two levels as the Slum Dweller was amusing. I really enjoy having to find items/weapons around the map to accomplish objectives. The maps are decent sized, and the style looks good. My first time bashing someone through a wall was one of thee most entertaining things. Everything else is icing on the cake. 
Having unlocked Harambe right away, I couldn't help but try him. Well Gorilla is a bit OP; I breezed through the game playing as them. 

Melee feels good, guns feel good, and stealth is rewarding. Particularly when you use a bat and bash a few guys through a wall, into another room full of guys who are just thinking..."What the fu.." before I smashed them as well.

Would smash guys through walls again. 8/10

Edit:
I was saddened to not be able to come home today and play this after the free weekend. Had to buy it.

8/10? Wrong. Excuse me, more like a 10/10. Bigly, it's uuge. Have you even seen the polls?

30445364.review:
I understand this game is early access. 
I understand Day 1 multiplayer issues.
I understand what a roguelike is. 
I understand the game is free right now. I thought I'd get that out the way before the inevitable influx of cry babies. 

The game is marketed as a co-op, shooter, brawler, stealth, roguelike RPG. The irony is this game is missing the one title that it ends up being - survival. And that is part of the game's identity crisis. The game gives you so many options that the execution suffers, mainly due to progressive RPG leveling with a punishing one-life-then-dead mechanic. This is like making a speedrunning stealth game. The two concepts don't work together. Whoever thinks spending an hour building up your character and arsenal to then randomly die to an invisible floor trap is a fun concept is being fooled by the game's free weekend. It's not fun at the game's current pacing, and I certainly wouldn't pay £10.99 for it. I've put hundreds of hours into games such as FTL and Rogue Legacy and it didn't feel nearly as deflating to die to randomness in those games, as you could generally get back to where you was within fifteen minutes. 

Bottom line: the pacing of Streets of Rogue is too slow. Which is baffling considering how action packed the trailers are. If you attempt any of the stuff in the trailers you'll be dead prompty, selecting a new character again, and the prospect of losing all that progression stifles your urge to go around causing mayhem. Higher health bars and more food pick ups would help, but it's not really addressing the problem. 

People are likening the game to Deus Ex, due to the amount of options available to you. But it's flawed. You can be a stealthy thief, but if you mess up you're punching people. You can be a soldier, but you only have a few bullets and then you're punching people. You can roll with a gang, but when your members die, you're just punching people. 99% of what you can do boils down to punching people, which makes most classes irrelevant after the first level, because you will inevitably test out all your perishable gear and then your class is just the same as all the others. Thus classes with melee bonuses end up being innately better (looking at you, Gorilla!). 

If this was a Beat Em Up, fair enough. But the game tries to be so many things that it falls flat in any one area, and all the cool strategies and ideas you think to try end up mashing the RT button after five minutes. 

There's no progression, only the illusion of progression. It's a roguelike. One death and you're back at the start. The game is probably a lot more fun with friends, but reviewing a game based on how fun the multiplayer is feels like a cop-out. Really bad games can be fun with friends, and the idea of having a few friends round with some pizza and punching shit in this game actually sounds like a blast! But the solo experience felt like treading on eggshells around everyone to avoid losing the character I'd built up, which goes counter-intuitive to a game that wants you to test things out. 

Bare in mind this review was written after an hour of solo play. But that's how long it took to feel like I was wasting my time.

30439241.review:
Theres plenty of good reviews out thers, so instead of a decent review, have this thought.

Remember when you were a kid trying to play your first games and you had tons of great ideas and such, then you realized because games arent reality, you cant do anything that comes to mind? "Daddy, why cant i move that barrel?" "Because its a game, sonny"

Yea, being a gamer can be depressing. Why cant I throw my gun at the enemy when im out of ammo? why cant I throw a gas grenade into a window? Why cant I lure someone to their door and tranquilize them? Why do these buildings have doors I cannot open?

And then this cheeky little game comes along, and if you play it expecting to be limited, you will quickly be amazed with all the things you CAN do, your creativity hits a fever pitch, you just hacked a security system and locked all the baddies in a base and pumped the vents with cyanide. You just snuck in and out of a factory to steal sensetive items without being seen. You just mowed the ever loving crap out of 20 baddies with a machinegun because YOU BLOODY CAN AND THE GAME DOESNT GET MAD AT YOU FOR IT!

And then at the end of the day, finally, you may realize that this game isnt one about finding what you CAN do, but rather is a game where its hard to find anything you cannot do.

30438766.review:
What a great game! 

For a while I was looking for a game that tested creativity without stumping the player.

In this game you go around each floor completing objectives or quests. There are many ways to approach each objective or quest and that's where the fun comes in. Will you run and gun your way through while taking mutiple enemies at once? Will you set up distractions and pick off the enemies one by one? Will you set your enemies against eachother and then go in at the end as a clean-up crew? Or will you just stealth your way through?

For a game in Alpha I can do nothing but reccomend it. The developer is active on his discord channel. Things this game has coming. 

Seeding - This is a Rogue Like game which means perma death. However with seeds you will be able to play the same world more than once. This also opens up oppurtunities for racing your friends.

Custom Characters - Streets of Rogue has many unlockable and playable characters to choose from. But in the future you will be able to create your own. 

Custom Mutators - Currently in order to spice the game up you can play with mutators, an extra set of rules that the game applies beforehand to each level. For example one of them makes it so the game runs at 1.3 speed making everything faster. Another makes it so everybody has rocket launchers! Custom mutators are on their way and then it's up to you to decide what happens.

More items - This game has a variety of items and gadgets. With more to come!

New levels - As of right now the game only has a small amount of levels and worlds. But the new ones will be added later and in the mean time there is a mutator that works as sort of a new game plus type deal.

This game is totaly worth the money it costs and it's not even close to being finished yet.

Also if you ever get bored playing alone...There is Local and Online Co-op!

30435733.review:
Had me at Deus Ex.


There is immense depth to the gameplay, this is an excellent example of the "emergent" gameplay design principle. There is an open world, that responds in a variety of logical ways to actions that happen within it, both the player and NPCs can act upon the world, there are many tools players and NPCs have access to and many actions they can choose take. On top of all that there are varied and interesting goals for the player to accomplish. It all adds up for unpredictable gameplay where the player is encouraged to experiment. Examples:

I had to kill a drug dealer, who was surrounded by powerful guards. So I bought a drug from the dealer that made me HUGE, took the drug, got HUGE and smashed my way through him and his guards. Not only did the guards and dealer get smashed, but I destroyed the entire building in the process. When that was done the drug hadn't worn off yet, so I smashed through the walls of another building to complete a different mission.

I had to assassinate a prisoner in a guarded complex. There was a window near his cell with an explosive trip wire. I threw a rock through the window, setting off the bomb, hurting my target and destroying the wall of his cell. While the wounded prisoner tried to escape a guard gunned him down, mission accomplished!

There are a great variety of characters you can choose to be which mixes up gameplay. You can be a gorilla who has massive strength but can't speak to NPCs. A hacker who is super weak but can hack any computer he wants. There's perks you can unlock and weapons and all sorts of things to mix up how you play.

The one downside is that there are only 6 levels. Randomly generated levels yes, but still only 6. The dev seems like a good guy and I expect the game has a very bright future. Oh and the game is pretty funny too!

It is great. Gives me the sense of flow I would get from a good Deus Ex session.
